instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides Accounts Payable release line details for equipment-related transactions (LineType 5 or LineType 6 with ItemType 5), enriched with concatenated equipment descriptions (EQ# + desc) and compone
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view APRLforWO
output:
SELECT
    APRL.APCo,
    APRL.VendorGroup,
    APRL.Vendor,
    APRL.InvId,
    APRL.Line,
    EMEM.EMCo,
    EMEM.Equipment,
    'EQ#: ' + CONVERT(VARCHAR(10), ISNULL(APRL.Equip, ''))
    + ' - ' + ISNULL(EMEM.Description, '') AS EQDesc,
    CONVERT(VARCHAR(10), ISNULL(APRL.CompType, '')) + ' - '
    + CONVERT(VARCHAR(10), ISNULL(APRL.Component, ''))
    + ' - ' + ( SELECT Description
FROM dbo.EMEM AS EMEM_1
WHERE APRL.EMCo = EMEM_1.EMCo
    AND APRL.Component = EMEM_1.Equipment
    )
    AS EQComp
FROM dbo.APRL
JOIN dbo.EMEM ON APRL.EMCo = EMEM.EMCo
    AND APRL.Equip = EMEM.Equipment
WHERE APRL.LineType = 5
    OR ( APRL.LineType = 6
    AND APRL.ItemType = 5
    );

instruction: Write a SQL query to: View exposing data from APRL.
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view APRLGrid
output:
SELECT
    TOP 100 percent APCo,
    VendorGroup,
    Vendor,
    InvId,
    Line,
    LineType,
    Description,
    UM,
    GrossAmt,
    MiscAmt,
    TaxAmt,
    Retainage,
    Discount,
    'Total'= GrossAmt+MiscAmt+TaxAmt
FROM APRL WITH (nolock)
ORDER BY APCo, VendorGroup, Vendor, InvId, Line;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view aggregates accounts payable line totals by company, vendor group, vendor, and invoice ID, providing summed gross amounts, combined freight/tax, retainage/discount, total payable, and net pay
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view APRLTotals
output:
SELECT
    TOP 100 percent APRL.APCo,
    VendorGroup,
    Vendor,
    InvId,
    'TotalGross'= sum(GrossAmt),
    'TotalFreightTax'= sum(MiscAmt + TaxAmt),
    'TotalRetgDisc' = sum(Retainage + Discount),
    'TotalPayable' = sum (GrossAmt + TaxAmt + MiscAmt),
    'TotalNetAmount' = sum ((GrossAmt + TaxAmt + MiscAmt) - (Retainage + Discount))
FROM dbo.APRL (nolock)
JOIN dbo.APCO (nolock) ON APRL.APCo=APCO.APCo
GROUP BY APRL.APCo, VendorGroup, Vendor, InvId
ORDER BY APRL.APCo, VendorGroup, Vendor, InvId;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides Accounts Payable batch transaction headers with aggregated detail-level current amounts, discount taken, and net amounts per transaction, alongside invoice details, gross, retainage, prior pa
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view APTBGrid
output:
SELECT
    TOP 100 percent APTB.Co,
    APTB.Mth,
    APTB.BatchId,
    APTB.BatchSeq,
    APTB.ExpMth,
    APTB.APTrans,
    APTB.APRef,
    APTB.Description,
    APTB.InvDate,
    APTB.Gross,
    APTB.Retainage,
    APTB.PrevPaid,
    APTB.PrevDisc,
    APTB.Balance,
    'DiscAmt' = sum(APDB.DiscTaken),
    'CurrentAmt' = sum(Amount),
    'NetAmt' = sum(Amount) - sum(APDB.DiscTaken)
FROM dbo.APTB (nolock)
JOIN dbo.APDB (nolock) ON APDB.Co = APTB.Co AND APDB.Mth = APTB.Mth AND APDB.BatchId = APTB.BatchId
    AND APDB.BatchSeq = APTB.BatchSeq AND APDB.APTrans = APTB.APTrans AND APDB.ExpMth = APTB.ExpMth
GROUP BY APTB.Co, APTB.Mth, APTB.BatchId, APTB.BatchSeq, APTB.ExpMth, APTB.APTrans, APTB.APRef,
    APTB.Description, APTB.InvDate, APTB.Gross, APTB.Retainage, APTB.PrevPaid, APTB.PrevDisc,
    APTB.Balance, APTB.DiscTaken
ORDER BY APTB.Co, APTB.Mth, APTB.BatchId, APTB.BatchSeq;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Aggregates AP detail records to batch-transaction level, providing summed discount taken, current amount, and net amount (current minus discount) per company, month, batch ID/sequence, expense month,
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view APTransTotals
output:
SELECT
    bAPTB.Co,
    bAPTB.Mth,
    bAPTB.BatchId,
    bAPTB.BatchSeq,
    bAPTB.ExpMth,
    bAPTB.APTrans,
    SUM(bAPDB.DiscTaken) AS DiscAmt,
    SUM(bAPDB.Amount) AS CurrentAmt,
    SUM(bAPDB.Amount) - SUM(bAPDB.DiscTaken) AS NetAmt
FROM dbo.bAPTB WITH (nolock)
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.bAPDB WITH (nolock) ON bAPDB.Co = bAPTB.Co AND
    bAPDB.Mth = bAPTB.Mth AND
    bAPDB.BatchId = bAPTB.BatchId AND
    bAPDB.BatchSeq = bAPTB.BatchSeq AND
    bAPDB.APTrans = bAPTB.APTrans AND
    bAPDB.ExpMth = bAPTB.ExpMth
GROUP BY bAPTB.Co, bAPTB.Mth, bAPTB.BatchId, bAPTB.BatchSeq, bAPTB.ExpMth, bAPTB.APTrans;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view extracts AP utility ledger lines filtered to equipment-related transactions (LineType 5 or LineType 6 with ItemType 5), joining to equipment master for details. It transforms raw equipment a
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view APULforWO
output:
SELECT
    APUL.APCo,
    APUL.UIMth,
    APUL.UISeq,
    APUL.Line,
    EMEM.EMCo,
    EMEM.Equipment,
    'EQ#: ' + CONVERT(VARCHAR(10), ISNULL(APUL.Equip, ''))
    + ' - ' + ISNULL(EMEM.Description, '') AS EQDesc,
    CONVERT(VARCHAR(10), ISNULL(APUL.CompType, '')) + ' - '
    + CONVERT(VARCHAR(10), ISNULL(APUL.Component, ''))
    + ' - ' + ( SELECT Description
FROM dbo.EMEM AS EMEM_1
WHERE APUL.EMCo = EMEM_1.EMCo
    AND APUL.Component = EMEM_1.Equipment
    )
    AS EQComp
FROM dbo.APUL
JOIN dbo.EMEM ON APUL.EMCo = EMEM.EMCo
    AND APUL.Equip = EMEM.Equipment
WHERE APUL.LineType = 5
    OR ( APUL.LineType = 6
    AND APUL.ItemType = 5
    );

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides line-level details for Accounts Payable utility transactions, capturing gross amounts, discounts, retainage, taxes, and miscellaneous charges with a computed total that includes miscellaneous
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view APULGrid
output:
SELECT
    TOP 100 percent APCo,
    UIMth,
    UISeq,
    Discount,
    Retainage,
    TaxAmt,
    MiscAmt,
    GrossAmt,
    UM,
    Description,
    LineType,
    Line,
    TaxType,
    MiscYN,
    'Total'= GrossAmt+(CASE MiscYN WHEN 'Y' THEN MiscAmt ELSE 0 END)
    + CASE TaxType WHEN 2 THEN 0 ELSE TaxAmt END
FROM APUL WITH (nolock)
ORDER BY APCo, UIMth, UISeq;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Aggregates approval workflow statistics for Accounts Payable transactions, counting unapproved, approved, rejected, mandatory, and optional reviewer actions per company, UI month/sequence/line/approva
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view APURApprovalStats
output:
SELECT
    APCo,
    UIMth,
    UISeq,
    Line,
    ApprovalSeq,
    SUM((CASE WHEN(ApprvdYN = 'N' AND Rejected = 'N') THEN 1 ELSE 0 END)) AS [TotalUnapproved],
    SUM((CASE WHEN(ApprvdYN = 'Y') THEN 1 ELSE 0 END)) AS [TotalApproved],
    SUM((CASE WHEN(Rejected = 'Y') THEN 1 ELSE 0 END)) AS [TotalRejected],
    SUM((CASE WHEN(OptionalReviewerYN = 'N' AND ApprvdYN = 'Y') THEN 1 ELSE 0 END)) AS [MandatoryApproved],
    SUM((CASE WHEN(OptionalReviewerYN = 'N') THEN 1 ELSE 0 END)) AS [TotalMandatory],
    COUNT(1) AS [SeqReviewerCount],
    SUM((CASE WHEN(OptionalReviewerYN = 'Y' AND ApprvdYN = 'N') THEN 1 ELSE 0 END)) AS [OptionalUnapprovedReviewerCount]
FROM dbo.APUR
WHERE Line <> -1
GROUP BY APCo,
    UIMth,
    UISeq,
    Line,
    ApprovalSeq;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view selects the most recent record (maximum KeyID) from the APUR table for each unique combination of APCo (company), Reviewer, UIMth (UI month), and UISeq (UI sequence), excluding detail lines
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view APURHdr
output:
SELECT [APUR].*
FROM [dbo].[APUR] WITH (NOLOCK)
JOIN (
    SELECT
    APCo ,
    Reviewer ,
    [UIMth],
    [UISeq],
    MAX(KeyID) AS KeyID
FROM [dbo].[APUR] WITH (NOLOCK)
WHERE Line <> -1
GROUP BY APCo ,
    UIMth ,
    Reviewer ,
    UISeq
    ) AS APURDistinct ON [APUR].[KeyID] = [APURDistinct].[KeyID]
    AND [APURDistinct].[APCo] = [APUR].[APCo]
    AND [APURDistinct].[Reviewer] = [APUR].[Reviewer]
    AND [APURDistinct].[UIMth] = [APUR].[UIMth]
    AND [APURDistinct].[UISeq] = [APUR].[UISeq]
WHERE [Line] <> -1;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view aggregates item-level additional information for unapproved Accounts Payable invoice reviews by company, invoice identifier (month/sequence), and reviewer, summarizing flags for up-level app
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view APURInvRevAdditionalInfo
output:
SELECT
    APCo,
    UIMth,
    UISeq,
    Reviewer,
    MAX(HeaderAllowUpLevelApproval) AS HeaderAllowUpLevelApproval,
    MAX(AllowUpLevelApproval) AS AllowUpLevelApproval,
    MAX(ApproveWithoutData) AS ApproveWithoutData,
    MAX(MissingData) AS MissingData,
    MIN(MissingData) AS AllLinesMissingData,
    MAX(MatchLowestApprovalSeq) AS MatchLowestApprovalSeq,
    MIN(LineRejected) AS LineRejected,
    MIN(OptionalApproved) AS OptionalApproved,
    SUM(ReviewerLineTotal) AS ReviewerTotal,
    CASE WHEN(SUM(CASE ApprvdYN WHEN 'Y' THEN 0 ELSE 1 END) = 0) THEN 'Y' ELSE 'N' END AS ApprvdYN,
    CASE WHEN(SUM(CASE Rejected WHEN 'Y' THEN 0 ELSE 1 END) = 0) THEN 'Y' ELSE 'N' END AS Rejected,
    (SELECT CASE WHEN(COUNT(DISTINCT isnull(RejReason,'')) = 1) THEN MAX(RejReason) ELSE '' END) AS RejReason,
    MIN(OptionalReviewerYN) AS OptionalReviewerYN,
    MAX(FilteredDisplayChecksYN) AS FilteredDisplayChecksYN,
    MAX(UnfilteredDisplayChecksYN) AS UnfilteredDisplayChecksYN,
    MAX(POSLWarning) AS POSLWarning
FROM APURInvRevItemAdditionalInfo
GROUP BY APCo, UIMth, UISeq, Reviewer;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view aggregates review outcomes for accounts payable unapproved invoices, determining per invoice and reviewer if all qualifying lines (Line <> -1) were approved (all ApprvdYN='Y'), rejected (all
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view APURRevAppRej
output:
SELECT
    DISTINCT
    APUI.APCo,
    APUI.UIMth,
    APUI.UISeq,
    APUR.Reviewer,
    'Approved' = (SELECT CASE WHEN (sum(CASE APUR.ApprvdYN WHEN 'Y' THEN 0 ELSE 1 END)= 0) THEN 'Y' ELSE 'N' END),
    'Rejected' = (SELECT CASE WHEN (sum(CASE APUR.Rejected WHEN 'Y' THEN 0 ELSE 1 END)= 0) THEN 'Y' ELSE 'N' END),
    'RejReason' = (SELECT CASE WHEN (count(DISTINCT isnull(APUR.RejReason,''))= 1) THEN max(APUR.RejReason) ELSE '' END)
FROM APUI
JOIN dbo.APUR ON APUI.APCo=APUR.APCo AND APUI.UIMth=APUR.UIMth AND APUI.UISeq=APUR.UISeq
WHERE APUR.Line <> -1
GROUP BY APUI.APCo,APUI.UIMth, APUI.UISeq,APUR.Reviewer;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Aggregates total reviewable invoice amounts (gross + applicable misc/tax - conditional discount) per reviewer for each unapproved AP invoice sequence.
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view APURRevTot
output:
SELECT
    DISTINCT
    APUI.APCo,
    APUI.UIMth,
    APUI.UISeq,
    APUR.Reviewer,
    'ReviewerTotal' = sum(GrossAmt + (CASE MiscYN WHEN 'Y' THEN MiscAmt ELSE 0 END)
    + CASE TaxType WHEN 2 THEN 0 ELSE TaxAmt END
    - (CASE NetAmtOpt WHEN 'Y' THEN Discount ELSE 0 END))
FROM APUI
JOIN APUL ON APUI.APCo=APUL.APCo AND APUI.UIMth=APUL.UIMth AND APUI.UISeq=APUL.UISeq
JOIN APUR ON APUR.APCo=APUL.APCo AND APUR.UIMth=APUL.UIMth AND APUR.UISeq=APUL.UISeq AND APUR.Line=APUL.Line
JOIN APCO ON APUI.APCo=APCO.APCo
GROUP BY APUI.APCo,APUI.UIMth, APUI.UISeq, APUR.Reviewer;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view identifies duplicate vendors within the same VendorGroup by self-joining the Vendor Master table on the DuplicateOf field, linking original vendors to their duplicates. It retrieves the orig
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view APVendorDuplicates
output:
SELECT
    bAPVM_1.VendorGroup VendorGroup,
    bAPVM_1.Vendor Vendor,
    bAPVM_2.Vendor DupeVendor,
    bAPVM_2.Name Name,
    bAPVM_2.Address Address,
    bAPVM_2.Address2 Address2,
    bAPVM_2.City City,
    bAPVM_2.State State,
    bAPVM_2.Zip Zip,
    bAPVM_2.POAddress POAddress,
    bAPVM_2.POCity POCity,
    bAPVM_2.POState POState,
    bAPVM_2.POZip POZip,
    bAPVM_2.LastInvDate LastInvDate,
    bAPVM_2.Phone Phone,
    bAPVM_2.EMail EMail
FROM dbo.bAPVM AS bAPVM_1
LEFT JOIN dbo.bAPVM AS bAPVM_2
ON bAPVM_1.VendorGroup = bAPVM_2.VendorGroup AND bAPVM_2.DuplicateOf = bAPVM_1.Vendor
WHERE bAPVM_2.Vendor IS NOT NULL;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view delivers a consolidated, deduplicated list of vendor groups, projects, vendors, and vendor names by unioning project-associated vendor data from subledger headers (SLHDPM) and purchase order
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view APVMforProjectSLandPO
output:
SELECT
    TOP (100) PERCENT VendorGroup,
    Project,
    Vendor,
    Name
FROM (SELECT SLHDPM.VendorGroup, SLHDPM.Project, SLHDPM.Vendor, APVM.Name
FROM dbo.SLHDPM
INNER JOIN dbo.APVM ON APVM.VendorGroup = SLHDPM.VendorGroup AND APVM.Vendor = SLHDPM.Vendor
    UNION
    SELECT POHDPM.VendorGroup, POHDPM.Project, POHDPM.Vendor, APVM.Name
FROM dbo.POHDPM
INNER JOIN dbo.APVM ON APVM.VendorGroup = POHDPM.VendorGroup AND APVM.Vendor = POHDPM.Vendor) AS APVM;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view aggregates Accounts Receivable transactions from ARMT to compute net customer amount due as total invoiced minus retainage minus paid, grouped by company, customer group, and customer. It pr
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view ARMTCustAmtDue
output:
SELECT
    TOP 100 percent 'vARCo' = ARCo,
    'vCustGroup' = CustGroup,
    'vCustomer' = Customer,
    'CustAmtDue' = (isnull(sum(Invoiced),0) - isnull(sum(Retainage),0) - isnull(sum(Paid),0))
FROM dbo.ARMT WITH (nolock)
GROUP BY ARCo, CustGroup, Customer
ORDER BY ARCo, CustGroup, Customer;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view sums open retainage and retainage tax from AR transaction lines applied to batch lines, filtered to transactions where the header's in-use batch ID mismatches the batch line or months differ
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view ARReleaseLineValues
output:
SELECT
    TOP 100 percent 'vCo' = ARBL.Co,
    'vMth' = ARBL.Mth,
    'vBatchId' = ARBL.BatchId,
    'vBatchSeq' = ARBL.BatchSeq,
    'vARLine' = ARBL.ARLine,
    'TransLine' = ARTL.ApplyLine,
    'LineOpenRetg' = IsNull(sum(ARTL.Retainage),0),
    'LineOpenRetgTax' = IsNull(sum(ARTL.RetgTax),0)
FROM dbo.ARTL (nolock)
JOIN dbo.ARTH (nolock) ON ARTL.ARCo = ARTH.ARCo AND ARTL.Mth = ARTH.Mth AND ARTL.ARTrans = ARTH.ARTrans
JOIN dbo.ARBL (nolock) ON ARBL.Co = ARTL.ARCo AND ARBL.ApplyMth = ARTL.ApplyMth AND ARBL.ApplyTrans = ARTL.ApplyTrans
    AND ARBL.ApplyLine = ARTL.ApplyLine
WHERE ARTL.ARCo = ARBL.Co AND ARTL.ApplyMth = ARBL.ApplyMth AND ARTL.ApplyTrans = ARBL.ApplyTrans
    AND (isnull(ARTH.InUseBatchID,0) <> ARBL.BatchId
    OR (isnull(ARTH.InUseBatchID,0) = ARBL.BatchId AND ARTH.Mth <> ARBL.Mth))
GROUP BY ARTL.ApplyLine,
    ARBL.Co, ARBL.Mth, ARBL.BatchId, ARBL.BatchSeq, ARBL.ARLine
ORDER BY ARTL.ApplyLine, ARBL.Co, ARBL.Mth, ARBL.BatchId, ARBL.BatchSeq, ARBL.ARLine;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view provides a unified lookup of non-computed target columns across BI views by unioning company-specific columns from headers (with hardcoded 'Company' description and -1 sequence) and standard
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view BITargetDDFILookup
output:
SELECT
    -1 AS Seq,
    ViewName AS ViewName,
    CoColumn AS ColumnName,
    'Company' AS [Description],
    Form AS [TargetType]
FROM DDFHShared
WHERE ViewName IS NOT NULL
    AND CoColumn IS NOT NULL
UNION ALL
SELECT Seq,

    ColumnName,
    [Description],

FROM DDFIShared
WHERE Computed = 'N'

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Combines approved AP transaction details with unapproved utility invoices into a unified cash requirements dataset, calculating net payable amounts for utilities as gross plus misc/tax minus retainage
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvAPCashReq
output:
SELECT
    APTH.APCo,
    APTH.Mth,
    APTH.APTrans,
    APTH.VendorGroup,
    APTH.Vendor,
    APTH.APRef,
    APTH.Description,
    APTH.InvDate,
    APTH.DiscDate,
    H_DueDate = APTH.DueDate,
    APTD.APLine,
    APTD.APSeq,
    APTD.PayType,
    APTD.PayCategory,
    APTD.Amount,
    APTD.DiscTaken,
    D_DueDate = APTD.DueDate,
    APTD.Status,
    APVM.SortName,
    V_Name = APVM.Name,
    HQCO.HQCo,
    HQ_Name = HQCO.Name,
    PT_Description = APPT.Description,
    Apprvd = 'Y'
FROM APTH
LEFT OUTER JOIN APTD
    ON APTH.APCo = APTD.APCo
    AND APTH.Mth = APTD.Mth
    AND APTH.APTrans = APTD.APTrans
JOIN APPT
    ON APTD.APCo = APPT.APCo
    AND APTD.PayType = APPT.PayType
LEFT OUTER JOIN APVM
    ON APTH.VendorGroup = APVM.VendorGroup
    AND APTH.Vendor = APVM.Vendor
JOIN HQCO
    ON APTH.APCo = HQCO.HQCo
    UNION
    SELECT APUI.APCo,
    APUI.UIMth,
    APUI.UISeq,
    APUI.VendorGroup,
    APUI.Vendor,
    APUI.APRef,
    APUI.Description,
    APUI.InvDate,
    APUI.DiscDate,
    APUI.DueDate,
    APUL.Line,
    '1',
    APUL.PayType,
    APUL.PayCategory,
    (APUL.GrossAmt+APUL.MiscAmt+APUL.TaxAmt-APUL.Retainage),
    APUL.Discount,
    APUI.DueDate,
    '9',
    APVM.SortName,
    V_Name = APVM.Name,
    HQCO.HQCo,
    HQ_Name = HQCO.Name,
    PT_Description = APPT.Description,
    'N'
FROM dbo.APUI
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.APUL
    ON APUI.APCo = APUL.APCo
    AND APUI.UIMth = APUL.UIMth
    AND APUI.UISeq = APUL.UISeq
JOIN APPT
    ON APUL.APCo = APPT.APCo
    AND APUL.PayType = APPT.PayType
LEFT OUTER JOIN APVM
    ON APUI.VendorGroup = APVM.VendorGroup
    AND APUI.Vendor = APVM.Vendor
JOIN HQCO
    ON APUI.APCo = HQCO.HQCo;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view consolidates open AP invoices by job from both approved transactions (APTH/APTD/APTL) and unapproved entries (bAPUI/bAPUL), including line-level job, scope, work order, and calc
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvAPOpenInvoicesByJob
output:
SELECT
    APTH.APCo,
    APTH.Mth,
    APTH.APTrans,
    APTH.VendorGroup,
    APTH.Vendor,
    APVM.SortName,
    APVM.Name,
    APTH.APRef,
    APTL.[Description],
    APTH.InvDate,
    APTD.APLine,
    APTD.PayType,
    APTL.JCCo,
    APTL.Job,
    APTD.[Status],
    APTD.Amount,
    UnapprovedYN = 'N',
    APTL.SMCo,
    APTL.SMWorkOrder,
    APTL.Scope
FROM dbo.APTH
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.APTD
    ON APTH.APCo = APTD.APCo
    AND APTH.Mth = APTD.Mth
    AND APTH.APTrans = APTD.APTrans
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.APTL
    ON APTH.APCo = APTL.APCo
    AND APTH.Mth = APTL.Mth
    AND APTH.APTrans = APTL.APTrans
    AND APTL.APLine = APTD.APLine
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.APVM
    ON APTH.VendorGroup = APVM.VendorGroup
    AND APTH.Vendor = APVM.Vendor
JOIN dbo.HQCO
    ON APTH.APCo = HQCO.HQCo
    UNION ALL
    SELECT bAPUI.APCo,
    bAPUI.UIMth,
    bAPUI.UISeq,
    bAPUI.VendorGroup,
    bAPUI.Vendor,
    APVM.SortName,
    APVM.Name,
    bAPUI.APRef,
    bAPUL.[Description],
    bAPUI.InvDate,
    bAPUL.Line,
    bAPUL.PayType,
    bAPUL.JCCo,
    bAPUL.Job,
    '9',
    (bAPUL.GrossAmt + bAPUL.MiscAmt + bAPUL.TaxAmt ),
    UnapprovedYN = 'Y',
    bAPUL.SMCo,
    bAPUL.SMWorkOrder,
    bAPUL.Scope
FROM dbo.bAPUI
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.bAPUL
    ON bAPUI.APCo = bAPUL.APCo
    AND bAPUI.UIMth = bAPUL.UIMth
    AND bAPUI.UISeq = bAPUL.UISeq
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.APVM
    ON bAPUI.VendorGroup = APVM.VendorGroup
    AND bAPUI.Vendor = APVM.Vendor
JOIN dbo.HQCO
    ON bAPUI.APCo = HQCO.HQCo;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view aggregates current payment amounts and discounts taken from AP payment details. It sums Amount as CurrentAmt and DiscTaken, grouped by company, processing month, batch identifie

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view aggregates total payable amounts from AP transaction details by company, month, and transaction, applying conditional exclusions for taxes on retainage payments. The sum adjusts
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvAPTotalAPTDAmt
output:
SELECT
    'APCo' = APTD.APCo,
    'Mth' = APTD.Mth,
    'APTrans' = APTD.APTrans,
    'APTDTotalAmt' = SUM
    (
    CASE
    WHEN APCO.TaxBasisNetRetgYN = 'Y' THEN
    (
    CASE
    WHEN APTD.PayCategory IS NULL THEN
    (
    CASE WHEN APTD.PayType = APCO.RetPayType THEN (APTD.Amount - APTD.TotTaxAmount) ELSE APTD.Amount END
    )
    ELSE
    (
    CASE WHEN APTD.PayType = APPC.RetPayType THEN (APTD.Amount - APTD.TotTaxAmount) ELSE APTD.Amount END
    )
    END
    )
    ELSE
    APTD.Amount
    END
    )
FROM dbo.APTD
JOIN dbo.APCO ON APCO.APCo = APTD.APCo
LEFT JOIN dbo.APPC ON APPC.APCo = APTD.APCo AND APPC.PayCategory = APTD.PayCategory
GROUP BY APTD.APCo, APTD.Mth, APTD.APTrans;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view combines current and historical AR batch header records for cash management (CM) distributions, marking current data (excluding deletes) with OldNew=1 and positive CreditAmt, wh
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvARBH_CMDist
output:
SELECT
    OldNew = 1,
    Co,
    Mth,
    BatchId,
    BatchSeq,
    TransType,
    ARTransType,
    ARTrans,
    CustGroup,
    Customer,
    CheckNo,
    "Description",
    TransDate,
    CheckDate,
    CMCo,
    CMAcct,
    CMDeposit,
    CreditAmt
FROM ARBH
WHERE TransType <> 'D'
    UNION ALL
    SELECT OldNew = 0,
    Co,
    Mth,
    BatchId,
    BatchSeq,
    TransType,
    ARTransType,
    ARTrans,
    CustGroup,
    Customer,
    oldCheckNo,
    oldDescription,
    oldTransDate,
    oldCheckDate,
    oldCMCo,
    oldCMAcct,
    oldCMDeposit,
    -1* oldCreditAmt
FROM ARBH
WHERE TransType <> 'A';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view retrieves maximum highest credit amounts for AR customers per company, customer group, and customer from the monthly AR tracking table. It calculates peaks over the current mont
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvARHighCredit
output:
SELECT DISTINCT
    ARMT.ARCo,
    ARMT.CustGroup,
    ARMT.Customer,
    HCCurrent=(SELECT Max(ARMT_1.HighestCredit)
FROM dbo.ARMT AS ARMT_1
WHERE ARMT_1.Mth = getdate()
    AND ARMT_1.ARCo=ARMT.ARCo AND ARMT_1.CustGroup=ARMT.CustGroup AND ARMT_1.Customer=ARMT.Customer),
    HC3M=(SELECT Max(ARMT_1.HighestCredit)
FROM dbo.ARMT AS ARMT_1
WHERE ARMT_1.Mth BETWEEN DATEADD(month, -3, getdate()) AND getdate()
    AND ARMT_1.ARCo=ARMT.ARCo AND ARMT_1.CustGroup=ARMT.CustGroup AND ARMT_1.Customer=ARMT.Customer),
    HC6M=(SELECT Max(ARMT_1.HighestCredit)
FROM dbo.ARMT AS ARMT_1
WHERE ARMT_1.Mth BETWEEN DATEADD(month, -6, getdate()) AND getdate()
    AND ARMT_1.ARCo=ARMT.ARCo AND ARMT_1.CustGroup=ARMT.CustGroup AND ARMT_1.Customer=ARMT.Customer),
    HC12M=(SELECT Max(ARMT_1.HighestCredit)
FROM dbo.ARMT AS ARMT_1
WHERE ARMT_1.Mth BETWEEN DATEADD(month, -12, getdate()) AND getdate()
    AND ARMT_1.ARCo=ARMT.ARCo AND ARMT_1.CustGroup=ARMT.CustGroup AND ARMT_1.Customer=ARMT.Customer),
    HCToDate=(SELECT Max(ARMT_1.HighestCredit)
FROM dbo.ARMT AS ARMT_1
WHERE ARMT_1.Mth <=GETDATE()
    AND ARMT_1.ARCo=ARMT.ARCo AND ARMT_1.CustGroup=ARMT.CustGroup AND ARMT_1.Customer=ARMT.Customer)
FROM ARMT;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Aggregates Accounts Receivable transaction lines by company, apply month, and apply transaction to compute total amounts, total retainage, maximum transaction month, and a flag for entries with both n
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvAROpenTrans
output:
SELECT
    ARTL.ARCo,
    ARTL.ApplyMth,
    ARTL.ApplyTrans,
    MaxMth=max(ARTL.Mth),
    Amount=sum(ARTL.Amount),
    Ret=sum(ARTL.Retainage),
    OpenYN=CASE WHEN Sum(ARTL.Amount) <> 0 AND Sum(ARTL.Retainage)<> 0 THEN 'Y' ELSE 'N' END
FROM ARTL
GROUP BY ARTL.ARCo, ARTL.ApplyMth, ARTL.ApplyTrans;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides tax details from AR customer payments (type 'P') matched to applied invoice taxes via apply keys. Shows paid tax amounts/discs alongside aggregated original invoice tax basis, amounts, and di
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvARReceivedTax
output:
SELECT
    ARTL_1.ARCo,
    ARTL_1.Mth,
    ARTL_1.TaxGroup,
    TL.TaxCode,
    ARTL_1.TaxAmount AS PaidTax,
    ARTL_1.TaxDisc AS PaidTaxDisc,
    TL.ApplyMth,
    TL.ApplyTrans,
    TL.ApplyLine,
    TL.ARTransType,
    TL.Invoice,
    TL.TransDate,
    TL.InvAmt,
    TL.TaxBasis,
    TL.InvTax,
    TL.InvTaxDisc
FROM dbo.ARTL AS ARTL_1 WITH (nolock)
JOIN ARTH WITH (nolock) ON ARTH.ARCo=ARTL_1.ARCo AND ARTH.Mth=ARTL_1.Mth AND ARTH.ARTrans=ARTL_1.ARTrans
JOIN (SELECT ARTL.ARCo,
    ARTL.ApplyMth,
    ARTL.ApplyTrans,
    ARTL.ApplyLine,
    max(CASE WHEN ARTH.ARTransType='I' THEN ARTL.TaxCode END) AS TaxCode,
    max(CASE WHEN ARTH.ARTransType='I' THEN ARTH.ARTransType END) AS ARTransType,
    max(CASE WHEN ARTH.ARTransType='I' THEN ARTH.Invoice END) AS Invoice,
    max(CASE WHEN ARTH.ARTransType='I' THEN ARTH.TransDate END) AS TransDate,
    sum(ARTL.Amount) AS InvAmt,
    sum(ARTL.TaxBasis) AS TaxBasis,
    sum(ARTL.TaxAmount) AS InvTax,
    sum(ARTL.TaxDisc) AS InvTaxDisc
FROM ARTL WITH (nolock)
JOIN ARTH WITH (nolock) ON ARTL.ARCo = ARTH.ARCo AND ARTL.Mth = ARTH.Mth AND ARTL.ARTrans = ARTH.ARTrans
WHERE ARTH.ARTransType<>'P'
GROUP BY ARTL.ARCo, ARTL.ApplyMth, ARTL.ApplyTrans, ARTL.ApplyLine) AS TL
ON TL.ARCo=ARTL_1.ARCo AND TL.ApplyMth=ARTL_1.ApplyMth AND TL.ApplyTrans=ARTL_1.ApplyTrans AND TL.ApplyLine=ARTL_1.ApplyLine
WHERE ARTH.ARTransType='P';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view recaps Accounts Receivable transaction lines by company, month, receipt type, and transaction type, pulling line amounts, retainage, GL accounts, invoice/contract details, and c
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvARRTRecap
output:
SELECT
    TOP 100 percent ARTL.ARCo,
    ARTL.Mth,
    ARTL.RecType,
    ARTH.ARTransType,
    ARTL.Amount,
    ARTL.Retainage,
    ARTL.ARLine,
    ARTH.ARTrans,
    ARTL.LineType,
    ARTH.Contract,
    ARTH.Invoice,
    ARRT.Description,
    ARRT.GLARAcct,
    ARRT.GLRetainAcct,
    ARCM.Customer,
    ARCM.Name,
    ARCM.SortName
FROM dbo.ARTL
JOIN dbo.ARRT ON ARTL.ARCo = ARRT.ARCo AND ARTL.RecType = ARRT.RecType
LEFT JOIN dbo.ARTH ON ARTL.ARCo = ARTH.ARCo AND ARTL.Mth = ARTH.Mth AND ARTL.ARTrans = ARTH.ARTrans
LEFT JOIN dbo.ARCM ON ARTH.CustGroup = ARCM.CustGroup AND ARTH.Customer = ARCM.Customer
GROUP BY ARTL.ARCo
, ARTL.Mth
, ARTL.RecType
, ARTH.ARTransType
, ARTL.Amount
, ARTL.Retainage
, ARTL.ARLine
, ARTH.ARTrans
, ARTL.LineType
, ARTH.Contract
, ARTH.Invoice
, ARRT.Description
, ARRT.GLARAcct
, ARRT.GLRetainAcct
, ARCM.Customer
, ARCM.Name
, ARCM.SortName
ORDER BY ARTL.ARCo, ARTL.Mth, ARTL.RecType, ARTH.ARTransType;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view queries SQL Server system catalog tables to provide a simple lookup of all column names mapped to their parent database objects such as tables or views. It enables quick identif
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvColumnLookup

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view unions general datatype security assignments (by datatype, qualifier, instance, and security group) with payroll employee security groups (mapped to the 'bEmployee' datatype usi
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvDatatypeSecurity
output:
SELECT
    vDDDT.Datatype,
    vDDDS.Qualifier,
    vDDDS.Instance,
    vDDDS.SecurityGroup,
    vDDSG.[Name],
    vDDSU.VPUserName,
    vDDSG.[Description],
    vDDDT.Description AS DatatypeDescription,
    'Security GROUP' AS GroupType
FROM dbo.vDDDS
JOIN dbo.vDDSU ON vDDSU.SecurityGroup = vDDDS.SecurityGroup
JOIN dbo.vDDSG ON vDDSG.SecurityGroup = vDDDS.SecurityGroup
JOIN dbo.vDDDT ON vDDDT.Datatype = vDDDS.Datatype
UNION ALL
SELECT vDDDT.Datatype AS Datatype,
    bPREH.PRCo AS Qualifier ,
    CONVERT(CHAR(30),bPREH.Employee) AS Instance ,
    bPRGS.PRGroup AS SecurityGroup,
    NULL AS [Name],
    bPRGS.VPUserName,
    NULL AS [Description],
    vDDDT.Description AS DatatypeDescription,
    'Payroll GROUP' AS GroupType
FROM dbo.bPREH
JOIN dbo.bPRGS ON bPRGS.PRGroup = bPREH.PRGroup AND bPRGS.PRCo = bPREH.PRCo
JOIN dbo.vDDDT ON vDDDT.Datatype = 'bEmployee';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Reports metadata on BI-prefixed indexes ('bi%') exclusively on base tables ('b%'), extracting module codes from table names, index details, column counts per index, and individual index column informa
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvDDIndexes
output:
SELECT
    SUBSTRING(o.name, 2, 2) AS module,
    CONVERT(VARCHAR(10), o.name) AS [objectname],
    CONVERT(VARCHAR(10), i.name) AS keyname,
    COUNT(k.column_id) OVER (PARTITION BY i.object_id,i.index_id) AS keycnt,
    COL_NAME(k.object_id, k.column_id) AS colname,
    k.column_id AS colid
FROM sys.objects o
LEFT JOIN sys.indexes i ON o.object_id = i.object_id
    AND i.name LIKE 'bi%'
LEFT JOIN sys.index_columns k ON i.object_id = k.object_id
    AND i.index_id = k.index_id
WHERE o.name LIKE 'b%'
    AND o.type = 'U';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view extracts column metadata including datatypes, table names, and column names specifically from base tables bCMAcct, bJob, bEmployee, bCompany, and bContract. It filters user tabl
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvDDSecureColumns
output:
SELECT ty.name AS Datatype, o.name AS TableName, c.name AS ColName
FROM sys.columns c
JOIN sys.objects o ON c.object_id = o.object_id
JOIN sys.types ty ON c.user_type_id = ty.user_type_id
WHERE o.type = 'U'
    AND ty.name IN ( 'bCMAcct', 'bJob', 'bEmployee', 'bCompany',
    'bContract' );

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view maps GL accounts for equipment depreciation expenses by department, pulling the primary depreciation account from master data and specific expense accounts from cost code and co
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvEMDeprExpAcct
output:
SELECT
    EMCO=EMDM.EMCo,
    Dept=EMDM.Department,
    GLCo=EMDM.GLCo,
    EMDM.DepreciationAcct,
    EMDOCostCode.CostCode,
    EMDGCostType.CostType,
    EMDOAcct=EMDOCostCode.GLAcct,
    EMDGAcct=EMDGCostType.GLAcct
FROM EMDM
LEFT JOIN (SELECT EMDO.EMCo, EMDO.Department, EMDO.CostCode, EMDO.EMGroup, EMDO.GLCo, EMDO.GLAcct
FROM EMDO
INNER JOIN EMCO ON EMDO.EMCo=EMCO.EMCo AND EMDO.EMGroup=EMCO.EMGroup AND EMCO.DeprCostCode=EMDO.CostCode) AS
    EMDOCostCode ON EMDOCostCode.EMCo=EMDM.EMCo AND EMDOCostCode.Department=EMDM.Department
LEFT JOIN (SELECT EMDG.EMCo, EMDG.Department, EMDG.CostType,EMDG.EMGroup,EMDG.GLCo, EMDG.GLAcct
FROM EMDG
INNER JOIN EMCO ON EMDG.EMCo=EMCO.EMCo AND EMDG.EMGroup=EMCO.EMGroup
    AND EMCO.DeprCostType=EMDG.CostType) AS
    EMDGCostType ON EMDGCostType.EMCo=EMDM.EMCo AND EMDGCostType.Department=EMDM.Department;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view joins equipment rate records (EMRR) with equipment master data (EMEM) to provide rate category details including revenue codes, work units, update meters, posting overrides, and
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvEMEqCatforEMTE
output:
SELECT
    EMRR.EMCo,
    EMRR.Category,
    EMRR.RevCode,
    EMRR.EMGroup,
    EMRR.WorkUM,
    EMRR.UpdtHrMeter,
    EMRR.PostWorkUnits,
    EMRR.AllowPostOride,
    EMRR.Rate,
    EMEM.Equipment,
    EMEM.Description
FROM EMRR
LEFT OUTER JOIN EMEM ON
    EMEM.EMCo = EMRR.EMCo AND
    EMEM.EMGroup = EMRR.EMGroup AND
    EMRR.Category = EMEM.Category
WHERE EMEM.Equipment IS NOT NULL;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view provides revenue billing rates, breakdown codes, and override indicators for equipment organized by category (Type 'C') or individual equipment (Type 'E'). For categories, it ag
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvEMEquipCategory
output:
SELECT
    EMEM.EMCo,
    EMEM.Equipment,
    Type='C',
    EquipRateOR = (SELECT count(*)
FROM EMBE
WHERE EMBE.RevCode=EMRR.RevCode AND EMBE.EMCo=EMEM.EMCo AND EMBE.Equipment=EMEM.Equipment),
    EMRR.RevCode,EMBG.RevBdownCode, EMBG.Rate,
    EMEM.Description,EMBG.EMGroup,EMBG.Category
FROM EMEM
LEFT OUTER JOIN EMRR ON EMEM.EMCo=EMRR.EMCo AND EMEM.Category=EMRR.Category
LEFT OUTER JOIN EMBG ON EMRR.EMCo=EMBG.EMCo AND EMRR.RevCode=EMBG.RevCode AND
    EMRR.Category=EMBG.Category
    UNION
    SELECT EMEM.EMCo, EMEM.Equipment, Type='E',1,EMRH.RevCode,EMBE.RevBdownCode, EMBE.Rate,
    EMEM.Description,EMRH.EMGroup,EMEM.Category
FROM EMEM
LEFT OUTER JOIN EMRH ON EMEM.EMCo=EMRH.EMCo AND EMEM.Equipment=EMRH.Equipment
LEFT OUTER JOIN EMBE ON EMRH.EMCo=EMBE.EMCo AND EMRH.RevCode=EMBE.RevCode AND
    EMRH.Equipment=EMBE.Equipment
WHERE EMRH.ORideRate='Y';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides standardized monthly cost transaction details for equipment and components from Equipment Management cost details, including units, dollars, cost types, sources, and actual dates. Uses UNION
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvEMEquipCompoCosts
output:
SELECT
    EMCD.EMCo,
    HQCO.HQCo,
    HQ_Name = HQCO.Name,
    EMCD.Mth,
    EMCD.EMTrans,
    EMCD.EMGroup,
    EMCD.Equipment,
    EQ_Description = EMEM_1.Description,
    Component = IsNull(EMCD.Component,''),
    CompDesc = EMEM_2.Description,
    EMCD.CostCode,
    EMCD.EMCostType,
    EMCD.ActualDate,
    EMCD.Source,
    EMCD.Units,
    EMCD.Dollars,
    RecType = 'E'
FROM EMCD
JOIN dbo.HQCO ON EMCD.EMCo = HQCO.HQCo
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.EMEM AS EMEM_1 ON EMCD.EMCo = EMEM_1.EMCo AND EMCD.Equipment = EMEM_1.Equipment
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.EMEM AS EMEM_2 ON EMCD.EMCo = EMEM_2.EMCo AND EMCD.Component = EMEM_2.Equipment
    UNION
    SELECT EMCD.EMCo,
    HQCO.HQCo,
    HQ_Name = HQCO.Name,
    EMCD.Mth,
    EMCD.EMTrans,
    EMCD.EMGroup,
    EMCD.Equipment,
    EQ_Description = EMEM_2.Description,
    EMCD.Component,
    CompDesc = EMEM_1.Description,
    EMCD.CostCode,
    EMCD.EMCostType,
    EMCD.ActualDate,
    EMCD.Source,
    EMCD.Units,
    EMCD.Dollars ,
    RecType = 'C'
FROM EMCD
JOIN dbo.HQCO ON EMCD.EMCo = HQCO.HQCo
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.EMEM AS EMEM_1 ON EMCD.EMCo = EMEM_1.EMCo AND EMCD.Component = EMEM_1.Equipment
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.EMEM AS EMEM_2 ON EMCD.EMCo = EMEM_2.EMCo AND EMCD.Equipment = EMEM_2.Equipment
WHERE Component IS NOT NULL;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides Equipment Management companies mapped to General Ledger companies with fiscal periods and years where the period month falls within the fiscal year's begin and end months. Enables alignment o
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvEMGLFiscalPeriods
output:
SELECT
    EMCO.EMCo,
    EMCO.GLCo,
    GLMth=GLFP.Mth,
    GLFP.FiscalPd,
    GLFP.FiscalYr,
    GLFY.BeginMth,
    GLFY.FYEMO
FROM EMCO
JOIN GLFP ON GLFP.GLCo=EMCO.GLCo
JOIN GLFY ON GLFY.GLCo=GLFP.GLCo AND GLFP.Mth BETWEEN GLFY.BeginMth AND GLFY.FYEMO;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides historical equipment location move transactions from the Equipment Management module, duplicating each record via UNION ALL to present data keyed by both destination job (ToJob/ToJCCo) and or
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvEMLocHistByJob
output:
SELECT
    EMCo,
    JCCo=ToJCCo,
    Job=ToJob,
    Month,
    Trans,
    BatchID,
    Equipment,
    FromJCCo,
    FromJob,
    ToJCCo,
    ToJob,
    FromLocation,
    ToLocation,
    DateIn,
    TimeIn,
    DateOut,
    TimeOut,
    Memo,
    EstOut,
    InUseBatchID
FROM EMLH
    UNION ALL
    SELECT EMCo, FromJCCo, FromJob, Month, Trans, BatchID, Equipment, FromJCCo, FromJob, ToJCCo, ToJob, FromLocation, ToLocation,
    DateIn, TimeIn, DateOut, TimeOut, Memo, EstOut, InUseBatchID
FROM EMLH;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Combines equipment meter readings from EMRD detail records with total hour meter data from brvEMMR into a unified structure by company, month/reading date, and equipment. Populates RD-specific current
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvEMMeterVsRevenue
output:
SELECT
    EMCo,
    Mth,
    Equipment,
    RD_HourReading = HourReading,
    RD_PrevHourReading = PreviousHourReading,
    MR_CurrentTotalHourMeter = 0,
    MR_PreviousTotalHourMeter=0
FROM dbo.EMRD WITH(nolock)
    UNION ALL
    SELECT EMCo, ReadingDateMth, Equipment, RD_HourReading=0, RD_PrevHourReading=0, CurrentTotalHourMeter, PreviousTotalHourMeter
FROM dbo.brvEMMR WITH(nolock);

instruction: Write a SQL query to: View exposing data from EMMR.
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvEMMR
output:
SELECT
    EMCo,
    Mth,
    EMTrans,
    BatchId,
    InUseBatchID,
    Source,
    Equipment,
    PostingDate,
    CAST(LEFT(CONVERT(CHAR(8), ReadingDate, 112), 6) + '01' AS datetime) AS ReadingDateMth,
    ReadingDate,
    PreviousHourMeter = CurrentHourMeter-[Hours],
    CurrentHourMeter,
    PreviousTotalHourMeter=CurrentTotalHourMeter-[Hours],
    CurrentTotalHourMeter,
    [Hours],
    PreviousOdometer=CurrentOdometer-Miles,
    CurrentOdometer,
    PreviousTotalOdometer=CurrentTotalOdometer-Miles,
    CurrentTotalOdometer,
    Miles
FROM dbo.EMMR WITH(nolock);

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view unions monthly equipment revenue data from EMAR (tagged '1R') with monthly equipment cost data from EMMC (tagged '2C') into a unified structure for reporting. Revenue includes a
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvEMMthCostRev
output:
SELECT
    Type= '1R',
    EMCo= EMAR.EMCo,
    EMGroup = EMAR.EMGroup,
    Equipment = EMAR.Equipment,
    Month = EMAR.Month,
    RevCode = EMAR.RevCode,
    RevAvailableHrs = EMAR.AvailableHrs,
    RevActualWorkUnits = EMAR.ActualWorkUnits,
    RevActTime = EMAR.Actual_Time,
    RevActAmt = EMAR.ActualAmt,
    CostCode = NULL,
    CostType = NULL,
    CostActUnits = NULL,
    CostActCost = NULL
FROM EMAR
    UNION ALL
    SELECT
    '2C',
    EMCo,
    EMGroup,
    Equipment,
    Month,
    NULL,
    NULL,
    NULL,
    NULL,
    NULL,
    CostCode,
    CostType ,
    ActUnits,
    ActCost
FROM EMMC;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view unions monthly equipment revenue from activity records, operational costs from maintenance records, and depreciation amounts from cost details into a standardized format with a
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvEMMthDeprCostRev
output:
SELECT
    Type='R',
    EMCo=EMAR.EMCo,
    EMGroup=EMAR.EMGroup,
    Equip=EMAR.Equipment,
    Mth=EMAR.Month,
    RevCode=EMAR.RevCode,
    CostCode=NULL,
    CostType=0,
    RevAvailableHrs=EMAR.AvailableHrs,
    RevActualWorkUnits=EMAR.ActualWorkUnits,
    RevActTime=EMAR.Actual_Time,
    RevActAmt=EMAR.ActualAmt,
    CostActualUnits=0,
    CostActCost=0,
    Asset=NULL,
    AmtTaken=0
FROM EMAR WITH (NOLOCK)
    UNION ALL
    SELECT 'C',EMMC.EMCo, EMMC.EMGroup,EMMC.Equipment, EMMC.Month,
    RevCode=NULL, EMMC.CostCode, EMMC.CostType, revAvailableHrs=0,
    RevActualWorkUnits=0, RevActTime=0, RevActAmt=0,
    CostActualUnits=EMMC.ActUnits, CostActCost=EMMC.ActCost, Asset=NULL, AmtTaken=0
FROM EMMC WITH (NOLOCK)
    UNION ALL
    SELECT 'D',EMCD.EMCo,EMCD.EMGroup, EMCD.Equipment,EMCD.Mth,
    RevCode=NULL, CostCode=NULL, CostType=0, RevAvailableHrs=0,
    RevActualWorkUnits=0, RevActTime=0, RevActAmt=0,
    CostActualUnits=0, CostActCost=0, Asset=EMCD.Asset, AmtTaken=EMCD.Dollars
FROM EMCD WITH (NOLOCK)
WHERE EMCD.EMTransType='Depn';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Combines payroll transaction headers with HR accident records into a unified employee-level dataset for reporting work periods and incidents. Uses UNION ALL to include standard payroll rows (null acci
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvEmpAcc
output:
SELECT
    PRTH.PRCo,
    PRTH.Employee,
    Date=PRTH.PREndDate,
    PRTH.PostDate,
    Accident=NULL,
    AccidentDate ='1/1/1950',
    Preventable=NULL,
    AccidentType=NULL,
    PRTH.Hours,
    PRTH.Job,
    PRTH.Crew,
    PRTH.Craft,
    PRTH.Class,
    PRTH.PaySeq,
    PRTH.PostSeq
FROM PRTH
    UNION ALL
    SELECT HRRM.PRCo, HRRM.PREmp, '1/1/1950', NULL, HRAT.Accident,HRAT.AccidentDate, HRAI.PreventableYN,
    HRAI.Type, NULL,NULL, PRCrew.Crew,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL
FROM HRRM
JOIN HRAI ON HRAI.HRCo=HRRM.HRCo AND HRAI.HRRef=HRRM.HRRef
JOIN HRAT ON HRAT.HRCo=HRAI.HRCo AND HRAT.Accident=HRAI.Accident
LEFT JOIN (SELECT PRTH.PRCo, PRTH.Employee, PRTH.PostDate, Crew=Min(PRTH.Crew), Job=Min(PRTH.Job)
FROM PRTH
GROUP BY PRTH.PRCo, PRTH.Employee, PRTH.PostDate) AS PRCrew
    ON PRCrew.PRCo=HRRM.PRCo AND HRRM.PREmp=PRCrew.Employee AND HRAT.AccidentDate=PRCrew.PostDate;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view consolidates Equipment Management revenue transactions from EMRD with linked document attachments, providing base records (Src='EM'), direct EM revenue attachments via HQAT/HQAI
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvEMRevAttachments
output:
SELECT
    Src='EM',
    EMRD.EMCo,
    EMRD.Mth,
    EMRD.Trans,
    EMRD.EMGroup,
    EMRD.Equipment,
    EMRD.RevCode,
    EMRD.TransType,
    EMRD.PostDate,
    EMRD.ActualDate,
    EMRD.Source,
    Type=NULL,
    EMRD.JCCo,
    EMRD.Job,
    EMRD.PhaseGroup,
    EMRD.JCPhase,
    EMRD.JCCostType,
    EMRD.PRCo,
    EMRD.Employee,
    EMRD.GLCo,
    EMRD.RevGLAcct,
    EMRD.ExpGLCo,
    EMRD.ExpGLAcct,
    EMRD.Memo,
    EMRD.UM,
    EMRD.WorkUnits,
    EMRD.TimeUM,
    EMRD.TimeUnits,
    EMRD.Dollars,
    EMRD.RevRate,
    UniqueAttchID=NULL,
    AttachmentID=NULL,
    HQATDescription=NULL,
    DocName=NULL
FROM EMRD
    UNION ALL
    SELECT DISTINCT Src='Rev', EMRD.EMCo, EMRD.Mth, EMRD.Trans, NULL, EMRD.Equipment, EMRD.RevCode,
    NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL, NULL,
    NULL,NULL,NULL, NULL, NULL,NULL, NULL,
    NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL, NULL,
    NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,
    EMRD.UniqueAttchID, HQAT.AttachmentID, HQAT.Description, HQAT.DocName
FROM EMRD
JOIN HQAT WITH (nolock) ON EMRD.UniqueAttchID=HQAT.UniqueAttchID
JOIN HQAI WITH (nolock) ON HQAI.AttachmentID=HQAT.AttachmentID
UNION ALL
SELECT DISTINCT Src='PR', EMRD.EMCo, EMRD.Mth, EMRD.Trans, EMRD.EMGroup, EMRD.Equipment, EMRD.RevCode,
    EMRD.TransType, EMRD.PostDate, EMRD.ActualDate, EMRD.Source, Type=c.Type,
    NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,
    NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL,
    NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,
    c.UniqueAttchID, HQAT.AttachmentID, HQAT.Description, HQAT.DocName
FROM EMRD
INNER JOIN (SELECT PRTH.PRCo, Equipment, Type,Phase, Date=CASE WHEN PRCO.JCIPostingDate = 'N' THEN PREndDate ELSE PostDate END,
    PRTH.UniqueAttchID
FROM PRTH
INNER JOIN PRCO ON PRTH.PRCo=PRCO.PRCo
WHERE PRTH.UniqueAttchID IS NOT NULL AND PRTH.Type = 'J') AS c
    ON EMRD.PRCo=c.PRCo AND EMRD.Equipment=c.Equipment AND c.Date=EMRD.ActualDate
JOIN HQAT WITH (nolock) ON c.UniqueAttchID=HQAT.UniqueAttchID;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view unions equipment monthly revenue breakdown records from headers and details (type 'A') with cost records from cost details mapped to revenue breakdown codes (type 'B'). It struc
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvEMRevBdownCost
output:
SELECT
    EMRB.EMCo,
    EMRB.EMGroup,
    EMRB.Equipment,
    EMRB.RevBdownCode,
    EMRB.RevCode,
    EMRB.Mth,
    EMRB.Trans,
    RevBAmount=EMRB.Amount,
    TimeUnits = EMRD.TimeUnits,
    WorkUnits = EMRD.WorkUnits,
    EMCostCode = '',
    EMCostType = 0,
    CostUnits = 0,
    CostDollars=0,
    Rectype = 'A'
FROM EMRB
JOIN EMRD ON EMRD.EMCo=EMRB.EMCo AND EMRD.Mth=EMRB.Mth AND EMRD.Trans=EMRB.Trans
    UNION ALL
    SELECT EMCD.EMCo,EMCD.EMGroup,EMCD.Equipment,EMCC.RevBdownCode,NULL,EMCD.Mth,EMCD.EMTrans,0,0,0,
    EMCD.CostCode,EMCD.EMCostType,EMCD.Units, EMCD.Dollars,'B'
FROM dbo.EMCD
INNER JOIN dbo.EMCC ON EMCD.EMGroup = EMCC.EMGroup AND EMCD.CostCode= EMCC.CostCode;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view unions monthly actual costs aggregated from EMMC with actual amounts aggregated from EMAR, both by company, equipment, and month, placing costs in one column and amounts in anot
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvEMRevCost
output:
SELECT
    EMMC.EMCo,
    EMMC.Equipment,
    EMMC.Month,
    ActCost= sum(EMMC.ActCost),
    ActualAmt=NULL
FROM EMMC
GROUP BY EMMC.EMCo, EMMC.Equipment, EMMC.Month
    UNION ALL
    SELECT EMAR.EMCo, EMAR.Equipment, EMAR.Month, ActCost=NULL, ActualAmt=sum(EMAR.ActualAmt)
FROM EMAR
GROUP BY EMAR.EMCo, EMAR.Equipment, EMAR.Month,EMAR.AvailableHrs,EMAR.Actual_Time;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view unions monthly aggregated actual costs from equipment cost records (EMMC) by company, group, equipment, cost code, and cost type with monthly aggregated actual revenues from equ
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvEMRevCostMthlDetail
output:
SELECT
    EMCo,
    EMGroup,
    Equipment,
    CostCode,
    CostType,
    RevCode=NULL,
    Month,
    ActCost= sum(ActCost),
    ActRevAmt=NULL,
    RecType = 2
FROM EMMC
GROUP BY EMCo, EMGroup,Equipment,CostCode,CostType,Month
    UNION ALL
    SELECT EMCo, EMGroup,Equipment, NULL,NULL,RevCode,Month, 0, sum(ActualAmt) ,RecType = 1
FROM EMAR
GROUP BY EMCo, EMGroup,Equipment, RevCode,Month;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view provides equipment management cost details enriched with hierarchical tax information, distinguishing base and local tax codes via links for multi-level taxes. It calculates the
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvEMTax
output:
SELECT
    HQCO.Name,
    EMCD.EMCo,
    EMCD.Mth,
    EMCD.EMTrans,
    EMCD.EMTransType,
    EMCD.Equipment,
    EMCD.Description,
    EMCD.TaxType,
    TaxCo = CASE WHEN EMCD.TaxType IN (1,3) THEN EMCD.APCo ELSE EMCD.GLCo END,
    EMCD.GLCo,
    EMCD.TaxBasis,
    EMCD.TaxAmount,
    EMDesc = EMEM.Description,
    EMCD.ActualDate,
    EMCD.APVendor,
    EMCD.APRef,
    BaseTaxCode=HQTX_1.TaxCode,
    BaseTaxDesc=HQTX_1.Description,
    LocalTaxCode=CASE HQTX_1.MultiLevel WHEN 'Y' THEN HQTX_2.TaxCode ELSE HQTX_1.TaxCode END,
    LocalTaxDesc=CASE HQTX_1.MultiLevel WHEN 'Y' THEN HQTX_2.Description ELSE HQTX_1.Description END,
    GLAcct=CASE HQTX_1.MultiLevel WHEN 'Y' THEN HQTX_2.GLAcct ELSE HQTX_1.GLAcct END,
    TaxRate=CASE HQTX_1.MultiLevel WHEN 'Y'
    THEN (CASE WHEN EMCD.ActualDate < isnull(HQTX_2.EffectiveDate,'12/31/2070') THEN
    isnull(HQTX_2.OldRate,0) ELSE isnull(HQTX_2.NewRate,0) END)
    ELSE
    (CASE WHEN EMCD.ActualDate < isnull(HQTX_1.EffectiveDate,'12/31/2070') THEN
    isnull(HQTX_1.OldRate,0) ELSE isnull(HQTX_1.NewRate,0) END)
    END
FROM dbo.EMCD
JOIN HQCO ON EMCD.EMCo=HQCO.HQCo
INNER JOIN EMEM ON EMEM.EMCo=EMCD.EMCo AND EMEM.Equipment=EMCD.Equipment
JOIN dbo.HQTX AS HQTX_1 ON HQTX_1.TaxGroup=EMCD.TaxGroup AND HQTX_1.TaxCode=EMCD.TaxCode
Full OUTER JOIN HQTL ON HQTL.TaxGroup = EMCD.TaxGroup AND HQTL.TaxCode = EMCD.TaxCode
Full OUTER JOIN dbo.HQTX AS HQTX_2 ON HQTX_2.TaxGroup = HQTL.TaxGroup AND HQTX_2.TaxCode = HQTL.TaxLink;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view aggregates counts of work orders by company, equipment maintenance group, equipment identifier, standard maintenance group, and standard maintenance item, filtering out final ('
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvEquipSTDMtnGrpItemWOCnt
output:
SELECT
    EMCo,
    EMWI.EMGroup,
    Equipment,
    StdMaintGroup,
    StdMaintItem,
    WOCount=Count(WorkOrder)
FROM dbo.EMWI
INNER JOIN dbo.EMWS ON EMWI.EMGroup = EMWS.EMGroup AND EMWI.StatusCode = EMWS.StatusCode
WHERE StatusType <> 'F' AND EMWI.StdMaintGroup IS NOT NULL AND StdMaintItem IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY EMCo,EMWI.EMGroup,Equipment,StdMaintGroup,StdMaintItem;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides original and current contract quantities, amounts, and unit prices for pay items linked to job phases, alongside estimated and actual cost details including units, hours, costs, and transacti
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvEstCostPayItem
output:
SELECT
    JCCI.JCCo,
    JCCI.Contract,
    ContDesc=JCCM.Description,
    JCJP.Item,
    ItemDesc=JCCI.Description,
    ItemUM=JCCI.UM,
    JCCI.OrigContractUnits,
    JCCI.OrigContractAmt,
    JCCI.OrigUnitPrice,
    CurrContUnits=JCID.ContractUnits,
    CurrContAmt=JCID.ContractAmt,
    CurrUnitPrice=JCID.UnitPrice,
    JCCD.CostTrans,
    JCCD.Mth,
    JCCD.JCTransType,
    JCCD.EstUnits,
    JCCD.EstHours,
    JCCD.EstCost,
    JCCD.PostedDate,
    JCCD.ActualDate,
    JCCD.ActualUnits,
    JCCD.ActualHours,
    JCCD.ActualCost,
    JCCH.ItemUnitFlag,
    JCCH.PhaseUnitFlag,
    JCCH.ActiveYN,
    JCCH.CostType
FROM dbo.JCCI
LEFT JOIN JCID ON JCID.JCCo=JCCI.JCCo AND JCID.Contract=JCCI.Contract AND JCID.Item=JCCI.Item
JOIN JCCM ON JCCM.JCCo=JCCI.JCCo AND JCCM.Contract=JCCI.Contract
LEFT JOIN JCJP ON JCJP.JCCo=JCCI.JCCo AND JCJP.Contract=JCCI.Contract AND
    JCJP.Item=JCCI.Item
LEFT JOIN JCCD ON JCCD.JCCo=JCJP.JCCo AND JCCD.Job=JCJP.Job AND JCCD.Phase=JCJP.Phase
JOIN JCCH ON JCCH.JCCo=JCCD.JCCo AND JCCH.Job=JCJP.Job AND JCCH.Phase=JCJP.Phase
    AND JCCH.CostType=JCCD.CostType;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Combines GL budget details with ledger net activity into a single structure differentiated by Type (1 for budgets with amounts by account/company/month/budget code; 2 for activity with net amounts). A
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvGLActtoBud
output:
SELECT
    GLBD.GLCo,
    Type=1,
    GLBD.GLAcct,
    GLBD.BudgetCode,
    GLBD.Mth,
    GLBD.BudgetAmt,
    NetActivity=NULL
FROM GLBD
    UNION ALL
    SELECT GLBL.GLCo,2, GLBL.GLAcct, NULL, GLBL.Mth, NULL, GLBL.NetActivity
FROM GLBL;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view delivers General Ledger budget details by account and month, transforming raw budget amounts into debit, credit, and net figures with beginning balances from fiscal years. It pu
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvGLBudget
output:
SELECT
    GLAC.*,
    SummaryDesc=isnull(GLAC_1.Description,GLAC.Description),
    SummaryActType=GLAC_1.AcctType,
    SummarySubType=GLAC_1.SubType,
    SummaryActive=GLAC_1.Active,
    SummaryNormBal=GLAC_1.NormBal,
    GLBD.Mth,
    Debit=CASE
    WHEN GLBD.BudgetAmt>0 THEN GLBD.BudgetAmt
    ELSE 0 END,
    Credit=CASE
    WHEN GLBD.BudgetAmt<0 THEN -GLBD.BudgetAmt
    ELSE 0 END,
    NetAmt=isnull(GLBD.BudgetAmt,0),
    GLBD.BudgetCode,
    GLFP.FiscalPd,
    GLFP.FiscalYr,
    GLYB.FYEMO,
    BeginBal=isnull(GLYB.BeginBal,0),
    brvGLFSPart2.Part2I,
    brvGLFSPart2.Part2IDesc,
    brvGLFSPart3.Part3I,
    brvGLFSPart3.Part3IDesc,
    "P1Desc"=GLPD_1.Description,
    "P2Desc"=GLPD_2.Description,
    "P3Desc"=GLPD_3.Description,
    "P4Desc"=GLPD_4.Description
FROM (GLAC
LEFT JOIN dbo.GLAC AS GLAC_1
    ON GLAC_1.GLCo=GLAC.GLCo AND GLAC_1.GLAcct=GLAC.SummaryAcct
LEFT JOIN dbo.GLBD ON GLBD.GLCo=GLAC.GLCo AND GLBD.GLAcct=GLAC.GLAcct
LEFT JOIN GLFP ON GLFP.GLCo=GLBD.GLCo AND GLFP.Mth=GLBD.Mth)
LEFT JOIN GLYB ON GLYB.GLCo=GLBD.GLCo AND GLYB.GLAcct=GLAC.GLAcct AND
    DATEPART(year,GLYB.FYEMO)=GLFP.FiscalYr
LEFT JOIN brvGLFSPart2 ON brvGLFSPart2.GLCo=GLAC.GLCo AND brvGLFSPart2.Part2I=GLAC.Part2
LEFT JOIN brvGLFSPart3 ON brvGLFSPart3.GLCo=GLAC.GLCo AND brvGLFSPart3.Part3I=GLAC.Part3
LEFT JOIN dbo.GLPD AS GLPD_1 ON GLPD_1.GLCo=GLAC.GLCo AND GLPD_1.PartNo=1
LEFT JOIN dbo.GLPD AS GLPD_2 ON GLPD_2.GLCo=GLAC.GLCo AND GLPD_2.PartNo=2
LEFT JOIN dbo.GLPD AS GLPD_3 ON GLPD_3.GLCo=GLAC.GLCo AND GLPD_3.PartNo=3
LEFT JOIN dbo.GLPD AS GLPD_4 ON GLPD_4.GLCo=GLAC.GLCo AND GLPD_4.PartNo=4;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: View exposing data from GLPI.
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvGLFSPart2
output:
SELECT
    GLCo,
    PartNo,
    "Part2I"=Instance,
    "Part2IDesc"=Description
FROM GLPI
WHERE PartNo=2;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides GL account details with summary account attributes, transaction-level debits/credits/net amounts split by month/fiscal period/year, beginning balances, and descriptions for account segments (
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvGLFSSum
output:
SELECT
    GLAC.*,
    SummaryDesc=isnull(GLAC_1.Description,GLAC.Description),
    SummaryActType=GLAC_1.AcctType,
    SummarySubType=GLAC_1.SubType,
    SummaryActive=GLAC_1.Active,
    SummaryNormBal=GLAC_1.NormBal,
    GLDT.Mth,
    GLDT.Adjust,
    GLDT.SourceCo,
    GLDT.Source,
    GLDT.Jrnl,
    GLDT.GLRef,
    Debit=CASE
    WHEN GLDT.Amount>0 THEN GLDT.Amount
    ELSE 0 END,
    Credit=CASE
    WHEN GLDT.Amount<0 THEN -GLDT.Amount
    ELSE 0 END,
    NetAmt=isnull(GLDT.Amount,0),
    GLDT.GLTrans,
    GLDT.ActDate,
    TransDesc=GLDT.Description,
    GLDT.BatchId,
    GLFP.FiscalPd,
    GLFP.FiscalYr,
    GLYB.FYEMO,
    BeginBal=isnull(GLYB.BeginBal,0),
    brvGLFSPart2.Part2I,
    brvGLFSPart2.Part2IDesc,
    brvGLFSPart3.Part3I,
    brvGLFSPart3.Part3IDesc,
    "P1Desc"=GLPD_1.Description,
    "P2Desc"=GLPD_2.Description,
    "P3Desc"=GLPD_3.Description,
    "P4Desc"=GLPD_4.Description
FROM (GLAC
LEFT JOIN dbo.GLAC AS GLAC_1
    ON GLAC_1.GLCo=GLAC.GLCo AND GLAC_1.GLAcct=GLAC.SummaryAcct
LEFT JOIN dbo.GLDT ON GLDT.GLCo=GLAC.GLCo AND GLDT.GLAcct=GLAC.GLAcct
LEFT JOIN GLFP ON GLFP.GLCo=GLDT.GLCo AND GLFP.Mth=GLDT.Mth)
LEFT JOIN GLYB ON GLYB.GLCo=GLDT.GLCo AND GLYB.GLAcct=GLAC.GLAcct AND
    DATEPART(year,GLYB.FYEMO)=GLFP.FiscalYr
LEFT JOIN brvGLFSPart2 ON brvGLFSPart2.GLCo=GLAC.GLCo AND brvGLFSPart2.Part2I=GLAC.Part2
LEFT JOIN brvGLFSPart3 ON brvGLFSPart3.GLCo=GLAC.GLCo AND brvGLFSPart3.Part3I=GLAC.Part3
LEFT JOIN dbo.GLPD AS GLPD_1 ON GLPD_1.GLCo=GLAC.GLCo AND GLPD_1.PartNo=1
LEFT JOIN dbo.GLPD AS GLPD_2 ON GLPD_2.GLCo=GLAC.GLCo AND GLPD_2.PartNo=2
LEFT JOIN dbo.GLPD AS GLPD_3 ON GLPD_3.GLCo=GLAC.GLCo AND GLPD_3.PartNo=3
LEFT JOIN dbo.GLPD AS GLPD_4 ON GLPD_4.GLCo=GLAC.GLCo AND GLPD_4.PartNo=4;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view parses HQAT audit trail records filtered for transaction-related entries (KeyField LIKE '%Trans%'), deriving TransType from the first two characters of FormName, TransMth as a d
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvHQATTrans
output:
SELECT
    HQCo,
    TransType=LEFT(FormName,2),
    TransMth=(CASE WHEN isdate(Substring(KeyField,charindex('Mth',KeyField)+5,8))=1
    THEN CONVERT(smalldatetime, Substring(KeyField,charindex('Mth',KeyField)+5,8)) ELSE NULL END),
    Trans=(CASE WHEN [dbo].[vfIsNumeric](Substring(KeyField,charindex('Trans',KeyField)+6,10))=1
    THEN CONVERT(int,Substring(KeyField,charindex('Trans',KeyField)+6,10)) ELSE 0 END),
    Description,
    AddedBy,
    AddDate,
    DocName
FROM dbo.HQAT
WHERE KeyField LIKE '%Trans%';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view unions audit trail details from HQ master audits and VPLog sources, capturing table name (as ViewName), record keys, company (default 0 for HQ-wide), record type, changed field,
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvHQAuditDetail
output:
SELECT
    ViewName = SUBSTRING(TableName, 2, 30),
    KeyString,
    Co = ISNULL(HQCO.HQCo, 0),
    RecType,
    FieldName,
    OldValue,
    NewValue,
    DateTime,
    UserName
FROM VPLog.vrptMasterAudit WITH(NOLOCK)
CROSS JOIN HQCO
WHERE Co IS NULL
    UNION ALL
    SELECT ViewName = SUBSTRING(TableName, 2, 30) ,
    KeyString ,
    Co ,
    RecType ,
    FieldName ,
    OldValue ,
    NewValue ,
    [LogDateTime] ,
    UserName
FROM VPLog.vVAMasterAudit WITH(NOLOCK)
WHERE Co IS NOT NULL
    UNION ALL
    SELECT ViewName = SUBSTRING(TableName, 2, 30) ,
    KeyString ,
    Co ,
    RecType ,
    FieldName ,
    OldValue ,
    NewValue ,
    DateTime ,
    UserName
FROM bHQMA WITH(NOLOCK)
WHERE Co IS NOT NULL;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view assembles recordable ('R') HR accidents of type 'O' (Other), linking employee details, company locations, incident specifics like fatality and OSHA location, and lost time days
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvHRAccident
output:
SELECT
    HQCO.Name,
    HQCO.City,
    HQCO.State,
    HQCO.Address,
    HQCO.Zip,
    HRATAccident = '',
    HRAISeq=0,
    LastName='',
    FirstName='',
    PositionCode='',
    JobTitle='',
    AccidentDate='12/1/2050 12:00:00AM',
    Fatality='',
    Days=0,
    HRALType='',
    HRRef=0,
    AccidentType='R',
    HRAIType='O',
    Location='',
    PRCo=0,
    HRAIAccident='',
    HRALSeq=0,
    HRALDaySeq=0,
    IllnessInjury='',
    IllnessType='',
    HQCo=HQCO.HQCo,
    OSHALocation=' ',
    IllnessInjuryDesc=''
FROM HQCO
INNER JOIN HRAT ON HRAT.HRCo=HQCO.HQCo
    UNION ALL
    SELECT HQCO.Name, HQCO.City, HQCO.State, HQCO.Address, HQCO.Zip,
    HRAT.Accident, HRAI.Seq, HRRM.LastName, HRRM.FirstName, HRRM.PositionCode,
    HRPC.JobTitle, HRAT.AccidentDate, HRAI.FatalityYN, HRAL.Days, HRAL.Type,
    HRRM.HRRef, HRAI.AccidentType, HRAI.Type,
    HRAT.Location, HRRM.PRCo, HRAI.Accident, HRAL.Seq, HRAL.DaySeq,
    HRAI.IllnessInjury, HRAI.IllnessType, HRAT.HRCo,
    HRAI.OSHALocation, HRAI.IllnessInjuryDesc
FROM HRRM
LEFT OUTER JOIN HRAI ON HRRM.HRCo=HRAI.HRCo AND HRRM.HRRef=HRAI.HRRef
LEFT OUTER JOIN HQCO ON HRRM.PRCo=HQCO.HQCo
LEFT OUTER JOIN HRPC ON HRRM.HRCo=HRPC.HRCo AND
    HRRM.PositionCode=HRPC.PositionCode
LEFT OUTER JOIN HRAT ON HRAI.HRCo=HRAT.HRCo AND
    HRAI.Accident=HRAT.Accident
LEFT OUTER JOIN HRAL ON HRAI.HRCo=HRAL.HRCo AND
    HRAI.Accident=HRAL.Accident AND HRAI.Seq=HRAL.Seq
WHERE HRAI.AccidentType='R' AND HRAI.Type='O';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view unions inventory allocations from manufacturing orders (INMI) with demand from active manufacturing sales quotes (MSQD joined to MSQH), standardizing fields like company, locati
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvINAllocInventory
output:
SELECT
    INCo,
    MO,
    MOItem,
    Loc,
    MatlGroup,
    Material,
    JCCo,
    Job,
    PhaseGroup,
    Phase,
    ReqDate,
    UM,
    isnull(dbo.bfINUMConv(INMI.MatlGroup,INMI.Material, INMI.INCo, INMI.Loc,
    INMI.UM),0) AS 'UM_Conv',
    OrderedUnits,
    ConfirmedUnits,
    RemainUnits,
    MSCo=NULL,
    MSQuote = NULL,
    MSQD_OrderUnits=0,
    MSQD_SoldUnits=0,
    Record='INMI'
FROM INMI
    UNION ALL
    SELECT MSQH.MSCo, NULL, NULL, MSQD.FromLoc, MSQD.MatlGroup, MSQD.Material,
    MSQH.JCCo, MSQH.Job, MSQD.PhaseGroup, MSQD.Phase,
    MSQD.ReqDate, MSQD.UM,
    isnull(dbo.bfINUMConv(MSQD.MatlGroup,MSQD.Material, MSQH.INCo, MSQD.FromLoc, MSQD.UM),0) AS 'UM_Conv',
    0,0, 0,
    MSQD.MSCo,MSQD.Quote,MSQD.OrderUnits, MSQD.SoldUnits,Record='MSQD'
FROM MSQD
JOIN MSQH ON MSQD.MSCo=MSQH.MSCo AND MSQD.Quote= MSQH.Quote
WHERE MSQD.Status = 1;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view unions unbilled Job Change Order Items from JCOI, showing their full contract amounts with zero billed, alongside Job Billing Item Summary records from JBIS that prorate total b
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvJBJCChangeOrders
output:
SELECT
    Sort=1,
    Company=JCOI.JCCo,
    JCOI.Contract,
    JCOI.Job,
    JCOI.Item,
    JCOI.ACO,
    JCOI.ACOItem,
    'BillMonth' = '1/1/1950',
    'BillNumber'= NULL,
    JCOI.ContractAmt,
    ChgOrderAmt = 0,
    Description,
    AmtBilled=0
FROM dbo.JCOI
UNION ALL
SELECT Sort=2, JBIS_1.JBCo, JBIS_1.Contract, JBIS_1.Job, JBIS_1.Item, JBIS_1.ACO, JBIS_1.ACOItem, JBIS_1.BillMonth, JBIS_1.BillNumber,
NULL, ChgOrderAmt=JBIS_1.ChgOrderAmt,NULL,
CAST(CASE WHEN JBIS_1.ChgOrderAmt = 0 OR a.TotAmtBilled = 0 OR a.TotChgOrderAmt = 0 THEN 0
    ELSE a.TotAmtBilled / (a.TotChgOrderAmt / JBIS_1.ChgOrderAmt)
    END AS decimal(12,2)) AS AmtBilled
FROM dbo.JBIS AS JBIS_1
CROSS apply (
    SELECT sum(AmtBilled) AS TotAmtBilled, sum(ChgOrderAmt) AS TotChgOrderAmt
FROM dbo.JBIS AS JBIS_1
WHERE JBIS_1.JBCo = JBIS_1.JBCo AND JBIS_1.BillMonth = JBIS_1.BillMonth AND JBIS_1.BillNumber = JBIS_1.BillNumber AND JBIS_1.Contract = JBIS_1.Contract AND JBIS_1.Item = JBIS_1.Item
) a;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view identifies discrepancies in Workers' Compensation (WC) retainage carryover within job billing items. It compares the previous WC retainage value recorded on a specific bill agai
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvJBPrevRetainUtil
output:
SELECT
    JBIT_1.JBCo,
    JBIT_1.BillMonth,
    JBIT_1.BillNumber,
    JBIT_1.Item,
    ThisBillsPrevWCRetg = min(JBIT_1.PrevWCRetg),
    TruePrevWCRetg = isnull(sum(JBIT_2.WCRetg),0),
    Diff = min(JBIT_1.PrevWCRetg) - isnull(sum(JBIT_2.WCRetg),0)
FROM dbo.JBIT AS JBIT_1
JOIN dbo.JBIT AS JBIT_2 ON JBIT_2.JBCo = JBIT_1.JBCo AND JBIT_2.Contract = JBIT_1.Contract AND JBIT_2.Item = JBIT_1.Item
WHERE isnull(JBIT_1.BillGroup,'') = isnull(JBIT_2.BillGroup,'') AND
    ((JBIT_2.BillMonth < JBIT_1.BillMonth) OR (JBIT_2.BillMonth = JBIT_1.BillMonth AND JBIT_2.BillNumber < JBIT_1.BillNumber))
GROUP BY JBIT_1.JBCo,JBIT_1.BillMonth, JBIT_1.BillNumber,JBIT_1.Item
HAVING (min(JBIT_1.PrevWCRetg) - isnull(sum(JBIT_2.WCRetg),0)) <> 0;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view identifies exceptions on the latest job billing invoice per contract where carried-forward previous retainage amounts on invoice item lines mismatch the actual summed retainage
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvJBRetainageException
output:
SELECT
    JBIT_1.JBCo,
    JBIT_1.Contract,
    JBIT_1.BillMonth,
    JBIT_1.BillNumber,
    JBIT_1.Item,
    ThisBillsPrevWCRetg = (min(JBIT_1.PrevWCRetg)+ min(JBIT_1.PrevRetgTax)),
    TruePrevWCRetg = isnull(sum(JBIT_2.WCRetg),0)+isnull(sum(JBIT_2.RetgTax),0),
    DiffPrevWCRetg = (min(JBIT_1.PrevWCRetg)+ min(JBIT_1.PrevRetgTax)) - (isnull(sum(JBIT_2.WCRetg),0)+isnull(sum(JBIT_2.RetgTax),0)),
    ThisBillsPrevSMRetg = min(JBIT_1.PrevSMRetg),
    TruePrevSMRetg = isnull(sum(JBIT_2.SMRetg),0),
    DiffPrevSMRetg = min(JBIT_1.PrevSMRetg) - isnull(sum(JBIT_2.SMRetg),0),
    ThisBillsPrevRelRetg = (min(JBIT_1.PrevRetgReleased) + min(JBIT_1.PrevRetgTaxRel)),
    TruePrevRelRetg = (isnull(sum(JBIT_2.RetgRel),0)+isnull(sum(JBIT_2.RetgTaxRel),0)),
    DiffPrevRelRetg = (min(JBIT_1.PrevRetgReleased)++ min(JBIT_1.PrevRetgTaxRel)) - (isnull(sum(JBIT_2.RetgRel),0) +isnull(sum(JBIT_2.RetgTaxRel),0))
FROM dbo.JBIT AS JBIT_1
JOIN dbo.JBIT AS JBIT_2 ON JBIT_2.JBCo = JBIT_1.JBCo AND JBIT_2.Contract = JBIT_1.Contract AND JBIT_2.Item = JBIT_1.Item
    AND ((JBIT_2.BillMonth < JBIT_1.BillMonth) OR (JBIT_2.BillMonth = JBIT_1.BillMonth AND JBIT_2.BillNumber < JBIT_1.BillNumber))
JOIN (SELECT JBCo, Contract, BillMonth=max(BillMonth)
FROM JBIN
GROUP BY JBCo, Contract) AS JBIN1
    ON JBIN1.JBCo = JBIT_1.JBCo AND JBIN1.Contract = JBIT_1.Contract
    AND JBIT_1.BillMonth=JBIN1.BillMonth
JOIN (SELECT JBCo, Contract, BillMonth=BillMonth , BillNumber=max(BillNumber)
FROM JBIN
GROUP BY JBCo, Contract, BillMonth) AS JBIN2
    ON JBIN2.JBCo = JBIT_1.JBCo AND JBIN2.Contract = JBIT_1.Contract
    AND JBIT_1.BillMonth=JBIN2.BillMonth AND JBIT_1.BillNumber=JBIN2.BillNumber
GROUP BY JBIT_1.JBCo, JBIT_1.Contract, JBIT_1.BillMonth, JBIT_1.BillNumber, JBIT_1.Item
HAVING ((min(JBIT_1.PrevWCRetg) - isnull(sum(JBIT_2.WCRetg),0)) <> 0
    OR (min(JBIT_1.PrevSMRetg) - isnull(sum(JBIT_2.SMRetg),0)) <> 0
    OR (min(JBIT_1.PrevRetgReleased) - isnull(sum(JBIT_2.RetgRel),0)) <> 0);

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view derives effective tax rates for job billing invoices by resolving direct or multi-level tax assignments via tax links. It conditionally selects tax group/code from primary or li
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvJBTaxRate
output:
SELECT
    JBIL.JBCo,
    TaxGroup=CASE HQTX_1.MultiLevel WHEN 'Y' THEN HQTX_2.TaxGroup ELSE HQTX_1.TaxGroup END,
    TaxCode=CASE HQTX_1.MultiLevel WHEN 'Y' THEN HQTX_2.TaxCode ELSE HQTX_1.TaxCode END,
    TaxRate=CASE HQTX_1.MultiLevel WHEN 'Y'
    THEN (CASE WHEN JBIN.InvDate < isnull(HQTX_2.EffectiveDate,'12/31/2070') THEN
    isnull(HQTX_2.OldRate,0) ELSE isnull(HQTX_2.NewRate,0) END)
    ELSE
    (CASE WHEN JBIN.InvDate < isnull(HQTX_1.EffectiveDate,'12/31/2070') THEN
    isnull(HQTX_1.OldRate,0) ELSE isnull(HQTX_1.NewRate,0) END)
    END
FROM JBIL
JOIN JBIN ON JBIL.JBCo=JBIN.JBCo AND JBIL.BillMonth=JBIN.BillMonth AND JBIL.BillNumber=JBIN.BillNumber
JOIN dbo.HQTX AS HQTX_1 ON HQTX_1.TaxGroup=JBIL.TaxGroup AND HQTX_1.TaxCode=JBIL.TaxCode
Full OUTER JOIN HQTL ON
    HQTL.TaxGroup = JBIL.TaxGroup AND HQTL.TaxCode = JBIL.TaxCode
Full OUTER JOIN dbo.HQTX AS HQTX_2 ON HQTX_2.TaxGroup = HQTL.TaxGroup AND HQTX_2.TaxCode = HQTL.TaxLink;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view consolidates job billing template data by unioning core template records from JBTCwith details like phase groups, cost types, billing flags (AP/EM/IN/JC/MS/PR), categories, lia

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view aggregates the maximum ACO value per company, contract, item, and month from JCID records where ACO exists, filtering out nulls via GROUP BY and MAX. It provides summarized ACO
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvJCACO

    Item,

    ACO=MAX(ACO)
FROM JCID

GROUP BY JCCo, Contract, Item, Mth;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view provides all fields from the Job Cost Contract Master table, augmented with a security indicator for job-related data via a left join to the shared data dictionary. It enables s
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvJCCMDet

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Batch report view consolidating job cost details and contract items by company, contract, and item within jobs and ACOs. Merges estimated units, hours, and costs from cost details with contract units,
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvJCCObyContractItem
output:
SELECT
    JCOD.JCCo,
    JCOI.Contract,
    JCOI.Item,
    JCOD.Job,
    JCOD.ACO,
    JCOD.ACOItem,
    JCOI.Description,

    JCOD.CostType,
    UM,
    JCOI.ApprovedMonth,
    EstUnits,
    EstHours,
    EstCost,
    ContractUnits = NULL,

    UNION ALL
    SELECT JCOI.JCCo,JCOI.Contract,JCOI.Item,JCOI.Job,JCOI.ACO,ACOItem,JCOI.Description,ACOSequence = NULL,Phase = NULL,CostType = NULL,UM = NULL,ApprovedMonth,EstUnits = NULL,EstHours = NULL,EstCost = NULL,ContractUnits,ContUnitPrice,ContractAmt, ViewName = 'JCOI'FROM JCOI
INNER JOIN JCOH ON JCOI.JCCo = JCOH.JCCo AND JCOI.Job = JCOH.Job AND JCOI.ACO = JCOH.ACO AND JCOH.Contract = JCOI.Contract;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view links each contract to its minimum (earliest) associated job number and pulls key attributes from that job, including vendor group, architect/engineer firm, architect contact, a
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvJCContrMinJob
output:
SELECT
    JCCM.JCCo,
    JCCM.Contract,
    VendorGroup = JCJM_1.VendorGroup,
    ArchEngFirm = JCJM_1.ArchEngFirm,
    JCJM_1.ContactCode AS ArchContact,
    Job = b.MinJob,
    JCJM_1.ProjectMgr
FROM dbo.JCCM WITH (NOLOCK)
LEFT JOIN (SELECT JCCo, Contract, MinJob=Min(Job)
FROM JCJM WITH (NoLock)
GROUP BY JCCo, Contract) AS b
    ON JCCM.JCCo = b.JCCo
    AND JCCM.Contract = b.Contract
LEFT JOIN dbo.JCJM AS JCJM_1 ON JCJM_1.JCCo=b.JCCo AND JCJM_1.Job=b.MinJob;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view unions original job cost estimates from JCOD (with ACO and ACOItem details) and current/actual job costs from JCCP by company, job, phase group, phase, and cost type. It isolate
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvJCCostbyCTforACOI
output:
SELECT
    JCCo,
    Job,
    ACO,
    ACOItem,
    PhaseGroup,
    Phase,
    CostType,
    MonthAdded,
    EstCost,
    CurrEstCost=NULL,
    ActualCost=NULL
FROM JCOD
    UNION ALL
    SELECT JCCo, Job, NULL, NULL, PhaseGroup, Phase, CostType, Mth, NULL, CurrEstCost,ActualCost
FROM JCCP;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view unions contract item revenue data (original/current amounts, units, billed/received) with job phase cost data (original/current estimates, actuals, projections for hours/units/c
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvJCCostRevDrill
output:
SELECT
    JCIP.JCCo,
    JCIP.Contract,
    JCIP.Item,
    Job=NULL,
    PhaseGroup=NULL,
    Phase=NULL,
    CostType=NULL,
    OrigContractAmt=JCIP.OrigContractAmt,
    OrigContractUnits=JCIP.OrigContractUnits,
    OrigUnitPrice=JCIP.OrigUnitPrice,
    CurrContractAmt=JCIP.ContractAmt,
    CurrContractUnits=JCIP.ContractUnits,
    CurrUnitPrice=JCIP.CurrentUnitPrice,
    BilledAmt=JCIP.BilledAmt,
    BilledUnits=JCIP.BilledUnits,
    ReceivedAmt=JCIP.ReceivedAmt,
    OrigEstHours=0,
    OrigEstUnits=0,
    OrigEstCost=0,
    CurrEstHours=0,
    CurrEstUnits=0,
    CurrEstCost=0,
    ActualHours=0,
    ActualUnits=0,
    ActualCost=0,
    Mth=JCIP.Mth,
    ProjHours=0,
    ProjUnits=0,
    ProjCost=0,
    PhaseDesc=NULL
FROM JCIP WITH(nolock)
    UNION ALL
    SELECT JCJP.JCCo, JCJP.Contract, JCJP.Item, Job=JCCP.Job, PhaseGroup=JCJP.PhaseGroup,
    Phase=JCJP.Phase, CostType=JCCP.CostType,
    OrigContractAmt=0,
    OrigContractUnits=0, OrigUnitPrice=0, CurrContractAmt=0, CurrContractUnits=0,
    CurrUnitPrice=0, BilledAmt=0, BilledUnits=0, ReceivedAmt=0,
    OrigEstHours=JCCP.OrigEstHours,
    OrigEstUnits=JCCP.OrigEstUnits,
    OrigEstCost=JCCP.OrigEstCost, CurrEstHours=JCCP.CurrEstHours, CurrEstUnits=JCCP.CurrEstUnits,
    CurrEstCost=JCCP.CurrEstCost,
    ActualHours=JCCP.ActualHours, ActualUnits=JCCP.ActualUnits,
    JCCP.ActualCost, Mth=JCCP.Mth,
    ProjHours=JCCP.ProjHours,
    ProjUnits=JCCP.ProjUnits,
    ProjCost=JCCP.ProjCost,
    PhaseDesc=JCJP.Description
FROM JCCP WITH(nolock)
JOIN JCJP WITH(nolock) ON JCJP.JCCo=JCCP.JCCo AND JCJP.Job=JCCP.Job AND JCJP.Phase=JCCP.Phase
    AND JCJP.PhaseGroup=JCCP.PhaseGroup;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view aggregates revenue metrics like original/current contract amounts, billed/received amounts alongside cost metrics including actual costs, original/current estimated costs, and t
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvJCCostRevenueCustom
output:
SELECT
    JCCo,
    Contract,
    Sum(OrigContractAmt) AS OrigContractAmt,
    sum(ContractAmt) AS ContractAmt,
    SUM(BilledAmt) AS BilledAmt,
    sum(ReceivedAmt) AS ReceivedAmt,
    sum(ActualCost) AS ActualCost,
    sum(OrigEstCost) AS OrigEstCost,
    sum(CurrEstCost) AS CurrEstCost,
    sum(TotalCmtdCost) AS TotalCmtdCost,
    sum(RemainCmtdCost) AS RemainCmtdCost,
    sum(ContractAmt)-SUM(CurrEstCost) AS [Profit],
    CASE WHEN sum(ContractAmt) = 0 THEN 0 ELSE ((SUM(ContractAmt)-SUM(CurrEstCost))/SUM(ContractAmt))*100 END AS GMP
FROM brvJCCostRevenue
GROUP BY JCCo, Contract;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Summarizes job contract revenue including original/current amounts, billed/received payments, actual/estimated/committed costs, profit, and GMP with categorical profit levels (loss, 0-3%, 3-6%, >6%) d
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvJCCostRevenueCustom2
output:
SELECT
    brvJCCostRevenueCustom.JCCo,
    JCCM.Department,
    JCJM.Job AS [Contract],
    JCJM.ProjectMgr,
    brvJCCostRevenueCustom.OrigContractAmt,
    brvJCCostRevenueCustom.ContractAmt,
    brvJCCostRevenueCustom.BilledAmt,
    brvJCCostRevenueCustom.ReceivedAmt,
    brvJCCostRevenueCustom.ActualCost,
    brvJCCostRevenueCustom.OrigEstCost,
    brvJCCostRevenueCustom.CurrEstCost,
    brvJCCostRevenueCustom.TotalCmtdCost,
    brvJCCostRevenueCustom.RemainCmtdCost,
    brvJCCostRevenueCustom.Profit,
    brvJCCostRevenueCustom.GMP,
    CASE WHEN GMP < 0 THEN 'GPM Loss '
WHEN GMP >= 0 AND GMP < 3 THEN 'GPM 0-3%'
WHEN GMP >= 3 AND GMP < 6 THEN 'GPM 3-6%'
WHEN GMP >= 6 THEN 'GPM > 6%'
END AS [Profitlevel]
FROM brvJCCostRevenueCustom
LEFT OUTER JOIN JCCM ON JCCM.JCCo=brvJCCostRevenueCustom.JCCo AND JCCM.Contract=brvJCCostRevenueCustom.Contract
LEFT OUTER JOIN JCJM ON JCJM.JCCo=brvJCCostRevenueCustom.JCCo AND JCJM.Contract=brvJCCostRevenueCustom.Contract
LEFT OUTER JOIN JCMP ON JCMP.JCCo=JCJM.JCCo AND JCMP.ProjectMgr=JCJM.ProjectMgr;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Combines monthly cost period summaries from JCCP with daily cost detail transactions from JCCD for job phases and cost types, standardizing fields like record type, months, dates, and placeholders for
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvJCDailyCost
output:
SELECT
    JCCP.JCCo,
    JCCP.Job,
    JCCP.Phase,
    JCCP.CostType,
    RecordType='CP',
    JCCH.UM,
    PhaseUnitFlag,
    CPMonth=JCCP.Mth,
    CDMonth='1/1/1950',
    CostTrans=0,
    ActualDate='12/31/2050',
    PostedDate='12/31/2050',
    JCCP.ActualHours,
    JCCP.ActualUnits,
    JCCP.ActualCost,
    JCCP.OrigEstHours,
    JCCP.OrigEstUnits,
    JCCP.OrigEstCost,
    JCCP.CurrEstHours,
    JCCP.CurrEstUnits,
    JCCP.CurrEstCost,
    JCCP.ProjHours,
    JCCP.ProjUnits,
    JCCP.ProjCost,
    JCCP.ForecastHours,
    JCCP.ForecastUnits,
    JCCP.ForecastCost,
    JCCP.TotalCmtdUnits,
    JCCP.TotalCmtdCost,
    JCCP.RemainCmtdUnits,
    JCCP.RemainCmtdCost,
    JCCP.RecvdNotInvcdUnits,
    JCCP.RecvdNotInvcdCost
FROM JCCP
JOIN JCCH ON JCCH.JCCo=JCCP.JCCo AND JCCH.Job=JCCP.Job AND JCCH.PhaseGroup=JCCP.PhaseGroup AND JCCH.Phase=JCCP.Phase AND JCCH.CostType=JCCP.CostType
    UNION ALL
    SELECT JCCD.JCCo, JCCD.Job, JCCD.Phase, JCCD.CostType, RecordType='CD', JCCD.UM, PhaseUnitFlag, CPMonth='1/1/1950', JCCD.Mth, JCCD.CostTrans, JCCD.ActualDate, JCCD.PostedDate,
    JCCD.ActualHours, JCCD.ActualUnits, JCCD.ActualCost, 0, 0, 0,
    JCCD.EstHours, JCCD.EstUnits, JCCD.EstCost, JCCD.ProjHours, JCCD.ProjUnits, JCCD.ProjCost,
    JCCD.ForecastHours, JCCD.ForecastUnits, JCCD.ForecastCost, JCCD.TotalCmtdUnits, JCCD.TotalCmtdCost,
    JCCD.RemainCmtdUnits, JCCD.RemainCmtdCost, 0, 0
FROM JCCD
JOIN JCCH ON JCCH.JCCo=JCCD.JCCo AND JCCH.Job=JCCD.Job AND JCCH.PhaseGroup=JCCD.PhaseGroup AND JCCH.Phase=JCCD.Phase AND JCCH.CostType=JCCD.CostType;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Batch report view aggregating original budgeted hours, units, and costs per item from job change headers linked to contracts, unioned with summed estimated costs per item from job cost details for cha
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvJCEstCostItem
output:
SELECT
    Sort='A',
    JCCI.JCCo,
    JCCI.Contract,
    JCCH.Job,
    JCCI.Item,
    OrigHours=JCCH.OrigHours,
    OrigUnits=JCCH.OrigUnits,
    OrigCost=JCCH.OrigCost,
    ACO = NULL,
    ACOItem = NULL,
    Month =isnull(JCCI.StartMonth,'1/1/1950'),
    ContractAmt=JCCI.OrigContractAmt,
    JCCI.Description,
    EstCost=0
FROM dbo.JCCI
LEFT JOIN (SELECT JCCH.JCCo, JCJP.Contract, JCCH.Job, JCJP.Item, OrigHours=sum(OrigHours), OrigUnits=sum(OrigUnits), OrigCost=sum(OrigCost)
FROM dbo.JCCH
LEFT JOIN dbo.JCJP ON JCCH.JCCo=JCJP.JCCo AND JCCH.Job=JCJP.Job AND JCCH.PhaseGroup=JCJP.PhaseGroup AND JCCH.Phase=JCJP.Phase
GROUP BY JCCH.JCCo, JCJP.Contract, JCCH.Job, JCJP.Item) AS JCCH
    ON JCCH.JCCo=JCCI.JCCo AND JCCH.Contract=JCCI.Contract AND JCCH.Item=JCCI.Item
UNION ALL
SELECT Sort='C', JCOI.JCCo, JCOI.Contract, JCOD.Job, JCOI.Item, 0, 0, 0, JCOI.ACO, JCOI.ACOItem, JCOI.ApprovedMonth, JCOI.ContractAmt,
    JCOI.Description,JCOD.EstCost
FROM dbo.JCOI
LEFT JOIN (SELECT JCOD.JCCo, JCJP.Contract, JCOD.Job, JCJP.Item, JCOD.ACO, JCOD.ACOItem, EstCost=sum(JCOD.EstCost)
FROM dbo.JCOD
LEFT JOIN dbo.JCJP ON JCOD.JCCo=JCJP.JCCo AND JCOD.Job=JCJP.Job
GROUP BY JCOD.JCCo, JCJP.Contract, JCOD.Job, JCJP.Item, JCOD.ACO, JCOD.ACOItem) AS JCOD
    ON JCOD.JCCo=JCOI.JCCo AND JCOD.Contract=JCOI.Contract AND JCOD.Item=JCOI.Item;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view aggregates job contract revenue metrics from the JCID table, providing monthly totals for contract units and amounts, projected units and dollars, and billed units and amounts g
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvJCIDProjRev
output:
SELECT
    JCCo,
    Contract,
    Item,
    Mth,
    ContractUnits=sum(ContractUnits),
    ContractAmt =sum(ContractAmt),
    ProjUnits=sum(ProjUnits),
    ProjDollars =sum(ProjDollars),
    BilledUnits=sum(BilledUnits),
    BilledAmt =sum(BilledAmt)
FROM dbo.JCID
GROUP BY JCCo,Contract,Item,Mth;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view lists insurance templates associated with jobs, detailing phase groups, full phases, truncated phase prefixes (based on company-defined valid length), insurance codes, and descr
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvJCInsPhase

SELECT DISTINCT
    HQCO.HQCo,
    HQCO.Name,
    JCCO.ValidPhaseChars,
    JCTN.JCCo,
    JCJM.Job,
    JCTI.InsTemplate,
    InsTempDesc=JCTN.Description,
    JCTI.PhaseGroup,
    TempPhase= LEFT(JCTI.Phase,JCCO.ValidPhaseChars),
    JCTI.Phase,
    JCTI.InsCode,

FROM dbo.JCTN
INNER JOIN dbo.JCJM ON (JCJM.JCCo=JCTN.JCCo) AND (JCJM.InsTemplate=JCTN.InsTemplate)
INNER JOIN dbo.HQCO ON (JCJM.JCCo=HQCO.HQCo)
INNER JOIN dbo.JCCO ON (JCTN.JCCo=JCCO.JCCo)
LEFT JOIN dbo.JCTI ON (JCTI.JCCo=JCTN.JCCo) AND (JCTI.InsTemplate=JCTN.InsTemplate)
INNER JOIN dbo.HQIC ON (JCTI.InsCode=HQIC.InsCode);

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view provides a distinct listing of job phases across jobs and contracts, including company names, job status, insurance templates, parsed phase codes (truncated to valid lengths), f

SELECT DISTINCT

    JCJM.JCCo,
    JCJM.Job,
    JobDesc=JCJM.Description,
    JCJM.JobStatus,
    JCJM.InsTemplate,
    InsTempDesc=JCTN.Description,
    JCJP.PhaseGroup,
    JobPhase= LEFT(JCJP.Phase,JCCO.ValidPhaseChars),
    JCJP.Phase,

instruction: Write a SQL query to: View exposing data from brvJCInsPhase, brvJCJobPhase.
