    AND brvJCJobPhase.InsTemplate=brvJCInsPhase.InsTemplate);

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view identifies the minimum projected month (MinProjMth) with non-zero projected costs for each company, contract, and item in Job Costing. It joins job phase details to cost periods
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvJCMinProjMth
output:
SELECT
    bJCCP.JCCo,
    bJCJP_1.Contract,
    bJCJP_1.Item,
    MinProjMth=min(a.NextProjMth)
FROM dbo.bJCCP WITH (NoLock)
JOIN dbo.bJCJP AS bJCJP_1 WITH (NoLock) ON bJCJP_1.JCCo=bJCCP.JCCo AND bJCJP_1.Job=bJCCP.Job AND bJCJP_1.PhaseGroup=bJCCP.PhaseGroup
    AND bJCJP_1.Phase=bJCCP.Phase
JOIN (SELECT bJCCP.JCCo, bJCJP_1.Contract, bJCJP_1.Item, NextProjMth=bJCCP.Mth
FROM JCCP WITH (NoLock)
JOIN dbo.bJCJP AS bJCJP_1 WITH (NoLock) ON bJCJP_1.JCCo=bJCCP.JCCo AND bJCJP_1.Job=bJCCP.Job AND bJCJP_1.PhaseGroup=bJCCP.PhaseGroup
    AND bJCJP_1.Phase=bJCCP.Phase
GROUP BY bJCCP.JCCo, bJCJP_1.Contract, bJCJP_1.Item, Mth
HAVING sum(bJCCP.ProjCost)<>0) AS a
    ON a.JCCo=bJCCP.JCCo AND a.Contract=bJCJP_1.Contract AND a.Item=bJCJP_1.Item
    AND a.NextProjMth=bJCCP.Mth
GROUP BY bJCCP.JCCo, bJCJP_1.Contract, bJCJP_1.Item;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Combines contract billing transactions from JCID with job cost progress data from JCCD to compare billed units/amounts against billable actual/estimated/projected units/costs per contract item per mon
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvJCProgressVSBilled
output:
SELECT
    JCID.JCCo,
    HQCO.Name,
    JCID.Mth,
    JCID.Contract,
    ContractDescr = JCCM.Description,
    JCID.Item,
    ItemDescr= JCCI.Description,
    ItemUM = JCCI.UM,
    ItemSICode = JCCI.SICode,
    BillActualDate = JCID.ActualDate,
    JCID.ContractUnits,
    UnitPrice = CASE WHEN JCID.TransSource = 'JC OrigEst' THEN JCID.UnitPrice ELSE 0 END,
    JCID.ContractAmt,
    JCID.BilledUnits,
    JCID.BilledAmt,
    ProgActualUnits=0.00,
    ProgActualCost=0.00,
    ProgActualDate = '01/01/1950',
    EstCost = 0,
    EstUnits = 0,
    ProjCost = 0,
    ProjUnits = 0
FROM JCID WITH (NoLock)
JOIN JCCI WITH (NoLock) ON
    JCID.JCCo = JCCI.JCCo AND
    JCID.Contract = JCCI.Contract AND
    JCID.Item = JCCI.Item
JOIN JCCM WITH (NoLock) ON
    JCID.JCCo = JCCM.JCCo AND
    JCID.Contract = JCCM.Contract
JOIN HQCO WITH (NoLock) ON
    JCID.JCCo = HQCO.HQCo
    UNION ALL
    SELECT JCCD.JCCo, HQCO.Name, JCCD.Mth, JCJP.Contract, JCCM.Description, JCJP.Item, ItemDescr= JCCI.Description,
    JCCI.UM, JCCI.SICode, '01/01/1950', 0,
    0, 0, 0, 0,
    CASE WHEN JCCH.BillFlag = 'Y' THEN JCCD.ActualUnits ELSE 0 END, JCCD.ActualCost, JCCD.ActualDate,
    JCCD.EstCost,
    CASE WHEN JCCH.BillFlag = 'Y' THEN JCCD.EstUnits ELSE 0 END, JCCD.ProjCost,
    CASE WHEN JCCH.BillFlag = 'Y' THEN JCCD.ProjUnits ELSE 0 END
FROM JCCD WITH (NoLock)
JOIN JCJP WITH (NoLock) ON
    JCCD.JCCo=JCJP.JCCo AND
    JCCD.Job=JCJP.Job AND
    JCCD.Phase=JCJP.Phase AND
    JCCD.PhaseGroup=JCJP.PhaseGroup
JOIN JCCI WITH (NoLock) ON
    JCJP.JCCo = JCCI.JCCo AND
    JCJP.Contract = JCCI.Contract AND
    JCJP.Item = JCCI.Item
JOIN JCCM WITH (NoLock) ON
    JCJP.JCCo = JCCM.JCCo AND
    JCJP.Contract = JCCM.Contract
JOIN HQCO WITH (NoLock) ON
    JCCD.JCCo = HQCO.HQCo
JOIN JCCH WITH (NoLock) ON
    JCCD.JCCo=JCCH.JCCo AND
    JCCD.Job=JCCH.Job AND
    JCCD.Phase=JCCH.Phase AND
    JCCD.PhaseGroup=JCCH.PhaseGroup AND
    JCCD.CostType = JCCH.CostType;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides detailed tax information for job cost transactions, including base tax codes, multi-level local tax linkages, GL accounts, and date-effective tax rates derived from transaction actual dates.
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvJCTax
output:
SELECT
    HQCO.Name,
    JCCD.JCCo,
    JCCD.Mth,
    JCCD.JCTransType,
    JCCD.Job,
    JCCD.Description,
    JCCD.TaxType,
    TaxCo = CASE WHEN JCCD.TaxType IN (1,3) THEN JCCD.APCo ELSE JCCD.GLCo END,
    JCCD.GLCo,
    JCCD.TaxBasis,
    JCCD.TaxAmt,
    JCCD.Phase,
    JCCD.CostTrans,
    JobDesc = JCJM.Description,
    JCCD.ActualDate,
    JCCD.Vendor,
    JCCD.APRef,
    JCCD.MSTicket,
    BaseTaxCode=HQTX_1.TaxCode,
    BaseTaxDesc=HQTX_1.Description,
    LocalTaxCode=CASE HQTX_1.MultiLevel WHEN 'Y' THEN HQTX_2.TaxCode ELSE HQTX_1.TaxCode END,
    LocalTaxDesc=CASE HQTX_1.MultiLevel WHEN 'Y' THEN HQTX_2.Description ELSE HQTX_1.Description END,
    GLAcct=CASE HQTX_1.MultiLevel WHEN 'Y' THEN HQTX_2.GLAcct ELSE HQTX_1.GLAcct END,
    TaxRate=CASE HQTX_1.MultiLevel WHEN 'Y'
    THEN (CASE WHEN JCCD.ActualDate < isnull(HQTX_2.EffectiveDate,'12/31/2070') THEN
    isnull(HQTX_2.OldRate,0) ELSE isnull(HQTX_2.NewRate,0) END)
    ELSE
    (CASE WHEN JCCD.ActualDate < isnull(HQTX_1.EffectiveDate,'12/31/2070') THEN
    isnull(HQTX_1.OldRate,0) ELSE isnull(HQTX_1.NewRate,0) END)
    END
FROM dbo.JCCD
JOIN HQCO ON JCCD.JCCo=HQCO.HQCo
INNER JOIN JCJM ON JCJM.JCCo=JCCD.JCCo AND JCJM.Job=JCCD.Job
JOIN dbo.HQTX AS HQTX_1 ON HQTX_1.TaxGroup=JCCD.TaxGroup AND HQTX_1.TaxCode=JCCD.TaxCode
Full OUTER JOIN HQTL ON HQTL.TaxGroup = JCCD.TaxGroup AND HQTL.TaxCode = JCCD.TaxCode
Full OUTER JOIN dbo.HQTX AS HQTX_2 ON HQTX_2.TaxGroup = HQTL.TaxGroup AND HQTX_2.TaxCode = HQTL.TaxLink;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view extracts significant phase prefixes from job cost transaction phases using company-defined valid length and identifies the earliest phase per group. It aggregates data by compan
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvJCTISigPhs
output:
SELECT
    JCTI.JCCo,
    JCTI.InsTemplate,
    JCTI.PhaseGroup,
    SigPhase=LEFT(JCTI.Phase,JCCO.ValidPhaseChars),
    FirstPhase=min(JCTI.Phase)
FROM JCTI
JOIN JCCO ON JCCO.JCCo=JCTI.JCCo
GROUP BY JCTI.JCCo, JCTI.InsTemplate, JCTI.PhaseGroup,LEFT(JCTI.Phase,JCCO.ValidPhaseChars);

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view aggregates AP transaction headers into distinct AP references (invoices) by company, month, vendor group, and vendor. For each unique combination, it calculates the latest invoi
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvMSHaul_APTH_DistinctAPRef
output:
SELECT
    APCo,
    Mth,
    VendorGroup,
    Vendor,
    APRef,
    InvDate=max(InvDate),
    DueDate=max(DueDate),
    CountAPTrans=count(APTrans)
FROM APTH
GROUP BY APCo, Mth, VendorGroup, Vendor, APRef;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view aggregates material sales transaction details into per-material totals by company and month, including summed units, material costs, haul charges, and taxes, with a max sequence
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvMSInvTotal
output:
SELECT
    MSID.Co,
    MSID.Mth,
    Seq=max(MSTD.MSTrans),
    TotalSummary=1,
    MSID.MatlGroup,
    MSID.Material,
    MatlDesc=HQMT.Description,
    MSID.UM,
    TotalUnitsMatl=sum(MSTD.MatlUnits),
    TotalMatl=sum(MatlTotal),
    TotalHaul=sum(HaulTotal),
    TotalTax=sum(TaxTotal)
FROM MSID
JOIN MSTD ON MSTD.MSCo=MSID.Co AND MSTD.Mth=MSID.Mth AND MSTD.MSTrans=MSID.MSTrans
JOIN HQMT ON HQMT.MatlGroup=MSTD.MatlGroup AND HQMT.Material=MSTD.Material
GROUP BY MSID.Co, MSID.Mth, MSID.MatlGroup, MSID.Material, HQMT.Description, MSID.UM, MSID.UnitPrice;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Batch report view consolidating MS quote details from MSDX (Type 'D' records with sequence, location groups, material groups, categories, UMs, and pay discount rates) and zone headers from MSZD (Type
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvMSQuotes
output:
SELECT
    MSCo,
    Quote,
    Type='D',
    Seq,
    LocGroup,
    Loc,
    MatlGroup,
    Category,
    UM,
    PayDiscRate
FROM MSDX
    UNION
    SELECT MSCo, Quote, Type='H', FromLoc, Zone, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL
FROM MSZD;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Combines job cost estimates with committed buy-out costs from interfaced PM subcontract and miscellaneous transactions into a unified ACO-level summary. Aggregates estimated costs from job cost compan
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPMBuyOutACO
output:
SELECT
    Company=JCCo,
    Job=Job,
    PhaseGroup=PhaseGroup,
    Phase=Phase,
    CT=CostType,
    ACO=ACO,
    Item= ACOItem,
    EstCost=sum(EstCost),
    TotalCmdtCost=0.00
FROM JCCD
GROUP BY JCCo, Job,PhaseGroup ,Phase,CostType,ACO, ACOItem
    UNION ALL
    SELECT PMCo, Project,PhaseGroup ,Phase,CostType,ACO, ACOItem, EstCost=0.00, TotalCmdtCost=sum(Amount)
FROM PMSL
WHERE PMSL.InterfaceDate IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY PMCo, Project,PhaseGroup ,Phase,CostType,ACO, ACOItem
    UNION ALL
    SELECT PMCo, Project,PhaseGroup ,Phase,CostType,ACO, ACOItem, EstCost=0.00, TotalCmdtCost=sum(Amount)
FROM PMMF
WHERE PMMF.InterfaceDate IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY PMCo, Project,PhaseGroup ,Phase,CostType,ACO, ACOItem;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view combines project management estimated costs from detail lines (including units, hours, unit costs, and totals) linked to accounting orders (ACO) and ready for interface (SendYN=
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPMEstCo
output:
SELECT
    PMOL.PMCo,
    PMOL.Project,
    PMOL.ACO,
    PMOL.ACOItem,
    PMOL.Phase,
    PMOL.CostType,
    PMOL.EstUnits,
    PMOL.UM,
    PMOL.UnitHours,
    PMOL.EstHours,
    PMOL.HourCost,
    PMOL.UnitCost,
    PMOL.ECM,
    PMOL.EstCost
FROM dbo.PMOL
WHERE PMOL.ACO IS NOT NULL AND PMOL.SendYN = 'Y' AND PMOL.InterfacedDate IS NULL
    UNION ALL
    SELECT DISTINCT PMOI.PMCo,PMOI.Project,PMOI.ACO,PMOI.ACOItem,PMPA.Phase,PMPA.CostType,
    0,NULL,0,0,0,0,'Add ON',PMOA.AddOnAmount
FROM dbo.PMOI
LEFT JOIN dbo.PMOA ON PMOI.PMCo = PMOA.PMCo AND PMOI.Project = PMOA.Project
    AND PMOI.PCO = PMOA.PCO AND PMOI.PCOItem = PMOA.PCOItem AND PMOI.PCOType = PMOA.PCOType
LEFT JOIN dbo.PMPA ON PMOA.PMCo = PMPA.PMCo AND PMOA.Project = PMPA.Project AND PMOA.AddOn = PMPA.AddOn
    AND PMPA.Phase IS NOT NULL
WHERE PMOA.Status <> 'Y' AND PMPA.Phase IS NOT NULL;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view merges Material Sales (MS) quote details with Project Management (PM) material forecast entries linked to the same job and company, using UNION ALL for a unified structure. MS d
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPMMSQuoteDetail
output:
SELECT
    Sort=2,
    QuoteOverrideDefaultDesc='MS Quote Detail',
    MSQH.Job,
    MSQH.MSCo,
    MSQH.Quote,
    MSQH.Description,
    MSQH.Contact,
    MSQH.PriceTemplate,
    MSQH.TaxCode,
    MSQH.HaulTaxOpt,
    MSQH.QuotedBy,
    MSQH.QuoteDate,
    MSQH.ExpDate,
    MSQH.Active,
    MSQH.Loc,
    FromLoc=MSQD.FromLoc,
    Material=MSQD.Material,
    MSQD.UM,
    QuoteUnits=MSQD.QuoteUnits,
    UnitPrice=MSQD.UnitPrice,
    MSQD.ECM,
    MSQD.ReqDate,
    Status=MSQD.Status,
    OrderUnits=MSQD.OrderUnits,
    SoldUnits=MSQD.SoldUnits,
    MSQD.Notes,
    MatlGroup=MSQD.MatlGroup,
    PMMF_location=NULL,
    PMMF_MaterialCode=NULL,
    PMMF_MtlDescription=NULL,
    PMMF_Phase=NULL,
    PMMF_CT=NULL,
    PMMF_Units=NULL,
    PMMF_UnitCost=NULL,
    PMMF_ACO=NULL,
    PMMF_ACOItem=NULL,
    PMMF_Seq=NULL,
    PMMF_PMCo=NULL
FROM MSQH
JOIN MSQD ON MSQD.MSCo = MSQH.MSCo AND MSQD.Quote = MSQH.Quote AND MSQD.FromLoc = MSQH.Loc
    UNION ALL
    SELECT
    1, QuoteOverrideDefaultDesc='PM Quote Detail',PMMF.Project, PMMF.PMCo, PMMF.Quote, NULL, NULL,
    NULL, PMMF.TaxCode, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL,NULL,
    NULL, NULL, PMMF.UM, NULL, NULL, PMMF.ECM, PMMF.ReqDate, NULL, NULL,
    NULL, NULL,NULL,
    PMMF_location=Location, PMMF_MaterialCode=MaterialCode, PMMF_MtlDescription=MtlDescription, PMMF_Phase=Phase,
    PMMF_CT=CostType, PMMF_Units=Units, PMMF_UnitCost=UnitCost,PMMF_ACO=ACO,PMMF_ACOItem=ACOItem,
    PMMF_Seq=Seq,PMMF_PMCo=PMCo
FROM MSQH
JOIN PMMF ON MSQH.MSCo = PMMF.PMCo AND MSQH.Job = PMMF.Project;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Batch report view for PM reminder letters listing submittals to architects/engineers that are due back but not received, excluding final status records. Coalesces due dates, descriptions, and copies s
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPMReminderLtr
output:
SELECT
    PMSM.PMCo,
    PMSM.Project,
    Firm= PMSM.ArchEngFirm,
    Contact= PMSM.ArchEngContact,
    PMSMStatus=PMSC_1.Status,
    Date1=(CASE WHEN PMSI.Item IS NULL THEN PMSM.DueBackArch ELSE PMSI.DueBackArch END),
    Desccription =(CASE WHEN PMSI.Item IS NULL THEN PMSM.Description ELSE PMSI.Description END),
    PMDT.DocType,
    PMDTDesc=PMDT.Description,
    PMSM.Submittal,
    PMSM.SubmittalType,
    PMSM.Rev,
    PMSI.Item,
    VendorGroup,
    PMSM.SubFirm,
    CopiesSent = (CASE WHEN PMSI.Item IS NULL THEN PMSM.CopiesSentArch ELSE PMSI.CopiesSentArch END)
FROM PMSM
JOIN dbo.PMSC AS PMSC_1 ON PMSM.Status=PMSC_1.Status
JOIN PMDT ON PMSM.SubmittalType=PMDT.DocType
LEFT JOIN PMSI ON PMSM.PMCo=PMSI.PMCo AND PMSM.Project=PMSI.Project AND PMSM.Submittal=PMSI.Submittal AND PMSM.SubmittalType=PMSI.SubmittalType
    AND PMSM.Rev=PMSI.Rev
LEFT JOIN dbo.PMSC AS PMSC_2 ON PMSI.Status=PMSC_2.Status
WHERE PMSC_1.CodeType <> 'F' AND isnull(PMSC_2.CodeType,'') <> 'F' AND
    (PMSM.RecdBackArch IS NULL AND PMSI.RecdBackArch IS NULL) AND
    (PMSM.DueBackArch IS NOT NULL OR PMSI.DueBackArch IS NOT NULL);

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides PM subledger transactions linked to SL items, distinguished by SubCO and ACO, with detail amounts from PMSL, original costs from SLIT, and previous amounts pulled from prior (lower) SubCO/ACO
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPMSLCOACOSubCoSort
output:
SELECT DISTINCT
    PMSL_1.PMCo,
    PMSL_1.Project,
    PMSL_1.SLCo,
    PMSL_1.SL,
    PMSL_1.SLItem,
    PMSL_1.SubCO,
    PMSL_1.ACO,
    PMSL_1.ACOItem,
    PMSL_1.PhaseGroup,
    PMSL_1.Phase,
    VendorGroup = NULL,
    Vendor = NULL,
    Units = NULL,
    UM = NULL,
    UnitCost=NULL,
    DetailAmount = 0,
    PrevAmount = PMSL_1.Amount,
    OrigCost = 0,
    LT ='Previous'
FROM dbo.PMSL AS PMSL_1
INNER JOIN dbo.PMSL AS PMSL_2 ON PMSL_1.PMCo = PMSL_2.PMCo AND PMSL_1.Project = PMSL_2.Project AND
    PMSL_1.SLCo = PMSL_2.SLCo AND PMSL_1.SLItem = PMSL_1.SLItem AND
    PMSL_1.SubCO < PMSL_2.SubCO AND PMSL_1.ACO < PMSL_2.ACO
WHERE PMSL_1.ACO IS NOT NULL AND PMSL_1.SL IS NOT NULL AND PMSL_1.SubCO IS NOT NULL
    UNION
    SELECT PMSL.PMCo,PMSL.Project,PMSL.SLCo,PMSL.SL,PMSL.SLItem,PMSL.SubCO,PMSL.ACO,PMSL.ACOItem,PMSL.PhaseGroup,PMSL.Phase,PMSL.VendorGroup,PMSL.Vendor,PMSL.Units,PMSL.UM,PMSL.UnitCost,PMSL.Amount,0,SLIT.OrigCost,LT = 'Detail'
FROM dbo.PMSL
INNER JOIN dbo.SLIT ON PMSL.SLCo = SLIT.SLCo AND PMSL.SL = SLIT.SL
WHERE PMSL.ACO IS NOT NULL AND PMSL.SL IS NOT NULL AND PMSL.SubCO IS NOT NULL;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view provides audit data on purchase order batches, linking item-level details to header batch information via company, month, batch ID, and sequence. It retrieves PO numbers from he
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPOAudit
output:
SELECT
    POHB.Co,
    POHB.Mth,
    POHB.BatchId,
    POHB.BatchSeq,
    POHB.PO,
    POIB.POItem
FROM POIB
LEFT OUTER JOIN POHB ON POIB.Co=POHB.Co AND POIB.Mth=POHB.Mth AND
    POIB.BatchId=POHB.BatchId AND POIB.BatchSeq=POHB.BatchSeq;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: View exposing data from POCD.
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPOCD_DistinctPO
output:
SELECT DISTINCT POCo, PO, POItem
FROM POCD;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Summarizes purchase order change orders by company, PO, and item, including original PO total cost from item records, current change details like date, units, unit cost, and total change cost. Calcula
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPOChgOrderSummary
output:
SELECT
    POCD.POCo,
    POCD.PO,
    POCD.POItem,
    POIT2.OrigCost,
    POCD.ChangeOrder,
    POCD.ActDate,
    POCD.Description,
    POCD.UM,
    POCD.ChangeCurUnits,
    POCD.CurUnitCost,
    POCD.ECM,
    POCD.Notes,
    POCD.ChgTotCost,
    PrevCost = (SELECT sum(ChgTotCost)
FROM dbo.POCD AS POCD_1
WHERE POCD_1.POCo = POCD.POCo AND POCD_1.PO= POCD.PO AND POCD_1.ChangeOrder < POCD.ChangeOrder)
FROM POCD
JOIN (SELECT POIT.POCo, POIT.PO, sum(POIT.OrigCost) AS 'OrigCost'
FROM POIT
GROUP BY POIT.POCo, POIT.PO) AS POIT2
    ON POCD.POCo= POIT2.POCo AND POCD.PO = POIT2.PO;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view aggregates current and invoiced costs from purchase order items, but only for those linked to jobs, grouping totals by company and purchase order number. It delivers summed CurC
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPOCurCost
output:
SELECT
    POCo,
    PO,
    CurCost=sum(CurCost),
    InvCost=sum(InvCost)
FROM POIT
WHERE Job IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY POCo,PO;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Lists distinct purchase orders marked as in use by specific batches where the batch status is pending or processing (5 or 6). Identifies POs locked during batch operations to prevent concurrent proces
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPOHDInUse
output:
SELECT DISTINCT
    POHD.POCo,
    POHD.PO,
    POHD.InUseMth,
    POHD.InUseBatchId,
    TableName='POHD',
    BatchStatus=isnull(HQBC.Status,9)
FROM POHD WITH(nolock)
LEFT JOIN HQBC WITH(nolock) ON HQBC.Co=POHD.POCo AND HQBC.Mth=POHD.InUseMth AND HQBC.BatchId=POHD.InUseBatchId
WHERE (POHD.InUseMth IS NOT NULL OR POHD.InUseMth IS NOT NULL)
    AND POHD.InUseBatchId IS NOT NULL AND isnull(HQBC.Status,9) IN (5,6);

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view delivers the maximum unit cost for each material group and material per company, sourced exclusively from purchase order line items on the latest order date associated with that
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPOMaxMatUC
output:
SELECT
    POIT.MatlGroup,
    POIT.Material,
    MaxUnitCost=Max(POIT.CurUnitCost),
    POIT.POCo
FROM dbo.POIT, POHD b
WHERE POIT.POCo=b.POCo AND POIT.PO=b.PO
    AND b.OrderDate =
    (SELECT Max(POHD.OrderDate)
FROM dbo.POHD, POIT t
WHERE POHD.POCo=t.POCo AND POHD.PO=t.PO
    AND POIT.POCo=t.POCo
    AND POIT.MatlGroup=t.MatlGroup AND POIT.Material=t.Material)
GROUP BY POIT.MatlGroup,POIT.Material,POIT.POCo;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides the maximum current unit cost for each material (by group) per company and vendor (by group), sourced from the most recent purchase order matching that material-vendor combination. Filters to
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPOMaxMatVendorUC
output:
SELECT
    POIT.MatlGroup,
    POIT.Material,
    MaxUnitCost=Max(POIT.CurUnitCost),
    POIT.POCo,
    b.VendorGroup,
    b.Vendor
FROM dbo.POIT, POHD b
WHERE POIT.POCo=b.POCo AND POIT.PO=b.PO
    AND b.OrderDate =
    (SELECT Max(POHD.OrderDate)
FROM dbo.POHD, POIT t
WHERE POHD.POCo=t.POCo AND POHD.PO=t.PO
    AND POIT.POCo=t.POCo
    AND POIT.MatlGroup=t.MatlGroup AND POIT.Material=t.Material
    AND b.VendorGroup=POHD.VendorGroup AND b.Vendor=POHD.Vendor)
GROUP BY POIT.MatlGroup,POIT.Material,POIT.POCo,b.VendorGroup,b.Vendor;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view unions PO receipt details (received units/costs/tax) with AP invoice line details (invoiced units/gross amounts/tax/ECM) for the same PO items, using zeros for unmatched receipt
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPORecptExpGlRec
output:
SELECT
    PORD.POCo,
    PORD.Mth,
    PORD.PO,
    PORD.POItem,
    PORD.RecvdUnits,
    InvUnits = 0,
    POIT.TaxRate AS 'RecvdTaxRate',
    RecvdCost = PORD.RecvdCost,
    InvCost = 0,
    InvTaxRate = 0,
    [Type] = 'PORD',
    NULL AS 'ECM'
FROM dbo.PORD
INNER JOIN dbo.POIT
    ON PORD.POCo = POIT.POCo
    AND PORD.PO = POIT.PO
    AND PORD.POItem = POIT.POItem
UNION ALL
SELECT APTL.APCo,
    APTL.Mth,
    APTL.PO,
    APTL.POItem,
    RecvdUnits = 0,
    APTL.Units,
    RecvdTaxRate = 0,
    RecvdCost = 0,
    APTL.GrossAmt,
    POIT.TaxRate AS 'InvTaxRate',
    [Type] = 'APTL',
    APTL.ECM
FROM dbo.APTL
JOIN dbo.APTH
    ON APTL.APCo = APTH.APCo
    AND APTL.Mth = APTH.Mth
    AND APTL.APTrans = APTH.APTrans
JOIN dbo.POIT
    ON APTL.APCo = POIT.POCo
    AND APTL.PO = POIT.PO
    AND APTL.POItem = POIT.POItem;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view provides employee-level payroll data from PREA for IRS Form 941 quarterly federal tax reporting, detailing amounts by EDL type/code per company and month. It includes total, sub
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPR941Form
output:
SELECT
    'PRCo' = PREA.PRCo,
    'Employee' = PREA.Employee,
    'Mth' = PREA.Mth,
    'EDLType' = PREA.EDLType,
    'EDLCode' = PREA.EDLCode,
    'Amount' = PREA.Amount,
    'SubjectAmt' = PREA.SubjectAmt,
    'EligibleAmt' = PREA.EligibleAmt,
    'PRYear' = YEAR(PREA.Mth),
    'PRQuarter' = (CASE
    WHEN MONTH(PREA.Mth) IN (1,2,3) THEN 1
    WHEN MONTH(PREA.Mth) IN (4,5,6) THEN 2
    WHEN MONTH(PREA.Mth) IN (7,8,9) THEN 3
    WHEN MONTH(PREA.Mth) IN (10,11,12) THEN 4
    ELSE 0 END),
    'PRMonth' = MONTH(PREA.Mth),
    'PRMonthOrdinalInQtr' = (CASE
    WHEN MONTH(PREA.Mth) IN (1,4,7,10) THEN 1
    WHEN MONTH(PREA.Mth) IN (2,5,8,11) THEN 2
    WHEN MONTH(PREA.Mth) IN (3,6,9,12) THEN 3
    ELSE 0 END)
FROM dbo.PREA;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view provides payroll attachment details linked to job cost code transactions for employees, including company, cost transaction, liability type, payroll group, period end date, and
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPRAttachments
output:
SELECT
    JCCD.PRCo,
    JCCD.JCCo,
    JCCD.CostTrans,
    JCCD.LiabilityType,
    PRTH.PRGroup,
    PRTH.PREndDate,
    Date= (CASE WHEN PRCO.JCIPostingDate = 'N' THEN JCCD.ActualDate ELSE PRTH.PostDate END ),
    JCCD.Employee,
    PRTH.UniqueAttchID
FROM dbo.JCCD
LEFT JOIN dbo.PRTH ON PRTH.PRCo=JCCD.PRCo AND PRTH.Employee=JCCD.Employee
INNER JOIN PRCO ON PRTH.PRCo=PRCO.PRCo
WHERE PRTH.UniqueAttchID IS NOT NULL;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Batch report view listing active employees' eligible payroll deductions (from PRED) and negative-rate accrual earnings (from PRAE) not taken in a specific payroll period, flagged by absence of matchin
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPRDedNotTaken
output:
SELECT
    PRED.PRCo,
    PRED.Employee,
    PRED.Frequency,
    PRED.RateAmt,
    PREH.LastName,
    PREH.FirstName,
    PREH.MidName,
    PRED.DLCode,
    EarnCode = 0,
    PREH.ActiveYN,
    PRPC.PREndDate,
    Record = 'D'
FROM PRED
JOIN PRPC ON PRED.PRCo=PRPC.PRCo
JOIN PREH ON PRED.PRCo=PREH.PRCo AND PRED.Employee=PREH.Employee AND PREH.PRGroup = PRPC.PRGroup
JOIN PRDL ON PRED.PRCo = PRDL.PRCo AND PRED.DLCode = PRDL.DLCode
WHERE PREH.ActiveYN = 'Y' AND PRED.RateAmt <> 0 AND PRED.OverCalcs IN ('A','R') AND PRDL.Method IN ('A','N') AND PRDL.DLType = 'D'
    AND NOT EXISTS (SELECT DISTINCT PRCo, PREndDate, Employee
FROM PRDT
WHERE PRED.PRCo = PRDT.PRCo
    AND PRDT.EDLType = 'D' AND PRED.DLCode = PRDT.EDLCode
    AND PRED.Employee = PRDT.Employee
    AND PRDT.PREndDate=PRPC.PREndDate)
    UNION ALL
    SELECT PRAE.PRCo, PRAE.Employee, PRAE.Frequency,
    PRAE.RateAmt,
    PREH.LastName, PREH.FirstName, PREH.MidName,0,
    PRAE.EarnCode,
    PREH.ActiveYN, PRPC.PREndDate, 'E'
FROM PRAE
JOIN PRPC ON PRAE.PRCo = PRPC.PRCo
JOIN PREH ON PRAE.PRCo=PREH.PRCo AND PRAE.Employee=PREH.Employee AND PREH.PRGroup = PRPC.PRGroup
JOIN PREC ON PRAE.PRCo= PREC.PRCo AND PRAE.EarnCode = PREC.EarnCode
WHERE PREH.ActiveYN = 'Y' AND PRAE.RateAmt < 0 AND PREC.Method = 'A'
    AND NOT EXISTS (SELECT DISTINCT PRCo, PREndDate, Employee
FROM PRDT
WHERE PRAE.PRCo = PRDT.PRCo
    AND PRDT.EDLType = 'E' AND PRDT.EDLCode = PRAE.EarnCode
    AND PRAE.Employee = PRDT.Employee
    AND PRDT.PREndDate=PRPC.PREndDate);

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides payroll liability amounts from transaction lines, allocated to either payroll departments or job cost departments based on job presence and type, with expense month determined by multi-month
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPRDeptCostLiabPre611
output:
SELECT
    PRTH.PRCo,
    PRTH.PRGroup,
    PRTH.PREndDate,
    PRTH.Employee,
    PRTH.Phase,
    Dept=(CASE WHEN PRTH.Job IS NULL OR PRTH.Type = 'M' OR
    PRTH.Job IS NOT NULL AND PRTH.JCDept IS NULL THEN ('PR' + PRTH.PRDept) ELSE ('JC'+PRTH.JCDept) END),
    JCCo=isnull(PRTH.JCCo,0),
    PRTH.JCDept,
    PRTH.PRDept,
    PRTH.Job,
    PRTH.Type,
    ExpMth = CASE WHEN PRPC.MultiMth = 'Y' THEN (CASE WHEN PRTH.PostDate<=
    PRPC.CutoffDate THEN PRPC.BeginMth ELSE PRPC.EndMth END) ELSE PRPC.BeginMth END,
    PRTL.LiabCode,
    PRDL.LiabType,
    HQLT.Description,
    PRTL.Amt
FROM dbo.PRTH
JOIN dbo.PRPC ON PRTH.PRCo=PRPC.PRCo AND PRTH.PRGroup=PRPC.PRGroup AND PRTH.PREndDate=PRPC.PREndDate
JOIN PRCO ON PRTH.PRCo=PRCO.PRCo
JOIN dbo.PRTL ON PRTH.PRCo=PRTL.PRCo AND PRTH.PRGroup=PRTL.PRGroup AND PRTH.PREndDate=PRTL.PREndDate AND PRTH.Employee=PRTL.Employee
    AND PRTH.PaySeq=PRTL.PaySeq AND PRTH.PostSeq=PRTL.PostSeq
JOIN dbo.PRDL ON PRDL.PRCo=PRTL.PRCo AND PRDL.DLCode=PRTL.LiabCode
JOIN dbo.HQLT ON HQLT.LiabType=PRDL.LiabType;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view enriches all payroll detail records from PRDL with the corresponding AP company code (APCo) from PRCO via a left outer join on PRCo. It provides complete payroll transaction det
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPRDL_APCO
output:
SELECT PRDL.*, APCo=PRCO.APCo
FROM PRDL
LEFT OUTER JOIN PRCO ON
    PRDL.PRCo = PRCO.PRCo;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view unifies payroll earnings data by combining timecard-based earnings from transaction headers (with hours, rate, and amount) and addon earnings (direct amounts with zero hours) in
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPREarnings
output:
SELECT
    PRTH.PRCo,
    PRGroup,
    PREndDate,
    Employee,
    PaySeq,
    PostSeq,
    RecType='Timecard',
    AddonEarnCode=0,
    DLCode,
    Rate,
    Hours,
    Amt
FROM PRTH
JOIN dbo.PRDB ON PRDB.PRCo=PRTH.PRCo AND PRDB.EDLCode=PRTH.EarnCode AND PRDB.EDLType='E'
    UNION
    SELECT PRTA.PRCo, PRGroup, PREndDate, Employee, PaySeq, PostSeq, 'Addon', PRTA.EarnCode, DLCode, Rate, 0, Amt
FROM PRTA
JOIN dbo.PRDB ON PRDB.PRCo=PRTA.PRCo AND PRDB.EDLCode=PRTA.EarnCode AND PRDB.EDLType='E';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: View exposing data from PREC.
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPRECConvert
output:
SELECT
    cPRCo=PRCo,
    cEarnCode=CONVERT(varchar(10),(space(10-datalength(CONVERT(varchar(10),EarnCode))) + CONVERT(varchar(10),EarnCode))),
    EDLType = 'E',
    *
FROM PREC;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view delivers all data from the PREC table augmented with PhaseGroup from HQCO via a left outer join on company code. It provides PR records with associated headquarters company phas
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPREC_PhsGrp
output:
SELECT PREC.*, HQCO.PhaseGroup
FROM PREC
LEFT OUTER JOIN HQCO
    ON PREC.PRCo = HQCO.HQCo;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view unions payroll employee records from PREH with HR reference records from HRRM into a single dataset, distinguishing records by datatype ('bEmployee' or 'bHRRef'). It standardize
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPREH
output:
SELECT
    Datatype='bEmployee',
    PRCo,
    Employee=CONVERT(char(6),Employee),
    LastName,
    FirstName,
    SortName
FROM PREH
    UNION ALL
    SELECT Datatype='bHRRef', HRCo,Employee=CONVERT(char(6),HRRef),
    LastName, FirstName, SortName
FROM HRRM;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view extracts the minimum straight-time rate (VarSTRate) for variable-method earning codes (Method='V') from payroll transaction accumulators (PRTA), linked to matching transaction h
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPRInsVarRate
output:
SELECT
    PRTA.PRCo,
    PRTA.PRGroup,
    PRTA.PREndDate,
    PRTA.Employee,
    PRTA.PaySeq,
    PRTH.PostDate,
    AddonEC=PRTA.EarnCode,
    VarSTRate=min(PRTA.Rate)
FROM PRTA
JOIN PRTH ON PRTH.PRCo=PRTA.PRCo AND PRTH.PRGroup=PRTA.PRGroup AND PRTH.PREndDate=PRTA.PREndDate AND PRTH.Employee=PRTA.Employee AND PRTH.PaySeq=PRTA.PaySeq AND PRTH.PostSeq=PRTA.PostSeq
JOIN dbo.PREC AS PREC_1 ON PREC_1.PRCo=PRTH.PRCo AND PREC_1.EarnCode=PRTH.EarnCode
JOIN dbo.PREC AS PREC_2 ON PREC_2.PRCo=PRTA.PRCo AND PREC_2.EarnCode=PRTA.EarnCode
WHERE PREC_2.Method='V' AND PREC_1.Factor=1.0
GROUP BY PRTA.PRCo, PRTA.PRGroup, PRTA.PREndDate, PRTA.Employee, PRTA.PaySeq, PRTH.PostDate, PRTA.EarnCode;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view calculates leave usage for payroll transactions by linking earnings to leave codes, prioritizing employee-specific leave balances from PRLB over general accrual usage from PRAU
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPRLeave
output:
SELECT
    PRTH.PRCo,
    PRTH.PRGroup,
    PRTH.PREndDate,
    PRTH.Employee,
    PRTH.PaySeq,
    PRTH.PostSeq,
    PRTH.PostDate,
    PRTH.EarnCode,
    PRTH.Hours,
    PRTH.Amt,
    PRAU.LeaveCode,
    PRAU.Type,
    PRAU.Basis,
    PRAU.Rate,
    Usage=(CASE WHEN PRAU.Basis='H' THEN PRAU.Rate*PRTH.Hours ELSE PRAU.Rate*PRTH.Amt END)
FROM dbo.PRTH
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.PRAU ON PRTH.PRCo=PRAU.PRCo AND PRTH.EarnCode=PRAU.EarnCode
JOIN dbo.PREL ON PREL.PRCo=PRAU.PRCo AND PRTH.Employee=PREL.Employee AND PRAU.LeaveCode=PREL.LeaveCode
WHERE NOT EXISTS
    (SELECT *
FROM PRLB
WHERE PREL.PRCo=PRLB.PRCo AND PREL.Employee=PRLB.Employee AND PREL.LeaveCode=PRLB.LeaveCode)
UNION ALL
SELECT PRTH.PRCo, PRTH.PRGroup, PRTH.PREndDate, PRTH.Employee, PRTH.PaySeq, PRTH.PostSeq, PRTH.PostDate, PRTH.EarnCode, PRTH.Hours, PRTH.Amt, PRLB.LeaveCode, PRLB.Type, PRLB.Basis, PRLB.Rate,
Usage=(CASE WHEN PRLB.Basis='H' THEN PRLB.Rate*PRTH.Hours ELSE PRLB.Rate*PRTH.Amt END)
FROM dbo.PRTH
JOIN dbo.PRLB ON PRTH.PRCo=PRLB.PRCo AND PRTH.Employee=PRLB.Employee AND PRTH.EarnCode=PRLB.EarnCode;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Identifies active payroll employees missing timecard submissions for specific payroll periods by joining employee records with pay period calendars and excluding those with matching transaction header
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPRMissingTimecards
output:
SELECT
    PREH.PRCo,
    PREH.Employee,
    PREH.SortName,
    PREH.LastName,
    PREH.FirstName,
    PREH.MidName,
    PREH.PRGroup,
    PREH.PRDept,
    PREH.Craft,
    PREH.JCCo,
    PREH.Job,
    PREH.ActiveYN,
    PRPC.PREndDate
FROM PRPC
Full OUTER JOIN PREH ON PREH.PRCo=PRPC.PRCo AND PREH.PRGroup=PRPC.PRGroup
WHERE PREH.ActiveYN = 'Y' AND
    NOT EXISTS (SELECT *
FROM PRTH
WHERE PREH.PRCo = PRTH.PRCo AND PREH.PRGroup = PRTH.PRGroup AND
    PREH.Employee = PRTH.Employee AND PRTH.PREndDate=PRPC.PREndDate);

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Batch report view for payroll reconciliation aggregating transaction headers with summed addon earnings from PRTA and addon liabilities from PRTL at the pay period, employee, posting sequence, and job
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPRRecon
output:
SELECT
    PRTH.PRCo,
    PRTH.PRGroup,
    PRTH.PREndDate,
    PRTH.Employee,
    PRTH.PaySeq,
    PRTH.PostSeq,
    PRTH.PostDate,
    PRTH.JCCo,
    PRTH.Job,
    PRTH.PhaseGroup,
    PRTH.Phase,
    PRTH.Craft,
    PRTH.Class,
    PRTH.EarnCode,
    PRTH.Amt,
    PRTH.Hours,
    AddonEarn=sum(AddonEarn),
    AddonLiab=sum(AddonLiab)
FROM PRTH
LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT PRCo, PRGroup, PREndDate, Employee, PaySeq, PostSeq, AddonEarn=sum(Amt)
FROM PRTA
GROUP BY PRCo, PRGroup, PREndDate, Employee, PaySeq, PostSeq) AS AE
    ON AE.PRCo=PRTH.PRCo AND AE.PRGroup=PRTH.PRGroup AND AE.PREndDate=PRTH.PREndDate AND AE.Employee=PRTH.Employee
    AND AE.PaySeq=PRTH.PaySeq AND AE.PostSeq=PRTH.PostSeq
LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT PRCo, PRGroup, PREndDate, Employee, PaySeq, PostSeq, AddonLiab=sum(Amt)
FROM PRTL
GROUP BY PRCo, PRGroup, PREndDate, Employee, PaySeq, PostSeq) AS AL
    ON AL.PRCo=PRTH.PRCo AND AL.PRGroup=PRTH.PRGroup AND AL.PREndDate=PRTH.PREndDate AND AL.Employee=PRTH.Employee
    AND AL.PaySeq=PRTH.PaySeq AND AL.PostSeq=PRTH.PostSeq
GROUP BY PRTH.PRCo, PRTH.PRGroup, PRTH.PREndDate, PRTH.Employee, PRTH.PaySeq, PRTH.PostSeq,PRTH.PostDate,PRTH.JCCo,
    PRTH.Job,PRTH.PhaseGroup, PRTH.Phase,PRTH.Craft, PRTH.Class,PRTH.EarnCode,PRTH.Amt,PRTH.Hours;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view delivers a static lookup of predefined reason codes for Records of Employment (ROE) in Payroll, covering causes like work shortages, strikes, quits, retirements, and leaves. Cod

SELECT

'Shortage of Work' AS 'Reason',
'A - Shortage of Work' AS 'ReasonCode'
UNION
SELECT

SELECT
'C' AS 'Code',

UNION
SELECT
'D' AS 'Code',
'Illness OR Injury' AS 'Reason',
'D - Illness OR Injury' AS 'ReasonCode'
UNION
SELECT
'E' AS 'Code',
'Quit' AS 'Reason',
'E - Quit' AS 'ReasonCode'
UNION
SELECT
'F' AS 'Code',
'Maternity' AS 'Reason',
'F - Maternity' AS 'ReasonCode'
UNION
SELECT
'G' AS 'Code',
'Retirement' AS 'Reason',
'G - Retirement' AS 'ReasonCode'
UNION
SELECT
'H' AS 'Code',
'Work Sharing' AS 'Reason',
'H - Work Sharing' AS 'ReasonCode'
UNION
SELECT
'J' AS 'Code',
'Apprentice Training' AS 'Reason',
'J - Apprentice Training' AS 'ReasonCode'
UNION
SELECT
'M' AS 'Code',
'Dismissal' AS 'Reason',
'M - Dismissal' AS 'ReasonCode'
UNION
SELECT
'N' AS 'Code',
'Leave of Absence' AS 'Reason',
'N - Leave of Absence' AS 'ReasonCode'
UNION
SELECT
'P' AS 'Code',
'Parental' AS 'Reason',
'P - Parental' AS 'ReasonCode'
UNION
SELECT
'K' AS 'Code',
'Other' AS 'Reason',
'K - Other' AS 'ReasonCode'
UNION
SELECT
'Z' AS 'Code',
'Compassionate Care' AS 'Reason',
'Z - Compassionate Care' AS 'ReasonCode';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides queued payroll payment transactions including employee details, pay period information, earnings, deductions, SUI earnings, and check management references for batch tax liability reporting.

SELECT

    Employee,

    CMAcct,
    PayMethod,
    CMRef,

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides sequenced W2 Box 12 data per company, tax year, and employee, including item details, descriptions, amounts, and a cumulative count of distinct prior items with valid W2 codes. Filters to onl
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPRW2Box12
output:
SELECT
    PRWA.PRCo,
    PRWA.TaxYear,
    Employee,
    PRWA.Item,
    PRWA.ItemID,
    PRWA.Seq,
    W2Code,
    PRWI.Description,
    Amount,
    CountItem=(SELECT count(DISTINCT PRWA_1.Item)
FROM dbo.PRWA AS PRWA_1
JOIN dbo.PRWI AS PRWI_1 ON PRWI_1.TaxYear=PRWA_1.TaxYear AND PRWI_1.Item=PRWA_1.Item
WHERE PRWA.PRCo=PRWA_1.PRCo
    AND PRWA.TaxYear=PRWA_1.TaxYear AND PRWA.Employee=PRWA_1.Employee
    AND PRWA_1.Item<=PRWA.Item AND (PRWI_1.W2Code IS NOT NULL AND PRWI_1.W2Code<>''))
FROM PRWA
JOIN PRWI ON PRWI.TaxYear=PRWA.TaxYear AND PRWI.Item=PRWA.Item
WHERE (PRWI.W2Code IS NOT NULL AND PRWI.W2Code<>'');

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view extracts payroll amounts for specific federal W-2 Box 14 items (codes 40,41,46,47,51,52,53,54) by company, tax year, and employee, joining with item descriptions and defaulting
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPRW2Box14FederalDetail
output:
SELECT
    PRWA.PRCo,
    PRWA.TaxYear,
    PRWA.Employee,
    PRWA.Item,
    PRWA.Amount,
    isnull(PRWC.Description,' ') AS Description
FROM PRWA
LEFT OUTER JOIN PRWC
    ON PRWA.PRCo = PRWC.PRCo AND PRWA.TaxYear = PRWC.TaxYear AND PRWA.Item = PRWC.Item
WHERE PRWA.Item IN (40,41,46,47,51,52,53,54);

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view merges state and local payroll tax withholding data for W2 reporting by combining wages, taxes, miscellaneous amounts, and tax IDs via full outer join on company, tax year, empl
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvPRW2LocalState
output:
SELECT
    PRCo=isnull(PRWS.PRCo,PRWL.PRCo),
    TaxYear=isnull(PRWS.TaxYear,PRWL.TaxYear),
    Employee=isnull(PRWS.Employee,PRWL.Employee),
    State=isnull(PRWS.State,PRWL.State),
    StateTaxID=PRWS.TaxID,
    LocalTaxID=PRWL.TaxID,
    StateWages=PRWS.Wages,
    StateTax=PRWS.Tax,
    PRWS.Misc1Amt,
    PRWS.Misc2Amt,
    PRWS.Misc3Amt,
    PRWS.Misc4Amt,
    PRWL.LocalCode,
    LocalWages=PRWL.Wages,
    LocalTax=PRWL.Tax
FROM PRWS
Full OUTER JOIN PRWL ON
    PRWL.PRCo=PRWS.PRCo AND PRWL.TaxYear=PRWS.TaxYear AND
    PRWL.Employee=PRWS.Employee AND PRWL.State=PRWS.State;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view aggregates metadata for report parameters and fields, unioning parameter details from RPRP (with fixed FormatType 'VPParam' and null sequence) and field details from RPRF (exclu
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvReportInfo
output:
SELECT
    RPRP.ReportID,
    RPRTShared.Title,
    ParameterName,
    FormatSeq=NULL,
    FormatType='VPParam'
FROM RPRP
JOIN dbo.RPRTShared ON RPRTShared.ReportID = RPRP.ReportID
    UNION ALL
    SELECT RPRF.ReportID, RPRT.Title, NULL, Seq, FormatType=FieldType
FROM RPRF
    CROSS APPLY dbo.vfRPRTShared(RPRF.ReportID) RPRT
WHERE FieldType NOT IN ('Proc Parameter','Parameters');

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view summarizes unique RP report titles with their descriptions, determines the primary table type (defaulting to 'Detail') from associated data dictionary entries, and flags layout
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvRPReportType
output:
SELECT
    Title=CAST(RPRTShared.Title AS varchar(40)),
    ReportDescr=max(RPRTShared.ReportDesc),
    Type=isnull(min(TType.TableType),'Detail'),
    Layout=(CASE WHEN min(TType.TableType) IS NULL THEN 'N' ELSE 'Y' END)
FROM dbo.RPRTShared
LEFT JOIN (SELECT DISTINCT TTypeReportID=RPTP.ReportID, DDTH.TableType
FROM RPTP
JOIN DDTH ON DDTH.TableName=RPTP.ViewName) AS TType
    ON TTypeReportID=RPRTShared.ReportID
GROUP BY CAST(RPRTShared.Title AS varchar(40));

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view unions reviewer data for requisition lines from RQRR (Type 1) and quote lines from RQQR (Type 2) in the RQ module. It standardizes fields like company, reviewer, dates, status,
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvRQReviewers
output:
SELECT
    Type = '1',
    RQCo,
    Reviewer,
    RQID,
    RQLine,
    Quote = NULL,
    QuoteLine = NULL,
    AssignedDate,
    ReviewDate,
    Status,
    RejReason = Description,
    Notes
FROM RQRR
    UNION ALL
    SELECT Type = '2', RQCo, Reviewer,NULL, NULL, Quote, QuoteLine,
    AssignedDate, ReviewDate, Status, Description, Notes
FROM RQQR;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view summarizes Accounts Payable transaction amounts by company, subledger account (SL), and subledger item (SLItem), calculating total invoice amounts (APInvAmt) and paid amounts (A
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvSLAPAmounts
output:
SELECT
    SLCo=APTL.APCo,
    APTL.SL,
    APTL.SLItem,
    APInvAmt=sum(Amount),
    APPaid=sum(CASE WHEN Status>3 THEN Amount ELSE 0 END)
FROM APTL
LEFT JOIN APTD ON APTD.APCo=APTL.APCo AND APTD.Mth=APTL.Mth AND APTD.APTrans=APTL.APTrans AND APTD.APLine=APTL.APLine
GROUP BY APTL.APCo, APTL.SL, APTL.SLItem;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: View exposing data from SLCD.
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvSLCD_DistinctSL
output:
SELECT DISTINCT SLCo, SL, SLItem
FROM SLCD;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides service ledger change order details including original summed costs from initial items (excluding ItemType 3), current change order quantities/units/costs, previous cumulative change costs pr
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvSLChangeOrders
output:
SELECT
    SLCD.SLCo,
    SLCD.SL,
    SLCD.SLItem,
    SLIT2.OrigCost,
    SLCD.SLChangeOrder,
    SLCD.AppChangeOrder,
    SLCD.ActDate,
    SLCD.Description,
    SLCD.UM,
    SLCD.ChangeCurUnits,
    SLCD.ChangeCurUnitCost,
    SLCD.Notes,
    SLCD.ChangeCurCost,
    SLIT.JCCo,
    SLIT.Job,
    SLIT.PhaseGroup,
    SLIT.Phase,
    SLIT.CurUnits,
    SLIT.CurUnitCost,
    PrevCost = (SELECT sum(ChangeCurCost)
FROM dbo.SLCD AS SLCD_1
WHERE SLCD_1.SLCo = SLCD.SLCo AND SLCD_1.SL= SLCD.SL AND SLCD_1.SLChangeOrder < SLCD.SLChangeOrder)
FROM SLCD
JOIN (SELECT SLIT.SLCo, SLIT.SL, sum(SLIT.OrigCost) AS 'OrigCost'
FROM SLIT
WHERE SLIT.ItemType <> 3
GROUP BY SLIT.SLCo, SLIT.SL) AS SLIT2
    ON SLCD.SLCo= SLIT2.SLCo AND SLCD.SL = SLIT2.SL
LEFT OUTER JOIN SLIT ON SLCD.SLCo = SLIT.SLCo AND SLCD.SL = SLIT.SL AND SLIT.SLItem = SLCD.SLItem;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This batch report view lists all database views with defined descriptions from either the Data Dictionary (DDTH) or User-Defined Dictionary (UDTH), providing view names alphabetically ordered with coa
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view brvViewLookup
output:
SELECT DISTINCT TOP ( 100 ) PERCENT
    v.name, ISNULL(DDTH.Description, UDTH.Description) AS Description
FROM sys.views v
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.DDTH ON v.name = DDTH.TableName
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.UDTH ON v.name = UDTH.TableName
WHERE ( DDTH.Description IS NOT NULL )
    OR ( UDTH.Description IS NOT NULL )
ORDER BY v.name;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view combines all PMCO records with corresponding business unit details by joining on PMCO.KeyID equaling the business unit's CompanyId, delivering complete PMCO data contextualized by business u
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view BusinessUnitPMCO

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Combines weekly cash flow projections for Accounts Payable outflows (NetAmount as PayableAmount) and Accounts Receivable inflows (AmountDue as ReceivableAmount) aligned by StartOfWeek into a single da
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view CashFlowAP-AR-ByWeek
output:
SELECT StartOfWeek, NetAmount AS [PayableAmount], 0 AS [ReceivableAmount]
FROM CashFlowAPbyWeek
UNION ALL
SELECT StartOfWeek, 0 AS [PayableAmount],AmountDue AS [ReceivableAmount]
FROM CashFlowARbyWeek;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides net payable amounts due from approved AP transactions (Amount minus discounts taken) and unapproved invoices (gross minus retainage and discounts), with due dates bucketed into year, month, d
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view CashFlowAP
output:
SELECT
    APTH.Vendor AS [Vendor],
    APVM.Name AS [Name],
    APTH.APRef,
    APTH.Description,
    APTD.Amount -APTD.DiscTaken AS [NetAmount],
    APTD.DueDate AS [DueDate],
    DATEPART(yyyy,APTD.DueDate) AS [Year],
    DATEPART(mm,APTD.DueDate) AS [Month],
    DATEPART(dd,APTD.DueDate) AS [Day],
    DATEPART(wk,APTD.DueDate) AS [WeekOfYear],
    DATEADD(wk, DATEDIFF(wk, 7, APTD.DueDate), 7) AS [StartOfWeek],
    DATEADD(wk, DATEDIFF(wk, 6, APTD.DueDate), 6 + 7) AS [EndofWeek],
    'Approved' AS [Status]
FROM APTH
INNER JOIN APTD
    ON APTH.APCo = APTD.APCo
    AND APTH.Mth = APTD.Mth
    AND APTH.APTrans = APTD.APTrans
JOIN APVM ON APTH.VendorGroup=APVM.VendorGroup AND APTH.Vendor=APVM.Vendor
WHERE APTD.CMRef IS NULL AND APTD.APCo ='1'
UNION ALL
SELECT
    APUI.Vendor AS [Vendor],
    APVM.Name AS [Name],
    APUI.APRef,
    APUI.Description,
    APUL.GrossAmt - APUL.Retainage - APUL.Discount AS [NetAmount],
    APUI.DueDate AS [DueDate],
    DATEPART(yyyy,APUI.DueDate) AS [Year],
    DATEPART(mm,APUI.DueDate) AS [Month],
    DATEPART(dd,APUI.DueDate) AS [Day],
    DATEPART(wk,APUI.DueDate) AS [WeekOfYear],
    DATEADD(wk, DATEDIFF(wk, 7, APUI.DueDate), 7) AS [StartOfWeek],
    DATEADD(wk, DATEDIFF(wk, 6, APUI.DueDate), 6 + 7) AS [EndofWeek],
    'Unapproved' AS [Status]
FROM APUI
INNER JOIN APUL
    ON APUI.APCo = APUL.APCo
    AND APUI.UIMth = APUL.UIMth
    AND APUI.UISeq = APUL.UISeq
JOIN APVM ON APUI.VendorGroup=APVM.VendorGroup AND APUI.Vendor=APVM.Vendor
WHERE APUI.APCo ='1';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view aggregates Accounts Payable cash flow projections by the start of each week, summing net payment amounts to provide a weekly outflow summary. It simplifies granular cash flow data into time-
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view CashFlowAPbyWeek

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides open Accounts Receivable invoices with customer details, outstanding amounts due, and due date-derived metrics including days to due date, year/month/day/week extractions, and weekly date ran
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view CashFlowAR
output:
SELECT
    ARTH.Customer AS [Customer],
    ARCM.Name AS [Name],
    ARTH.Invoice AS [Invoice],
    ARTH.Description AS [Description],
    ARTH.Invoiced AS [Invoiced],
    ARTH.Paid AS [Paid],
    ARTH.Retainage AS [Retainage],
    ARTH.AmountDue AS [AmountDue],
    ARTH.DueDate AS [DueDate],
    ( datediff(dd, Getdate(), ARTH.DueDate) ) AS [Days Past Due],
    DATEPART(yyyy,ARTH.DueDate) AS [Year],
    DATEPART(mm,ARTH.DueDate) AS [Month],
    DATEPART(dd,ARTH.DueDate) AS [Day],
    DATEPART(wk,ARTH.DueDate) AS [WeekOfYear],
    DATEADD(wk, DATEDIFF(wk, 7, ARTH.DueDate), 7) AS [StartOfWeek],
    DATEADD(wk, DATEDIFF(wk, 6, ARTH.DueDate), 6 + 7) AS [EndofWeek]
FROM dbo.ARTH(Nolock)
JOIN dbo.ARCM (Nolock )
    ON ARTH.CustGroup = ARCM.CustGroup
    AND ARTH.Customer = ARCM.Customer
WHERE ARCo = '1' AND AmountDue <> '0';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Aggregates Accounts Receivable cash flow data into weekly totals of amounts due, grouped by the start of each week. Provides a simple summary view for tracking expected AR inflows over time.
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view CashFlowARbyWeek

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Aggregates accounts payable and receivable cash flow data by week start date, summing total payable and receivable amounts per week from the underlying CashFlowAP-AR-ByWeek view.
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view CashFlowGroupedbyWeek

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Aggregates monthly payroll data by company and EDL type (earnings, deductions, liabilities), providing total hours and segregated amount totals for cash flow analysis.
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view CashFlowPR
output:
SELECT
    PRCo,
    Mth,
    EDLType,
    sum(Hours)AS [Hours],
    Earnings =
    CASE
    WHEN EDLType='E' THEN sum(Amount)
    END,
    Deduction =
    CASE
    WHEN EDLType='D' THEN sum(Amount)
    END,
    Liability =
    CASE
    WHEN EDLType='L' THEN sum(Amount)
    END
FROM PREA
GROUP BY PRCo, Mth, EDLType;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view aggregates payroll cash flow data by company (PRCo) and monthly date (Mth), summing total hours and computing net amount as earnings minus deductions plus liabilities. It derives year, month
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view CashFlowPRbyWeek
output:
SELECT
    PRCo,
    Mth,
    sum(Hours)AS [Hours],
    (sum(Earnings)- sum(Deduction)+ sum(Liability) ) AS [Net Amount],
    DATEPART(yyyy,Mth) AS [Year],
    DATEPART(mm,Mth) AS [Month],
    DATEPART(dd,Mth) AS [Day],
    DATEPART(wk,Mth) AS [WeekOfYear],
    DATEADD(wk, DATEDIFF(wk, 7, Mth), 7) AS [StartOfWeek],
    DATEADD(wk, DATEDIFF(wk, 6, Mth), 6 + 7) AS [EndofWeek]
FROM CashFlowPR
GROUP BY PRCo, Mth;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: CM Detail Batch
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view CMDB

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides commitment detail batch transactions from the CMDB table, including company, period, batch identifiers, transaction types, accounts, references, activity dates, and a signed Amount field. The
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view CMDBGrid
output:
SELECT
    Co,
    Mth,
    BatchId,
    BatchSeq,
    BatchTransType,
    CMTrans,
    CMAcct,
    CMTransType,
    GLAcct,
    CMRef,
    CMRefSeq,
    ActDate,
    'Amount'=CASE
    WHEN CMTransType=1 THEN Amount*-1
    ELSE
    Amount
    END
FROM CMDB;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides contract master detail transactions (CMDT) with adjusted amounts, clearing status, and working balances for bank statement reconciliation. Flips signs on amounts and cleared amounts for speci
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view CMDTforCMClear
output:
SELECT
    CMDT.CMCo,
    CMDT.CMAcct,
    CMDT.InUseBatchId,
    CMDT.Amount AS [DBAmt],
    CMDT.ClearedAmt,
    CASE WHEN CMDT.StmtDate IS NOT NULL THEN (CASE WHEN CMDT.Void = 'Y' THEN 0 ELSE CMDT.Amount END) ELSE 0 END AS [WorkBalAmt],
    CMDT.CMTrans,
    CMDT.CMTransType,
    CMDT.CMRef,
    CMDT.CMRefSeq,
    CASE WHEN CMDT.CMTransType IN (1,4) THEN Amount * -1 ELSE Amount END AS [Amount],
    CMDT.ActDate AS [ActDate],
    CMDT.Description,
    CMDT.Void,
    CASE WHEN CMDT.StmtDate IS NULL THEN 0 ELSE 1 END AS [Cleared],
    CMDT.ClearDate,
    CMDT.Mth,
    CASE WHEN CMTransType IN (1,4) THEN ClearedAmt * -1 ELSE ClearedAmt END AS [ClearedAmtVis],
    CMDT.StmtDate,
    CASE WHEN PRVP.PaidDate IS NULL THEN 'N' ELSE 'Y' END AS [PRVoidChk]
FROM dbo.CMDT WITH (nolock)
LEFT JOIN dbo.PRVP WITH (nolock) ON PRVP.CMCo = CMDT.CMCo AND PRVP.CMRef = CMDT.CMRef AND PRVP.CMRefSeq = CMDT.CMRefSeq
    AND PRVP.CMAcct=CMDT.CMAcct;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: The CMDTGrid view displays contract master transactions with amounts negated for types 1 and 4 (likely payments/credits) to standardize display as debits or credits. It derives a cleared flag from the
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view CMDTGrid
output:
SELECT
    CMCo,
    CMAcct,
    StmtDate,
    CMTrans,
    CMTransType,
    CMRef,
    ( CASE WHEN CMTransType IN ( 1, 4 ) THEN Amount * -1
    ELSE Amount
    END ) AS Amount,
    ActDate,
    Description,
    Void,
    ( CASE
    WHEN StmtDate IS NULL THEN 0
    ELSE 1
    END ) AS Cleared,
    ClearDate,
    Mth,
    ( CASE WHEN CMTransType IN ( 1, 4 )
    THEN ( CASE WHEN ClearedAmt > 0
    THEN ClearedAmt * -1
    ELSE ClearedAmt
    END )
    ELSE ClearedAmt
    END ) AS ClearedAmt,
    InUseBatchId
FROM dbo.CMDT;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view unions cash management transaction details from CMDT with unposted AR deposit batches from ARBH, providing a unified list of CM references by month, account, and standardized transaction typ
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view CMRefByMthIncludeARBatch
output:
SELECT
    CMDT.CMCo CMCo,
    CMDT.CMTransType CMTransType,
    CMDT.CMRef CMRef,
    CMDT.CMAcct CMAcct,
    CMDT.Description Description,
    CMDT.Mth Mth,
    CMDT.ActDate ActDate,
    (CASE CMDT.CMTransType WHEN 0 THEN 'Adj' WHEN 1 THEN 'Chk'WHEN 2 THEN 'Dep' WHEN 3 THEN 'Trns' WHEN 4 THEN 'EFT' END) TransType
FROM CMDT
UNION
SELECT ARBH.CMCo, 2,
    ARBH.CMDeposit, ARBH.CMAcct, 'NOT Posted', ARBH.Mth, ARBH.TransDate,
    'Dep'
FROM ARBH;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view provides unified multilingual text data for DD module entities by combining default 'en-US' CultureText from the culture list with specific culture translations via UNION ALL. It links all t

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view consolidates base data type definitions from vDDDT with company-specific overrides from vDDDTc, prioritizing overrides for input properties like type, mask, length, precision, and security.
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view DDDTShared
output:
SELECT
    vDDDT.Datatype,
    vDDDT.Description,
    isnull(vDDDTc.InputType,vDDDT.InputType) AS InputType,
    isnull(vDDDTc.InputMask,vDDDT.InputMask) AS InputMask,
    isnull(vDDDTc.InputLength,vDDDT.InputLength) AS InputLength,
    isnull(vDDDTc.Prec,vDDDT.Prec) AS Prec,
    isnull(vDDDTc.Secure, 'N') AS Secure,
    vDDDTc.DfltSecurityGroup,
    vDDDTc.Label,
    vDDDT.MasterTable,
    vDDDT.MasterColumn,
    vDDDT.MasterDescColumn,
    vDDDT.QualifierColumn,
    vDDDT.Lookup,
    vDDDT.SetupForm,
    vDDDT.ReportLookup,
    vDDDT.SQLDatatype,
    vDDDT.ReportOnly,
    vDDDT.TextID
FROM dbo.vDDDT (nolock)
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.vDDDTc ON vDDDTc.Datatype = vDDDT.Datatype;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view delivers a unioned dataset of DD module security assignments linking data types (especially bEmployee), qualifiers, instances, VPUserNames, and employee numbers. The first query joins genera
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view DDDU
output:
SELECT
    vDDDS.Datatype,
    vDDDS.Qualifier,
    vDDDS.Instance,
    vDDSU.VPUserName,
    CASE WHEN vDDDS.Datatype = 'bEmployee' THEN CONVERT(INT, vDDDS.Instance) ELSE NULL END AS Employee
FROM dbo.vDDDS
JOIN dbo.vDDSU ON vDDSU.SecurityGroup = vDDDS.SecurityGroup
    UNION
    SELECT 'bEmployee' AS Datatype,
    bPREH.PRCo AS Qualifier ,
    CONVERT(char(30),bPREH.Employee) AS Instance ,
    bPRGS.VPUserName ,
    bPREH.Employee AS Employee
FROM dbo.bPREH
JOIN dbo.bPRGS ON bPRGS.PRGroup = bPREH.PRGroup AND bPRGS.PRCo = bPREH.PRCo
WHERE EXISTS (SELECT 1
FROM dbo.DDDTShared WITH (nolock)
WHERE Datatype = 'bEmployee' AND Secure = 'Y');

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view lists standard user memo forms linked to document fields of type 4, excluding those starting with 'ud', by joining form configurations and memo form definitions. It groups results by form de
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view DDFHUserMemoExist
output:
SELECT
    TOP 100 percent DDFHUserMemoForms.Form,
    DDFHUserMemoForms.Title,
    DDFHUserMemoForms.ViewName,
    DDFHUserMemoForms.TitleID
FROM dbo.DDFIc (nolock)
JOIN dbo.DDFHUserMemoForms (nolock) ON DDFHUserMemoForms.Form = DDFIc.Form
WHERE FieldType = 4 AND substring(Lower(DDFHUserMemoForms.Form),1,2) <> 'ud'
GROUP BY DDFHUserMemoForms.Form, DDFHUserMemoForms.Title, DDFHUserMemoForms.ViewName, DDFHUserMemoForms.TitleID
ORDER BY DDFHUserMemoForms.Title;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides a unified dataset of form lookup configurations by merging standard definitions from vDDFL with custom overrides from vDDFLc, prioritizing custom values via ISNULL. Derives a Status field cla
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view DDFLShared
output:
SELECT
    isnull(vDDFLc.Form,vDDFL.Form) AS Form,
    isnull(vDDFLc.Seq,vDDFL.Seq) AS Seq,
    isnull(vDDFLc.Lookup,vDDFL.Lookup) AS Lookup,
    isnull(vDDFLc.LookupParams,vDDFL.LookupParams) AS LookupParams,
    isnull(vDDFLc.Active, 'Y') AS Active,
    isnull(vDDFLc.LoadSeq,vDDFL.LoadSeq) AS LoadSeq,
    CASE WHEN vDDFLc.Form IS NULL AND vDDFL.Form IS NOT NULL THEN 'Standard'
    WHEN vDDFLc.Form IS NOT NULL AND vDDFL.Form IS NOT NULL THEN 'Override'
    WHEN vDDFLc.Form IS NOT NULL AND vDDFL.Form IS NULL THEN 'Custom'
    ELSE 'Unknown' END AS [Status]
FROM dbo.vDDFLc
full OUTER JOIN dbo.vDDFL ON vDDFL.Form = vDDFLc.Form AND vDDFL.Seq = vDDFLc.Seq AND vDDFL.Lookup = vDDFLc.Lookup;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view displays DD module form security configurations, linking form permissions by company, user, and security group with resolved group names, user full names, access levels, record add/delete/up
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view DDFSForm
output:
SELECT
    TOP (100) PERCENT DDFS.Co,
    DDFS.Form,
    DDFS.SecurityGroup,
    DDSG.Name AS Groups,
    DDFS.VPUserName,
    DDUP.FullName AS [Full Name],
    DDFS.Access,
    DDFS.RecAdd,
    DDFS.RecDelete,
    DDFS.RecUpdate,
    DDFH.Mod
FROM dbo.DDFS
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.DDSG ON DDFS.SecurityGroup = DDSG.SecurityGroup
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.DDUP ON DDFS.VPUserName = DDUP.VPUserName
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.DDFH ON DDFS.Form = DDFH.Form
ORDER BY DDFS.Form;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view provides security permissions for DD module forms, grouped by security group across companies, including access levels, record add/update/delete rights, VP usernames, and associated form mod

SELECT
    TOP (100) PERCENT DDFS.Co,
    DDFS.SecurityGroup,
    DDSG.Name AS Names,
    DDFS.VPUserName,
    DDFS.Form,
    DDFS.Access,
    DDFS.RecAdd,
    DDFS.RecUpdate,
    DDFS.RecDelete,
    DDFH.Mod
FROM dbo.DDFS
INNER JOIN dbo.DDSG ON DDFS.SecurityGroup = DDSG.SecurityGroup
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.DDFH ON DDFS.Form = DDFH.Form
ORDER BY DDFS.SecurityGroup;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view lists Viewpoint user permissions for Data Dictionary (DD) forms, including overall access and specific record add/delete/update rights, filtered exclusively to the default security group (-1

    DDFS.RecDelete,

FROM dbo.DDFS
INNER JOIN dbo.DDFH ON DDFS.Form = DDFH.Form
WHERE (DDFS.SecurityGroup = - 1)

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Merges standard and custom DD form/tab definitions via full outer join, prioritizing custom values for form elements like titles, types, and load sequences. Computes flags for custom status (favoring
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view DDFTShared
output:
SELECT
    isnull(vDDFTc.Form,vDDFT.Form) AS Form,
    isnull(vDDFTc.Tab,vDDFT.Tab) AS Tab,
    isnull(vDDFTc.Title,vDDFT.Title) AS Title,
    isnull(vDDFTc.GridForm, vDDFT.GridForm) AS GridForm,
    QueryName,
    isnull(vDDFTc.Type, 0) AS Type,
    CASE WHEN vDDFTc.Form IS NULL THEN 'N' WHEN vDDFTc.Form LIKE 'ud%' AND isnull(vDDFTc.Tab,vDDFT.Tab) < 100 THEN 'N' ELSE 'Y' END AS Custom,
    isnull(vDDFTc.LoadSeq, vDDFT.LoadSeq) AS LoadSeq,
    CASE WHEN isnull(vDDFTc.Tab,vDDFT.Tab) <100 THEN 'Y' ELSE 'N' END AS IsStandard,
    CASE WHEN vDDFTc.IsVisible IS NULL THEN 'Y' ELSE vDDFTc.IsVisible END AS IsVisible,
    vDDFT.TitleID
FROM dbo.vDDFTc
full OUTER JOIN dbo.vDDFT ON vDDFT.Form = vDDFTc.Form AND vDDFT.Tab = vDDFTc.Tab;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view merges custom and standard dynamic data lookup definitions (DDLD) via full outer join on Lookup and Seq keys, prioritizing custom values with ISNULL coalescing for a complete set of column m
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view DDLDShared
output:
SELECT
    isnull(vDDLDc.Lookup,vDDLD.Lookup) AS Lookup,
    isnull(vDDLDc.Seq,vDDLD.Seq) AS Seq,
    isnull(vDDLDc.ColumnName,vDDLD.ColumnName) AS ColumnName,
    isnull(vDDLDc.ColumnHeading, vDDLD.ColumnHeading) AS ColumnHeading,
    isnull(vDDLDc.Hidden,vDDLD.Hidden) AS Hidden,
    isnull(vDDLDc.Datatype,vDDLD.Datatype) AS Datatype,
    isnull(vDDLDc.InputType,vDDLD.InputType) AS InputType,
    isnull(vDDLDc.InputLength,vDDLD.InputLength) AS InputLength,
    isnull(vDDLDc.InputMask,vDDLD.InputMask) AS InputMask,
    isnull(vDDLDc.Prec,vDDLD.Prec) AS Prec
FROM dbo.vDDLDc
full OUTER JOIN dbo.vDDLD ON vDDLD.Lookup = vDDLDc.Lookup AND vDDLD.Seq = vDDLDc.Seq;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view merges custom and standard dynamic data lookup header definitions into a single dataset, prioritizing custom SQL clauses (FROM, WHERE, JOIN, ORDER BY, GROUP BY) and metadata over Viewpoint d
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view DDLHShared
output:
SELECT
    ISNULL(vDDLHc.[DDLookupHeaderID],vDDLH.[DDLookupHeaderID]) AS [DDLookupHeaderID],
    isnull(vDDLHc.Lookup,vDDLH.Lookup) AS Lookup,
    isnull(vDDLHc.Title,vDDLH.Title) AS Title,
    isnull(vDDLHc.FromClause, vDDLH.FromClause) AS FromClause,
    isnull(vDDLHc.WhereClause,vDDLH.WhereClause) AS WhereClause,
    isnull(vDDLHc.JoinClause,vDDLH.JoinClause) AS JoinClause,
    isnull(vDDLHc.OrderByColumn,vDDLH.OrderByColumn) AS OrderByColumn,
    isnull(vDDLHc.Memo,vDDLH.Memo) AS Memo,
    isnull(vDDLHc.GroupByClause,vDDLH.GroupByClause) AS GroupByClause,
    isnull(vDDLHc.Version,vDDLH.Version) AS Version,
    isnull(vDDLHc.DescendingOrder,vDDLH.DescendingOrder) AS DescendingOrder,
    CASE WHEN vDDLHc.Lookup IS NULL THEN 'Viewpoint' ELSE 'Custom' END AS Source,
    isnull(vDDLHc.EnableFieldView,vDDLH.EnableFieldView) AS EnableFieldView
FROM dbo.vDDLHc
full OUTER JOIN dbo.vDDLH ON vDDLH.Lookup = vDDLHc.Lookup;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view merges all standard related forms definitions with non-duplicative custom related forms, using a UNION operation keyed on Form and Tab to eliminate overlaps. It delivers a unified, complete

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view lists DD security groups secured for specific object typesCanvas Templates ('T'), Queries ('M'), Attachments ('A'), Forms ('F'), and Reports ('R')filtered by the current user's company acc
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view DDSecurityGroupsSecured
output:
SELECT 'T' AS FormType, DDSG.Name, DDSG.SecurityGroup
FROM dbo.DDSG
LEFT JOIN dbo.vVPCanvasTemplateSecurity ON vVPCanvasTemplateSecurity.SecurityGroup = DDSG.SecurityGroup
LEFT JOIN dbo.vfVAGetCompaniesFormSecurityAccess(SUSER_SNAME(),'VPTemplateSecurity') a ON a.HQCo = vVPCanvasTemplateSecurity.Co
WHERE DDSG.GroupType = 2
    AND (a.HQCo IS NOT NULL OR vVPCanvasTemplateSecurity.SecurityGroup IS NULL)
UNION
SELECT 'M' AS FormType, DDSG.Name, DDSG.SecurityGroup
FROM dbo.DDSG
LEFT JOIN dbo.vVPQuerySecurity ON vVPQuerySecurity.SecurityGroup = DDSG.SecurityGroup
LEFT JOIN dbo.vfVAGetCompaniesFormSecurityAccess(SUSER_SNAME(),'VPQuerySecurity') a ON a.HQCo = vVPQuerySecurity.Co
WHERE DDSG.GroupType = 2
    AND (a.HQCo IS NOT NULL OR vVPQuerySecurity.SecurityGroup IS NULL)
UNION
SELECT 'A' AS FormType, DDSG.Name, DDSG.SecurityGroup
FROM dbo.DDSG
LEFT JOIN dbo.vVAAttachmentTypeSecurity ON vVAAttachmentTypeSecurity.SecurityGroup = DDSG.SecurityGroup
LEFT JOIN dbo.vfVAGetCompaniesFormSecurityAccess(SUSER_SNAME(),'VAAttachmentTypeSecurity') a ON a.HQCo = vVAAttachmentTypeSecurity.Co
WHERE DDSG.GroupType = 3
    AND (a.HQCo IS NOT NULL OR vVAAttachmentTypeSecurity.SecurityGroup IS NULL)
UNION
SELECT 'F' AS FormType, DDSG.Name, DDSG.SecurityGroup
FROM dbo.DDSG
LEFT JOIN dbo.vDDFS ON vDDFS.SecurityGroup = DDSG.SecurityGroup
LEFT JOIN dbo.vfVAGetCompaniesFormSecurityAccess(SUSER_SNAME(),'VADDFS') a ON a.HQCo = vDDFS.Co
WHERE DDSG.GroupType = 1
    AND (a.HQCo IS NOT NULL OR vDDFS.SecurityGroup IS NULL)
UNION
SELECT 'R' AS FormType, DDSG.Name, DDSG.SecurityGroup
FROM dbo.DDSG
LEFT JOIN dbo.vRPRS ON vRPRS.SecurityGroup = DDSG.SecurityGroup
LEFT JOIN dbo.vfVAGetCompaniesFormSecurityAccess(SUSER_SNAME(),'VARS') a ON a.HQCo = vRPRS.Co
WHERE DDSG.GroupType = 2
    AND (a.HQCo IS NOT NULL OR vRPRS.SecurityGroup IS NULL);

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view provides secure access to the DD Security List (vDDSLc) by selecting all its fields and augmenting with a derived Description from matching transaction headers. It checks if the TableName st
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view DDSLSecure
output:
SELECT vDDSLc.*, CASE substring(vDDSLc.TableName,1,3) WHEN 'bud' THEN bUDTH.Description ELSE vDDTH.Description END AS Description
FROM dbo.vDDSLc WITH (nolock)
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.vDDTH WITH (nolock) ON vDDTH.TableName = SUBSTRING(vDDSLc.TableName, 2, LEN(vDDTH.TableName))
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.bUDTH WITH (nolock) ON bUDTH.TableName = SUBSTRING(vDDSLc.TableName, 2, LEN(bUDTH.TableName));

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Combines standard and custom Data Dictionary Security List (DDSL) definitions for tables via full outer join, categorizing each as Standard, Override, or Custom based on presence in source views. Flag
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view DDSLShared
output:
SELECT a.*, CASE WHEN s.TABLE_NAME IS NULL THEN 'N'ELSE 'Y' END AS InUseState, dbo.vfVAViewGenViewOutOfSync(SUBSTRING(TableName, 2, LEN(TableName)), TableName) AS ViewIsOutOfSync
FROM (SELECT ISNULL(vDDSLc.TableName,vDDSL.TableName) AS TableName,
    ISNULL(vDDSLc.Datatype,vDDSL.Datatype) AS Datatype,
    ISNULL(vDDSLc.InstanceColumn,vDDSL.InstanceColumn) AS InstanceColumn,
    ISNULL(vDDSLc.QualifierColumn,vDDSL.QualifierColumn) AS QualifierColumn,
    ISNULL(vDDSLc.InUse, vDDSL.InUse) AS InUse,
    CASE WHEN vDDSLc.TableName IS NULL AND vDDSL.TableName IS NOT NULL THEN 'Standard'
    WHEN vDDSLc.TableName IS NOT NULL AND vDDSL.TableName IS NOT NULL THEN 'Override'
    WHEN vDDSLc.TableName IS NOT NULL AND vDDSL.TableName IS NULL THEN 'Custom' END AS Status
FROM dbo.vDDSLc (NOLOCK)
FULL OUTER JOIN dbo.vDDSL (NOLOCK) ON vDDSL.TableName = vDDSLc.TableName AND vDDSL.Datatype = vDDSLc.Datatype
    AND vDDSL.InstanceColumn = vDDSLc.InstanceColumn) a
LEFT OUTER JOIN INFORMATION_SCHEMA.VIEWS s WITH (nolock)
    ON s.TABLE_NAME = substring(a.TableName, 2, len(a.TableName))
    AND (
    ( CHARINDEX('vfDataTypeSecurity', s.VIEW_DEFINITION) > 0
    AND CHARINDEX(rtrim(ltrim(a.Datatype)),s.VIEW_DEFINITION,0) > 0
    AND CHARINDEX(rtrim(ltrim(a.InstanceColumn)),s.VIEW_DEFINITION,0) > 0
    )
    OR CHARINDEX('vfDataTypeSecurityPayrollEmployee', s.VIEW_DEFINITION) > 0
    )
LEFT OUTER JOIN INFORMATION_SCHEMA.VIEWS v WITH (NOLOCK)
    ON v.TABLE_NAME = s.TABLE_NAME
    AND CHARINDEX(RTRIM(LTRIM(a.Datatype)),v.VIEW_DEFINITION,0) > 0
    AND CHARINDEX(RTRIM(LTRIM(a.InstanceColumn)),v.VIEW_DEFINITION,0) > 0;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view merges standard and custom Document Management attachment types into a unified list, prioritizing custom overrides for names, descriptions, retention months, and security while providing loc
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view DMAttachmentTypesShared
output:
SELECT
    ISNULL(vDMAttachmentTypesCustom.AttachmentTypeID, DMAttachmentTypes.AttachmentTypeID) AS AttachmentTypeID,
    ISNULL(vDMAttachmentTypesCustom.Name, vDDTM.CultureText) AS Name,
    CASE WHEN vDMAttachmentTypesCustom.Name IS NULL THEN DMAttachmentTypes.Description ELSE vDMAttachmentTypesCustom.Description END AS Description,
    CASE WHEN vDMAttachmentTypesCustom.AttachmentTypeID IS NULL AND DMAttachmentTypes.AttachmentTypeID < 50000 THEN 'Standard'
    WHEN DMAttachmentTypes.AttachmentTypeID = vDMAttachmentTypesCustom.AttachmentTypeID THEN 'Override'
    WHEN vDMAttachmentTypesCustom.AttachmentTypeID > 50000 THEN 'Custom'
    ELSE '' END AS Status,
    ISNULL(vDMAttachmentTypesCustom.MonthsToRetain, NULL) AS MonthsToRetain,
    ISNULL(vDMAttachmentTypesCustom.Secured, 'Y') AS Secured
FROM dbo.DMAttachmentTypes
INNER JOIN dbo.vDDTM ON DMAttachmentTypes.TextID = vDDTM.TextID
FULL OUTER JOIN dbo.vDMAttachmentTypesCustom ON DMAttachmentTypes.AttachmentTypeID = vDMAttachmentTypesCustom.AttachmentTypeID
WHERE (DMAttachmentTypes.Active <> 'N') OR (vDMAttachmentTypesCustom.AttachmentTypeID IS NOT NULL);

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view provides core metadata for documents, combining title, sender display name, due date, document type name, creator, unique identifiers, and state from joined tables. It supports document trac

SELECT
    doc.Title,
    sndr.DisplayName,
    doc.DueDate,
    typ.DocumentTypeName,
    doc.CreatedByUser As CreatedBy,
    doc.KeyID,
    doc.DocumentId,
    doc.[State]
FROM [Document].[Document] doc
JOIN [Document].[DocumentType] typ
ON doc.DocumentTypeId=typ.DocumentTypeId
JOIN [Document].[Sender] sndr
ON doc.SenderId=sndr.SenderId;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view flattens XML-stored responses from document interactions into individual rows of field names and corresponding values, enabling relational querying of structured response data. It links each
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view DocumentResponseValue
output:
SELECT
    DocumentResponse.KeyID AS [Id],
    CAST(ResponseTable.Responses.query('local-name(.)') AS VARCHAR(50)) AS FieldName,
    ResponseTable.Responses.value('.', 'varchar(max)') AS ResponseValue,
    ParticipantId,
    DocumentId,
    DocumentResponseId,
    Processed
FROM Document.DocumentResponse
CROSS APPLY Response.nodes('/*/*') as ResponseTable(Responses);

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view provides equipment fuel transaction details from batch files, including batch identifiers, equipment usage metrics (units, hours, meters, odometer), costs, job/phase allocations, GL accounts
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view EMBFFuelInit
output:
SELECT
    EMBF.Co,
    EMBF.Mth,
    EMBF.BatchId,
    EMBF.BatchSeq,
    EMBF.Source,
    EMBF.Equipment,
    EMBF.RevCode,
    EMBF.EMTrans,
    EMBF.BatchTransType,
    EMBF.EMTransType,
    EMBF.ComponentTypeCode,
    EMBF.Component,
    EMBF.Asset,
    EMBF.EMGroup,
    EMBF.CostCode,
    EMBF.EMCostType,
    EMBF.ActualDate,
    EMBF.Description,
    EMBF.GLCo,
    EMBF.GLTransAcct,
    EMBF.GLOffsetAcct,
    EMBF.MatlGroup,
    EMBF.INCo,
    EMBF.INLocation,
    EMBF.Material,
    EMBF.UM,
    EMBF.Units,
    EMBF.Dollars,
    EMBF.UnitPrice,
    EMBF.Hours,
    EMBF.PerECM,
    EMBF.TotalCost,
    EMBF.JCCo,
    EMBF.Job,
    EMBF.PhaseGrp,
    EMBF.JCPhase,
    EMBF.JCCostType,
    EMBF.OffsetGLCo,
    EMBF.MeterTrans,
    EMBF.MeterReadDate,
    EMBF.ReplacedHourReading,
    EMBF.CurrentHourMeter,
    EMBF.CurrentTotalHourMeter,
    EMBF.ReplacedOdoReading,
    EMBF.CurrentOdometer,
    EMBF.CurrentTotalOdometer,
    EMBF.MeterMiles,
    EMBF.MeterHrs,
    EMBF.TaxType,
    EMBF.TaxCode,
    EMBF.TaxGroup,
    EMBF.TaxBasis,
    EMBF.TaxRate,
    EMBF.TaxAmount,
    EMBF.UniqueAttchID,
    EMEM.JCCo AS EMEMJCCo,
    EMEM.Job AS EMEMJob,
    EMEM.Location AS EMEMLocation,
    EMEM.Category AS EMEMCategory,
    EMEM.Department AS EMEMDepartment,
    EMEM.Shop AS EMEMShop
FROM dbo.EMBF WITH (nolock)
JOIN dbo.EMEM WITH (nolock) ON EMBF.Co = EMEM.EMCo AND EMBF.Equipment = EMEM.Equipment;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view lists company, month, and batch ID for headquarters batches sourced from Equipment Management adjustments (EMAdj) that contain fuel transactions in the EM batch file. It performs a left join
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view EMBZGrid
output:
SELECT TOP 100 percent HQBC.Co, HQBC.Mth, HQBC.BatchId
FROM dbo.HQBC
LEFT JOIN dbo.EMBF
    ON HQBC.Co=EMBF.Co
    AND HQBC.Mth = EMBF.Mth
    AND HQBC.BatchId = EMBF.BatchId
WHERE HQBC.Source = 'EMAdj' AND EMBF.EMTransType = 'Fuel'
ORDER BY HQBC.Co, HQBC.Mth, HQBC.BatchId;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view compiles company code column mappings from distribution and audit tables configured for batch equipment changes in Equipment Management. It identifies standard 'co' columns directly and tran
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view EMChangeBatchCol
output:
SELECT
    EMChangeEquipCol.ViewpointDB,
    EMChangeEquipCol.VPTableName,
    EMChangeEquipCol.VPColumnName,
    VPEMCo=NULL,
    VPCo=c.COLUMN_NAME
FROM dbo.EMChangeEquipCol WITH(nolock)
INNER JOIN INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS c (NOLOCK) ON c.TABLE_CATALOG=EMChangeEquipCol.ViewpointDB AND c.TABLE_NAME = EMChangeEquipCol.VPTableName
WHERE EMChangeEquipCol.VPColType IN ('Standard','Custom Field') AND EMChangeEquipCol.VPTableType IN('Audit','Dist')
AND c.DOMAIN_NAME IN('bCompany') AND lower(c.COLUMN_NAME)IN('co')
AND EMChangeEquipCol.VPTableName NOT IN ('PRRB','PRJC','PREM')
UNION ALL
SELECT EMChangeEquipCol.ViewpointDB,EMChangeEquipCol.VPTableName,EMChangeEquipCol.VPColumnName,VPEMCo=NULL,
VPCo=CASE LEFT(EMChangeEquipCol.VPTableName,2)
    WHEN 'PR' THEN 'PRCo'
    WHEN 'PO' THEN 'POCo'
    WHEN 'MS' THEN 'MSCo'
    WHEN 'EM' THEN 'EMCo'
    WHEN 'AR' THEN 'ARCo'
    WHEN 'AP' THEN 'APCo'
END
FROM dbo.EMChangeEquipCol WITH(nolock)
INNER JOIN INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS c (NOLOCK) ON c.TABLE_CATALOG=EMChangeEquipCol.ViewpointDB AND c.TABLE_NAME = EMChangeEquipCol.VPTableName
WHERE EMChangeEquipCol.VPColType IN ('Standard','Custom Field') AND EMChangeEquipCol.VPTableType IN('Dist')
AND c.DOMAIN_NAME IN('bCompany') AND lower(c.COLUMN_NAME)IN('emco')
AND EMChangeEquipCol.VPTableName NOT IN ('PRRB','PRJC','PREM','PRER');

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view consolidates equipment management change batch data by Viewpoint database, table name, column name, and equipment company, deriving the minimum associated company code via aggregation.
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view EMChangeBatchList
output:
SELECT
    EMChangeBatchEquipEMCoCol.ViewpointDB,
    EMChangeBatchEquipEMCoCol.VPTableName,
    EMChangeBatchEquipEMCoCol.VPColumnName,
    EMChangeBatchEquipEMCoCol.VPEMCo,
    Co=Min(EMChangeBatchCol.VPCo)
FROM dbo.EMChangeBatchEquipEMCoCol
INNER JOIN dbo.EMChangeBatchCol ON EMChangeBatchEquipEMCoCol.ViewpointDB=EMChangeBatchCol.ViewpointDB AND EMChangeBatchEquipEMCoCol.VPTableName=EMChangeBatchCol.VPTableName
AND EMChangeBatchEquipEMCoCol.VPColumnName=EMChangeBatchCol.VPColumnName
GROUP BY EMChangeBatchEquipEMCoCol.ViewpointDB,EMChangeBatchEquipEMCoCol.VPTableName,EMChangeBatchEquipEMCoCol.VPColumnName,EMChangeBatchEquipEMCoCol.VPEMCo;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Lists equipment-related columns (DOMAIN_NAME='bEquip') from Equipment Management views, excluding EMEM, EMEH, and EMED, with table types (e.g., Maint) and column type classifications (Standard if Seq<
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view EMChangeEquipCol
output:
SELECT DISTINCT
    ViewpointDB = t.TABLE_CATALOG,
    VPTableType = ISNULL(DDTH.TableType, 'Maint'),
    VPTableName = t.TABLE_NAME,
    VPColumnName=c.COLUMN_NAME,
    VPColType = CASE WHEN ISNULL(DDFIShared.Seq, 0) < 5000 THEN
    'Standard'
    ELSE
    CASE WHEN UDTH.TableName IS NOT NULL THEN
    'User Database'
    ELSE
    'Custom Field'
    END
    END
FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLES t WITH (NOLOCK)
INNER JOIN INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS c (NOLOCK)ON c.TABLE_NAME = t.TABLE_NAME AND c.TABLE_CATALOG = t.TABLE_CATALOG
LEFT JOIN dbo.DDTH WITH (NOLOCK) ON DDTH.TableName = t.TABLE_NAME
LEFT JOIN dbo.DDFIShared WITH (NOLOCK) ON DDFIShared.ViewName = c.TABLE_NAME AND DDFIShared.ColumnName = c.COLUMN_NAME
LEFT JOIN dbo.UDTH WITH (NOLOCK) ON UDTH.TableName = t.TABLE_NAME
WHERE t.TABLE_TYPE = 'VIEW'
    AND t.TABLE_NAME NOT IN ('EMEM','EMEH','EMED')
    AND (DDTH.TableType NOT IN ('VIEW') OR UDTH.TableName IS NOT NULL)
    AND c.DOMAIN_NAME = 'bEquip';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view extracts metadata for columns in bCompany tables that store Equipment Management Company (EMCo), OldEMCo, or Co values, excluding audit and view tables. It standardizes column names by mappi
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view EMChangeEquipEMCoCol
output:
SELECT DISTINCT
    EMChangeEquipCol.ViewpointDB,
    EMChangeEquipCol.VPTableName,
    EMChangeEquipCol.VPColumnName,
    VPEMCo = CASE WHEN c.DOMAIN_NAME = 'bCompany' THEN
    CASE WHEN EMChangeEquipCol.VPColumnName LIKE '%UsedOn%' THEN
    'UsedOnEquipCo'
    ELSE
    c.COLUMN_NAME
    END
    ELSE
    NULL
    END,
    EMChangeEquipCol.VPColType
FROM dbo.EMChangeEquipCol WITH (NOLOCK)
INNER JOIN INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS c WITH (NOLOCK) ON c.TABLE_NAME = EMChangeEquipCol.VPTableName AND c.TABLE_CATALOG = EMChangeEquipCol.ViewpointDB
LEFT JOIN dbo.DDFIShared WITH (NOLOCK) ON DDFIShared.ViewName = c.TABLE_NAME AND DDFIShared.ColumnName = c.COLUMN_NAME
WHERE EMChangeEquipCol.VPTableType NOT IN ('Audit','VIEW')
    AND c.DOMAIN_NAME IN('bCompany')AND LOWER(c.COLUMN_NAME) IN ('emco','oldemco','co');

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides equipment location history records with the immediately prior and next location assignments (job, cost company, location) based on datetime sequence per equipment item and company. Uses OUTER
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view EMLocationHistoryPriorNext
output:
SELECT
    EMLocationHistory_1.EMCo AS [EMCo],
    EMLocationHistory_1.Equipment AS [Equipment],
    EMLocationHistory_1.DateTimeIn AS [DateTimeIn],
    CONVERT(VARCHAR(30), PRIOR.DateTimeIn, 100) AS [PriorDateTimeIn],
    PRIOR.ToJCCo AS [PriorToJCCo],
    PRIOR.ToJob AS [PriorToJob],
    PRIOR.ToLocation AS [PriorToLocation],
    CONVERT(VARCHAR(30), NEXT.DateTimeIn, 100) AS [NextDateTimeIn],
    NEXT.ToJCCo AS [NextToJCCo],
    NEXT.ToJob AS [NextToJob],
    NEXT.ToLocation AS [NextToLocation]
FROM dbo.EMLocationHistory AS EMLocationHistory_1
    OUTER APPLY (SELECT TOP 1 EMLocationHistory_2.ToJCCo, EMLocationHistory_2.ToJob, EMLocationHistory_2.ToLocation, EMLocationHistory_2.DateTimeIn
FROM dbo.EMLocationHistory AS EMLocationHistory_2
WHERE EMLocationHistory_2.EMCo = EMLocationHistory_1.EMCo
    AND EMLocationHistory_2.Equipment = EMLocationHistory_1.Equipment
    AND EMLocationHistory_2.DateTimeIn < EMLocationHistory_1.DateTimeIn
ORDER BY EMLocationHistory_2.EMCo,
    EMLocationHistory_2.Equipment,
    EMLocationHistory_2.DateTimeIn DESC
    ) PRIOR
    OUTER APPLY (SELECT TOP 1 EMLocationHistory_3.ToJCCo, EMLocationHistory_3.ToJob, EMLocationHistory_3.ToLocation, EMLocationHistory_3.DateTimeIn
FROM dbo.EMLocationHistory AS EMLocationHistory_3
WHERE EMLocationHistory_3.EMCo = EMLocationHistory_1.EMCo
    AND EMLocationHistory_3.Equipment = EMLocationHistory_1.Equipment
    AND EMLocationHistory_3.DateTimeIn > EMLocationHistory_1.DateTimeIn
ORDER BY EMLocationHistory_3.EMCo,
    EMLocationHistory_3.Equipment,
    EMLocationHistory_3.DateTimeIn ASC
    ) NEXT;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides unified revenue breakdown data for Equipment Management categories and equipment, including rates, revenue breakdown codes, categories/equipment identifiers, revenue codes, and descriptions.
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view EMRevBdownCategEquip
output:
SELECT
    EMBG.Rate,
    EMBG.RevBdownCode,
    [Description]=IsNull(EMBG.Description,EMRT.Description),
    EMBG.Category,
    [CatDesc]=EMCM.Description,
    [Type]='C',
    EMBG.RevCode,
    [RevCodeDesc]=EMRC.Description,
    [Equipment]=NULL,
    [EquipDesc]=NULL,
    EMBG.EMCo,
    EMBG.EMGroup
FROM dbo.EMBG WITH(nolock)
INNER JOIN dbo.EMRT WITH(nolock)ON EMRT.EMGroup=EMBG.EMGroup AND EMRT.RevBdownCode=EMBG.RevBdownCode
INNER JOIN dbo.EMRC WITH(nolock)ON EMRC.EMGroup=EMBG.EMGroup AND EMRC.RevCode=EMBG.RevCode
INNER JOIN dbo.EMCM WITH(nolock)ON EMCM.EMCo=EMBG.EMCo AND EMCM.Category=EMBG.Category
UNION ALL
SELECT EMBE.Rate,EMBE.RevBdownCode,IsNull(EMBE.Description,EMRT.Description),
EMEM.Category,EMCM.Description,'E',EMBE.RevCode,EMRC.Description,
EMBE.Equipment,EMEM.Description,EMBE.EMCo,EMBE.EMGroup
FROM dbo.EMBE WITH(nolock)
INNER JOIN dbo.EMRT WITH(nolock)ON EMRT.EMGroup=EMBE.EMGroup AND EMRT.RevBdownCode=EMBE.RevBdownCode
INNER JOIN dbo.EMEM WITH(nolock)ON EMBE.EMCo=EMEM.EMCo AND EMBE.Equipment=EMEM.Equipment
LEFT JOIN dbo.EMCM WITH(nolock)ON EMEM.EMCo=EMCM.EMCo AND EMEM.Category=EMCM.Category
INNER JOIN dbo.EMRC WITH(nolock)ON EMRC.EMGroup=EMBE.EMGroup AND EMRC.RevCode=EMBE.RevCode
WHERE IsNull(EMEM.Category,'') <> '';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view aggregates equipment meter readings to provide the maximum end odometer value for each company, equipment, and reading date combination. It identifies the highest EndOdo recorded on a specif
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view EMSMLastReadDateEndOdo
output:
SELECT
    Co,
    Equipment,
    ReadingDate,
    LastEndOdo =Max(EndOdo)
FROM dbo.EMSM WITH(nolock)
GROUP BY Co,Equipment,ReadingDate;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides company code, equipment identifier, last meter reading date, and end odometer reading (defaulted to 0 if null) from the specific reading matching the last date.
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view EMSMMaxReadingDateEndOdo
output:
SELECT
    EMSMLastReadDate.Co,
    EMSMLastReadDate.Equipment,
    EMSMLastReadDate.LastReadingDate,
    EndOdo=IsNull(EMSMLastReadDateEndOdo.LastEndOdo,0)
FROM dbo.EMSMLastReadDate WITH(nolock)
INNER JOIN dbo.EMSMLastReadDateEndOdo WITH(nolock)ON EMSMLastReadDateEndOdo.Co=EMSMLastReadDate.Co AND EMSMLastReadDateEndOdo.Equipment=EMSMLastReadDate.Equipment
    AND EMSMLastReadDateEndOdo.ReadingDate=EMSMLastReadDate.LastReadingDate;
