instruction: Write a SQL query to: Retrieves standard maintenance group notes linked to equipment or components on work orders via work instructions. Uses UNION ALL to provide notes separately for equipment (Type='E') and components (T
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view EMWHStdMaintGroupNotes
output:
SELECT DISTINCT
    EMWI.EMCo,
    EMWI.WorkOrder,
    EMWI.Equipment,
    EquipOrComp=EMWI.Equipment,
    EMEM.Type,
    EMWI.StdMaintGroup,
    Notes=CONVERT(varchar(max),EMSH.Notes)
FROM dbo.EMWI WITH(nolock)
INNER JOIN dbo.EMSH WITH(nolock)ON EMSH.EMCo=EMWI.EMCo AND EMSH.Equipment = EMWI.Equipment AND EMSH.StdMaintGroup=EMWI.StdMaintGroup
INNER JOIN dbo.EMEM WITH(nolock)ON EMEM.EMCo=EMWI.EMCo AND EMEM.Equipment = EMWI.Equipment
INNER JOIN dbo.EMWH WITH(nolock)ON EMWH.EMCo=EMWI.EMCo AND EMWH.WorkOrder = EMWI.WorkOrder AND EMWH.Equipment = EMWI.Equipment
WHERE EMEM.Type = 'E'
UNION ALL
SELECT DISTINCT EMWI.EMCo,EMWI.WorkOrder,EMWI.Equipment,EquipOrComp=EMWI.Component,EMEM.Type,EMWI.StdMaintGroup,Notes=CONVERT(varchar(Max),EMSH.Notes)
FROM dbo.EMWI WITH(nolock)
INNER JOIN dbo.EMSH WITH(nolock)ON EMSH.EMCo=EMWI.EMCo AND EMSH.Equipment = EMWI.Component AND EMSH.StdMaintGroup=EMWI.StdMaintGroup
INNER JOIN dbo.EMEM WITH(nolock)ON EMSH.EMCo=EMWI.EMCo AND EMSH.Equipment = EMWI.Component
INNER JOIN dbo.EMWH WITH(nolock)ON EMWH.EMCo=EMWI.EMCo AND EMWH.WorkOrder = EMWI.WorkOrder AND EMWH.Equipment = EMWI.Equipment
WHERE EMEM.Type = 'C';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view delivers core enterprise company data, including company identifiers, names, and submittal review day thresholds for responsible, approving, and requesting firms. It consolidates project man
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view EnterpriseCompany
output:
SELECT
    [pmco].[KeyID] as [Id],
    [pmco].[PMCo] as [CompanyCode],
    [hqco].[Name] as [Name],
    [pmco].[SubmittalReviewDaysResponsibleFirm] as [ReviewedByDateReviewDayCount],
    [pmco].[SubmittalReviewDaysApprovingFirm] as [ApprovedByDateReviewDayCount],
    [pmco].[SubmittalReviewDaysRequestingFirm] as [SubmittedByDateReviewDayCount],
    [ourFirm].KeyID as DefaultRequestingFirmId
FROM [dbo].[PMCO] [pmco]
JOIN [dbo].[HQCO] [hqco] ON [hqco].[HQCo] = [pmco].[PMCo]
LEFT JOIN [dbo].[PMFM] ourFirm on ourFirm.FirmNumber = pmco.OurFirm and ourFirm.VendorGroup = pmco.VendorGroup;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Aggregates job progress metrics by company, job, phase group, phase, cost type, unit measure, type, month, and actual date, providing earned hours (calculated as unit-based percentage complete times p
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view EVEarnedAndActualHours
output:
SELECT
    [JCCo],
    [Job],
    [PhaseGroup],
    [Phase],
    [CostType],
    [UM],
    [Type],
    [MTH],
    [ActualDate],
    sum([ProgressCmplt])*100 AS [ProgressCmplt],
    CASE WHEN sum([ProjUnits]) = 0 THEN 0 ELSE sum([ActualUnits])/sum([ProjUnits])*100 END AS [CalcPerc],
    CASE WHEN sum([ProjUnits])=0 THEN 0 ELSE (sum([ActualUnits])/sum([ProjUnits]))*sum([ProjHours]) END AS [EarnedHours],
    sum([ActualHours]) AS [ActualHours],
    sum([ProjHours]) AS [ProjHours],
    sum([OrigEstUnits]) AS [OrigEstUnits],
    sum([CurrEstUnits]) AS [CurrEstUnits],
    sum([ActualUnits]) AS [ActualUnits],
    sum([ProjUnits]) AS [ProjUnits],
    sum([PendEstUnits]) AS [PendEstUnits],
    sum([AppEstUnits]) AS [AppEstUnits]
FROM [EVJobAnalysisQuery]
GROUP BY [JCCo]
    ,[Job]
    ,[PhaseGroup]
    ,[Phase]
    ,[CostType]
    ,[UM]
    ,[Type]
    ,[MTH]
    ,[ActualDate];

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view aggregates projected units, actual units, and projected hours from the EVJobAnalysisQuery, grouped by company, job, phase group, phase, cost type, unit of measure, and actual date. It delive
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view EVEarnedProjAndActualUnits
output:
SELECT
    [JCCo],
    [Job],
    [PhaseGroup],
    [Phase],
    [CostType],
    [UM],
    [ActualDate],
    sum([ProjUnits]) AS [ProjUnits],
    sum([ActualUnits]) AS [ActualUnits],
    sum([ProjHours]) AS [ProjHours]
FROM[EVJobAnalysisQuery]
GROUP BY [JCCo]
    ,[Job]
    ,[PhaseGroup]
    ,[Phase]
    ,[CostType]
    ,[UM]
    ,[ActualDate];

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view delivers detailed job cost performance data across original estimates, current estimates, actuals, remaining commitments, projections, and pending change order (PCO) impacts, segmented by jo
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view EVJobAnalysisQuery
output:
SELECT
    [JCCo],
    [Job],
    [PhaseGroup],
    [Phase],
    [CostType],
    [Type],
    [MTH],
    [ActualDate],
    [Source],
    [ProgressCmplt],
    [UM],
    [ItemUnitFlag],
    [PhaseUnitFlag],
    [Plugged],
    [OrigEstUnits],
    [OrigEstCost],
    [OrigEstHours],
    [CurrEstCost],
    [CurrEstHours],
    CASE WHEN [CurrEstUnits] = 0 THEN [OrigEstUnits] ELSE 0 END AS [CurrEstUnits],
    [ActualCost],
    [ActualHours],
    [ActualUnits],
    [RemainCmtdCost],
    [RemainCmtdUnits],
    [TotalCmtdCost],
    [TotalCmtdUnits],
    [ProjCost],
    [ProjHours],
    [ProjPlug],
    [ProjUnits],
    [LastProjDate],
    [ProjNotes],
    [PMOL.ACO],
    [PMOL.ACOItem],
    [AppEstHours],
    [AppHourCost],
    [AppEstCostChg],
    [PMOI.Approved],
    [PCOType],
    [PMOL.PCO],
    [PMOL.PCOItem],
    [PendEstHours],
    [PendHourCost],
    [PendEstCostChg],
    [AddOn],
    [AddOnPhase],
    [AddOnAmount],
    [UniqueAttchID],
    [PendEstUnits],
    [AppEstUnits],
    [PCOAddToCurEst],
    [PCOStatus],
    [PCOInclCurEstHours],
    [PCOInclCurEstCost],
    [PCOExclCurEstHours],
    [PCOExclCurEstCost]
FROM [EVJobAnalysisQueryInitialize];

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view provides GL Year Budget records limited to fiscal periods up to the last closed GL month per company, excluding header accounts by joining to the GL account master.
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view GLYBClosedNoHeaders
output:
SELECT GLYB.*
FROM dbo.GLYB
INNER JOIN dbo.bGLAC
    ON GLYB.GLAcct = bGLAC.GLAcct AND GLYB.GLCo = bGLAC.GLCo
WHERE GLYB.FYEMO <= (SELECT LastMthGLClsd
FROM dbo.bGLCO
WHERE bGLCO.GLCo=GLYB.GLCo) AND bGLAC.AcctType <> 'H';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view unions company records from HQ, Job Costing (JC), Inventory (IN), Equipment Management (EM), Service Ledger (SL), and General Ledger (GL) modules, linking each to a central HQ company via jo
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view HQApprovalModuleCompany
output:
SELECT 'HQ' AS [Mod], HQCo AS [Co], [Name]
FROM HQCO
UNION ALL
SELECT 'JC' AS [Mod]
    ,JCCo AS [Co]
    ,[Name]
FROM JCCO
JOIN HQCO WITH(NOLOCK)
    ON JCCO.JCCo = HQCO.HQCo
UNION ALL
SELECT 'IN' AS [Mod]
    ,INCo AS [Co]
    ,[Name]
FROM INCO
JOIN HQCO WITH(NOLOCK)
    ON INCO.INCo = HQCO.HQCo
UNION ALL
SELECT 'EM' AS [Mod]
    ,EMCo AS [Co]
    ,[Name]
FROM EMCO
JOIN HQCO WITH(NOLOCK)
    ON EMCO.EMCo = HQCO.HQCo
UNION ALL
SELECT 'SL' AS [Mod]
    ,SLCo AS [Co]
    ,[Name]
FROM SLCO
JOIN HQCO WITH(NOLOCK)
    ON SLCO.SLCo = HQCO.HQCo
UNION ALL
SELECT 'GL' AS [Mod]
    ,GLCo AS [Co]
    ,[Name]
FROM GLCO
JOIN HQCO WITH(NOLOCK)
    ON GLCO.GLCo = HQCO.HQCo;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view combines HQ batch distribution headers with job cost entry details and flattens embedded DistributionXML into individual GL transaction rows, extracting JCCostTransaction and GLDistributionI
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view HQBatchDistributionGLEntryTransaction
output:
SELECT
    vHQBatchDistribution.Co,
    vHQBatchDistribution.Mth,
    vHQBatchDistribution.BatchId,
    vJCCostEntry.*,
    JCCostEntryTransaction.value('./@JCCostTransaction','int') JCCostTransaction,
    JCCostEntryTransaction.value('./@GLDistributionID','bigint') GLDistributionID
FROM dbo.vHQBatchDistribution
INNER JOIN dbo.vJCCostEntry ON vHQBatchDistribution.HQBatchDistributionID = vJCCostEntry.HQBatchDistributionID
    CROSS APPLY DistributionXML.nodes('/JCCostEntryTransaction') JCCostEntryTransactions(JCCostEntryTransaction);

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view retrieves AuditIDs from HQSA for records tied to secure ('Y') and in-use ('Y') data dictionary tables where an Instance exists but the current user (via SUSER_NAME()) has no matching permiss
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view HQSAExclusions
output:
SELECT HQSA.AuditID
FROM dbo.HQSA
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.DDDTShared
    ON HQSA.Datatype = DDDTShared.Datatype
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.DDSLShared
    ON HQSA.TableName = DDSLShared.TableName
    AND HQSA.Datatype = DDSLShared.Datatype
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.DDDU
    ON HQSA.Datatype = DDDU.Datatype
    AND HQSA.Qualifier = DDDU.Qualifier
    AND HQSA.Instance = DDDU.Instance
    AND SUSER_NAME() = DDDU.VPUserName
WHERE HQSA.Instance IS NOT NULL
    AND DDDU.VPUserName IS NULL
    AND DDSLShared.InUse = 'Y'
    AND DDDTShared.Secure = 'Y';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides HQ workflow field configurations enriched with template types, linked document object tables, and underlying database column metadata such as numeric precision and domain names.
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view HQWFGrid
output:
SELECT
    HQWF.*,
    HQWD.TemplateType,
    HQWO.ObjectTable,
    i.NUMERIC_PRECISION,
    i.DOMAIN_NAME
FROM dbo.HQWF
JOIN dbo.HQWD ON HQWD.TemplateName=HQWF.TemplateName
JOIN dbo.HQWO ON HQWO.TemplateType=HQWD.TemplateType AND HQWO.DocObject=HQWF.DocObject
JOIN INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS i ON i.TABLE_NAME = HQWO.ObjectTable AND i.COLUMN_NAME=HQWF.ColumnName;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view delivers core workplace accident records enriched with descriptive labels for body parts and injury types from the HR code master. It links accident identifiers (company, accident number, se
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view HRADMAIN
output:
SELECT
    HRAD.HRCo AS 'HRCo',
    HRAD.Accident AS 'Accident',
    HRAD.Seq AS 'Seq',
    BodyPart = HRAD.BodyPart,
    BodyDesc = bHRCM_1.Description,
    InjuryType = HRAD.InjuryType,
    InjuryDesc = bHRCM_2.Description
FROM dbo.HRAD WITH (nolock)
JOIN dbo.bHRCM AS bHRCM_1 WITH (nolock) ON bHRCM_1.HRCo = HRAD.HRCo AND bHRCM_1.Code = HRAD.BodyPart
JOIN dbo.bHRCM AS bHRCM_2 WITH (nolock) ON bHRCM_2.HRCo = HRAD.HRCo AND bHRCM_2.Code = HRAD.InjuryType
WHERE bHRCM_1.Type = 'B' AND bHRCM_2.Type = 'I';

    ThirdPartyAddress,
    ThirdPartyCity,

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view provides HR accident details filtered for accident type 'R' (e.g., road incidents) where an HR reference exists, joining header and incident records. It includes accident identifiers, dates,
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view HRATbyHRRef

SELECT
    dbo.HRAT.HRCo,
    dbo.HRAI.HRRef,
    dbo.HRAI.AccidentType,
    dbo.HRAT.Accident,
    dbo.HRAI.Seq,
    dbo.HRAT.AccidentDate,
    dbo.HRAI.AccidentCode,
    dbo.HRAI.PreventableYN,
    dbo.HRAI.Type,
    dbo.HRAI.IllnessInjuryDesc,
    dbo.HRAI.Cause,
    dbo.HRAT.EmployerPremYN,
    dbo.HRAT.JobSiteYN
FROM dbo.HRAT
INNER JOIN dbo.HRAI ON dbo.HRAT.HRCo = dbo.HRAI.HRCo AND dbo.HRAT.Accident = dbo.HRAI.Accident AND dbo.HRAI.AccidentType = 'R' AND
    dbo.HRAI.HRRef IS NOT NULL;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view enriches HRBI records with descriptive text for Earnings, Deduction, and Labor payroll elements based on EDLType and EDLCode. It performs conditional left joins to PRDL for Deduction ('D') a
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view HRBIMAIN
output:
SELECT
    'EDLType' = HRBI.EDLType,
    'EDLCode' = HRBI.EDLCode,
    'PRDLDesc1' = PRDL_1.Description,
    'PRDLDesc2' = PRDL_2.Description,
    'PREDDesc' = PREC.Description
FROM dbo.HRBI
LEFT JOIN dbo.PRDL AS PRDL_1 ON HRBI.HRCo = PRDL_1.PRCo AND HRBI.EDLCode = PRDL_1.DLCode AND HRBI.EDLType = 'D'
LEFT JOIN dbo.PRDL AS PRDL_2 ON HRBI.HRCo = PRDL_2.PRCo AND HRBI.EDLCode = PRDL_2.DLCode AND HRBI.EDLType = 'L'
LEFT JOIN dbo.PREC ON HRBI.HRCo = PREC.PRCo AND HRBI.EDLCode = PREC.EarnCode AND HRBI.EDLType = 'E';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides HR processing header records linking HR and payroll companies, with employee or HR reference identifiers, status, error messages, and a formatted full name resolved from either HR reference m
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view HRHPGrid
output:
SELECT
    bHRHP.HRCo,
    bHRHP.PRCo,
    bHRHP.Employee,
    bHRHP.HRRef,
    CASE bHRHP.UpdateOpt WHEN 'H' THEN bHRRM.LastName + ',
    ' + bHRRM.FirstName + ' ' + isnull(bHRRM.MiddleName, '')
    WHEN 'P' THEN bPREH.LastName + ',
    ' + bPREH.FirstName + ' ' + isnull(bPREH.MidName, '') END AS 'Name',
    bHRHP.Status,
    bHRHP.ErrMsg
FROM dbo.bHRHP WITH (nolock)
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.bHRRM WITH (nolock) ON bHRHP.HRCo = bHRRM.HRCo AND bHRHP.HRRef = bHRRM.HRRef
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.bPREH WITH (nolock) ON bHRHP.PRCo = bPREH.PRCo AND bHRHP.Employee = bPREH.Employee;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view unions resource master records with their dependents, presenting the resource itself as Seq=0 with 'Resource' relationship alongside actual dependents (Seq<>0) with their specific relationsh
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view HRRMHRDP
output:
SELECT
    HRCo,
    HRRef,
    0 AS Seq,
    LastName,
    HRRM.Suffix,
    HRRM.FirstName,
    HRRM.MiddleName,
    'Resource' AS 'Relationship'
FROM dbo.HRRM WITH (nolock)
UNION
SELECT HRRM.HRCo, HRRM.HRRef, HRDP.Seq, HRDP.Name AS 'LastName', HRDP.Suffix, HRDP.FirstName, HRDP.MiddleName,HRDP.Relationship
FROM dbo.HRDP WITH (nolock)
INNER JOIN dbo.HRRM WITH (nolock) ON HRDP.HRCo = HRRM.HRCo AND HRDP.HRRef = HRRM.HRRef AND HRDP.Seq <> 0;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view provides HR company code, resource reference, and a standardized full name for HR resources from the base HR resource master table. It constructs the full name by concatenating last name, op
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view HRRMName
output:
SELECT TOP 100 percent HRCo, HRRef, (CASE WHEN Suffix IS NULL THEN isnull(LastName, '') + ', ' + isnull(FirstName, '') + ' ' + isnull(MiddleName, '')
    ELSE isnull(LastName, '') + ' ' + Suffix + ', ' + isnull(FirstName,'') + ' ' + isnull(MiddleName,'') END) AS FullName
FROM dbo.bHRRM WITH (nolock)
ORDER BY HRCo, HRRef;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view delivers a flattened detail set of import worksheet entries by unioning main records lacking notes (via anti-join exclusion) with all associated note records, flagged distinctly by IsNote. I
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view IMWEDetail
output:
SELECT
    CAST(IMWE.UploadVal AS VARCHAR(MAX)) AS UploadVal,
    CAST(IMWE.ImportedVal AS VARCHAR(MAX)) AS ImportedVal,
    IMWE.Identifier,
    IMWE.ImportId,
    'N' AS IsNote,
    IMWE.ImportTemplate,
    IMWE.RecordType,
    IMWE.Form,
    IMWE.RecordSeq
FROM dbo.IMWE
LEFT JOIN dbo.IMWENotes ON IMWE.ImportId = IMWENotes.ImportId AND IMWE.ImportTemplate=IMWENotes.ImportTemplate AND IMWE.Identifier = IMWENotes.Identifier AND IMWE.RecordSeq = IMWENotes.RecordSeq AND IMWE.RecordType = IMWENotes.RecordType
WHERE IMWENotes.RecordSeq IS NULL
    UNION ALL
    SELECT UploadVal, ImportedVal, Identifier, ImportId, 'Y' AS IsNote, ImportTemplate, RecordType, Form, RecordSeq
FROM IMWENotes;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view aggregates project management issue details from PMIM, including issue numbers, descriptions, creation/resolution dates, references, notes, and quantified schedule/cost impacts. It maps issu
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view Issue
output:
SELECT
    PMIM.[KeyID] AS [IssueId],
    [ge].[GlobalEntityId],
    [ge].[BusinessUnitId],
    PMCO.[KeyID] AS [CompanyId],
    JCJM.[KeyID] AS [ProjectId],
    PMDT.[KeyID] AS [DocumentTypeId],
    [responsibleContact].[GlobalUserId] as [ResponsibleGlobalUserId],
    [authorContact].[GlobalUserId] as [AuthorGlobalUserId],
    PMIM.[Issue] AS [IssueNumber],
    PMIM.[Description] AS [Title],
    PMIM.[IssueInfo] AS [Description],
    PMIM.[DateInitiated] as [CreatedDateTime],
    PMIM.[DateResolved] As [CompletedDate],
    PMIM.[Reference] AS [Reference],
    PMIM.[Notes] AS [Notes],
    [dbo].[vfBYNToBit](PMIM.[DaysImpactYN]) AS [IsScheduleImpact],
    [dbo].[vfBYNToBit](PMIM.[CostImpactYN]) AS [IsCostImpact],
    PMIM.[DescImpact] AS [ImpactDescription],
    PMIM.[DaysImpact] AS [ScheduleImpactNumeric],
    PMIM.[CostImpact] AS [CostImpactNumeric]
FROM dbo.PMIM
JOIN api.vGlobalEntityMap ge on ge.LocalEntityId = PMIM.KeyID and ge.GlobalEntityTypeId = 5
JOIN api.BusinessUnitPMCO bu on bu.BusinessUnitId = ge.BusinessUnitId
JOIN dbo.PMCO ON PMIM.[PMCo] = PMCO.[PMCo]
JOIN dbo.JCJM ON PMIM.PMCo = JCJM.JCCo AND PMIM.Project = JCJM.[Job]
LEFT JOIN dbo.PMDT ON PMDT.[DocCategory] = 'ISSUE' AND PMDT.[DocType] = PMIM.[Type]
LEFT JOIN [api].[GlobalProjectContact] responsibleContact ON responsibleContact.ProjectId = JCJM.KeyID AND responsibleContact.FirmNumber = PMIM.FirmNumber
    AND responsibleContact.ContactCode = PMIM.[Initiator]
LEFT JOIN [api].[GlobalProjectContact] authorContact ON authorContact.[ProjectId] = JCJM.KeyID AND authorContact.FirmNumber = PMIM.RelatedFirm
    AND authorContact.ContactCode = PMIM.RelatedFirmContact;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view provides the total invoice amount per job billing invoice by summing the Total field from invoice line details (JBIL), grouped by company (JBCo), billing month (BillMonth), and bill number (
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JBILTotal
output:
SELECT
    TOP 100 PERCENT dbo.JBIN.JBCo,
    dbo.JBIN.BillMonth,
    dbo.JBIN.BillNumber,
    ISNULL(SUM(dbo.JBIL.Total), 0) AS JBILInvTotal
FROM dbo.JBIN
INNER JOIN dbo.JBIL ON dbo.JBIL.JBCo = dbo.JBIN.JBCo AND dbo.JBIL.BillMonth = dbo.JBIN.BillMonth AND dbo.JBIL.BillNumber = dbo.JBIN.BillNumber
GROUP BY dbo.JBIN.JBCo, dbo.JBIN.BillMonth, dbo.JBIN.BillNumber
ORDER BY dbo.JBIN.JBCo, dbo.JBIN.BillMonth, dbo.JBIN.BillNumber;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view aggregates retainage data for job billing invoice items, calculating open retainage as prior retainage plus billed minus previously released, with parallel tax calculations and conditional r
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JBITRetgGrid
output:
SELECT
    TOP 100 percent 'co' = JBIT.JBCo,
    'mth' = JBIT.BillMonth,
    'billnum' = JBIT.BillNumber,
    JBIT.Item,
    JBIT.Description,
    'openretg' = min(JBIT.PrevRetg) + JBIT.RetgBilled - min(JBIT.PrevRetgReleased),
    'openretgtax' = min(JBIT.PrevRetgTax) + JBIT.RetgTax - min(JBIT.PrevRetgTaxRel),
    'prevretgrel' = min(JBIT.PrevRetgReleased),
    'prevretgtaxrel' = min(JBIT.PrevRetgTaxRel),
    'retgpct' = CASE JBIN.RevRelRetgYN WHEN 'N' THEN
    CASE min(JBIT.PrevRetg) + JBIT.RetgBilled - min(JBIT.PrevRetgReleased) WHEN 0 THEN 0
    ELSE CONVERT(float,(JBIT.RetgRel/(min(JBIT.PrevRetg) + JBIT.RetgBilled - min(JBIT.PrevRetgReleased)))) END
    ELSE CASE min(JBIT.PrevRetgReleased) WHEN 0 THEN 0
    ELSE CONVERT(float,-(JBIT.RetgRel/min(JBIT.PrevRetgReleased))) END END,
    JBIT.RetgRel,
    JBIT.AmountDue,
    amtdue = min(JBIT.WC) + min(JBIT.TaxAmount) - min(JBIT.WCRetg) + min(JBIT.SM) - min(JBIT.SMRetg)
FROM dbo.JBIT (nolock)
JOIN dbo.JBIN (nolock) ON JBIN.JBCo = JBIT.JBCo AND JBIN.BillMonth = JBIT.BillMonth AND JBIN.BillNumber = JBIT.BillNumber
GROUP BY JBIT.JBCo, JBIT.BillMonth, JBIT.BillNumber, JBIT.Item, JBIT.Description, JBIT.RetgRel,
    JBIT.RetgBilled, JBIT.AmountDue, JBIN.RevRelRetgYN, JBIT.RetgTax
ORDER BY JBIT.JBCo, JBIT.BillMonth, JBIT.BillNumber, JBIT.Item;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view aggregates job billing invoice line subtotals and totals by underlying field tickets, linking billing details through job cost records to field ticket specifics like ticket number, descripti
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JBTMBillLineTickets
output:
SELECT
    bJBID.JBCo,
    bJBID.BillMonth,
    bJBID.BillNumber,
    bJBID.Line,
    vJCFT.KeyID,
    vJCFT.FieldTicket,
    vJCFT.[Description],
    vJCFT.CustomerPO,
    vJCFT.OwnerJobNo,
    SUM(bJBID.SubTotal) CostTotal,
    SUM(bJBID.Total) Total
FROM dbo.bJBID
INNER JOIN dbo.bJCCD ON bJBID.JBCo = bJCCD.JCCo AND bJBID.BillMonth = bJCCD.JBBillMonth
    AND bJBID.BillNumber = bJCCD.JBBillNumber AND bJBID.JCMonth = bJCCD.Mth AND bJBID.JCTrans = bJCCD.CostTrans
INNER JOIN dbo.vJCFT ON vJCFT.KeyID = bJCCD.JCFTKeyID
GROUP BY bJBID.JBCo, bJBID.BillMonth, bJBID.BillNumber, bJBID.Line, vJCFT.KeyID, vJCFT.FieldTicket, vJCFT.[Description], vJCFT.CustomerPO, vJCFT.OwnerJobNo;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view aggregates actual job costs from JCCD into monthly totals by company, job, phase, and cost type, summing ActualCost while treating nulls as zero. It provides a summarized breakdown of incurr

    CostType,
    Mth,
    'ActualCost'=sum(isnull(ActualCost,0))
FROM JCCD
GROUP BY JCCo, Job, Phase, CostType, Mth;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides Job Cost Change Header details at the item level from JCJP, including all JCCH fields renamed with PMCo and Project aliases, plus aggregated current estimated units from matching Job Cost Cos
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCCHPMItems
output:
SELECT
    JCCH.JCCo AS [PMCo],
    JCCH.Job AS [Project],
    JCJP.Item,
    JCCH.*,
    'CurrEstUnits' = (SELECT isnull(sum(EstUnits),0)
FROM dbo.bJCCD
WHERE bJCCD.JCCo=JCCH.JCCo AND bJCCD.Job=JCCH.Job
    AND bJCCD.PhaseGroup=JCCH.PhaseGroup AND bJCCD.Phase=JCCH.Phase AND bJCCD.CostType=JCCH.CostType AND bJCCD.UM=JCCH.UM),
    'PMOLEstUnits' = (SELECT isnull(sum(EstUnits),0)
FROM dbo.bPMOL
WHERE bPMOL.PMCo=JCCH.JCCo AND bPMOL.Project=JCCH.Job
    AND bPMOL.PhaseGroup=JCCH.PhaseGroup AND bPMOL.Phase=JCCH.Phase AND bPMOL.CostType=JCCH.CostType AND bPMOL.UM=JCCH.UM
    AND bPMOL.InterfacedDate IS NULL)
FROM dbo.JCCH
JOIN dbo.JCJP ON JCJP.JCCo=JCCH.JCCo AND JCJP.Job=JCCH.Job AND JCJP.PhaseGroup=JCCH.PhaseGroup AND JCJP.Phase=JCCH.Phase;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view provides a distinct list of Sales Ledger (SLXB) and Purchase Order (POXB) batches closed to Job Costing (JCXB) contracts, capturing source batch identifiers and the linked JC closing batch d
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCCloseSLPOList
output:
SELECT DISTINCT
    'SLXB' AS [CloseTable],
    bSLXB.Co,
    bSLXB.Mth,
    bSLXB.BatchId,
    bSLXB.JCContractCloseCo,
    bSLXB.JCContractCloseMth,
    bSLXB.JCContractCloseBatchId
FROM dbo.bSLXB
INNER JOIN dbo.bJCXB ON bSLXB.JCContractCloseCo = bJCXB.Co AND bSLXB.JCContractCloseMth = bJCXB.Mth AND bSLXB.JCContractCloseBatchId = bJCXB.BatchId
    UNION ALL
    SELECT DISTINCT 'POXB' AS [CloseTable], bPOXB.Co, bPOXB.Mth, bPOXB.BatchId, bPOXB.JCContractCloseCo, bPOXB.JCContractCloseMth, bPOXB.JCContractCloseBatchId
FROM dbo.bPOXB
INNER JOIN dbo.bJCXB ON bPOXB.JCContractCloseCo = bJCXB.Co AND bPOXB.JCContractCloseMth = bJCXB.Mth AND bPOXB.JCContractCloseBatchId = bJCXB.BatchId;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides customer group, customer identifier, and a formatted multi-line billing address string from the Accounts Receivable Customer Master, concatenating primary address, city, state, zip, country,
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCCMARBillAddress
output:
SELECT
    CustGroup,
    Customer,
    'ARBillAddress' =
    CASE WHEN isnull(BillAddress,'') <> '' OR isnull(BillCity,'') <> ''
    OR isnull(BillState,'') <> '' OR isnull(BillZip,'') <> ''
    OR isnull(BillCountry,'') <> '' OR isnull(BillAddress2,'') <> ''
    THEN isnull(BillAddress,'') + ',
    ' + isnull(BillCity,'') + ',
    ' + isnull(BillState,'')
    + ' ' + isnull(BillZip,'') + ' ' + isnull(BillCountry,'') + char(13) + char(10) + isnull(BillAddress2,'')
    ELSE '' END
FROM dbo.ARCM WITH (nolock);

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view computes the maximum retainage amount for JC contracts by multiplying the contract MaxRetgPct against the sum of detail line ContractAmt (if InclACOinMaxYN='Y') or OrigContractAmt (otherwise
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCCMContractAmtForMaxRetg
output:
SELECT TOP 100 percent bJCCM.JCCo, bJCCM.Contract, 'MaxRetgByPct' = CASE WHEN bJCCM.InclACOinMaxYN = 'Y' THEN (bJCCM.MaxRetgPct * isnull(sum(bJCCI.ContractAmt), 0))
    ELSE (bJCCM.MaxRetgPct * isnull(sum(bJCCI.OrigContractAmt), 0)) END
FROM dbo.bJCCI WITH (nolock)
JOIN dbo.bJCCM WITH (nolock) ON bJCCM.JCCo = bJCCI.JCCo AND bJCCM.Contract = bJCCI.Contract
WHERE bJCCI.RetainPCT <> 0
GROUP BY bJCCM.JCCo, bJCCM.Contract, bJCCM.InclACOinMaxYN, bJCCM.MaxRetgPct;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view consolidates Job Cost company configurations by resolving JC company codes to names and linking to associated GL, AR, Inventory, and Payroll company names, plus descriptions for cost, revenu
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCCOCompany
output:
SELECT
    TOP 100 percent
JCCO.JCCo,
    HQCO_1.Name AS 'JCName',
    HQCO_2.Name AS 'GLName',
    HQCO_3.Name AS 'ARName',
    HQCO_4.Name AS 'INName',
    HQCO_5.Name AS 'PRName',
    GLJR_1.Description AS 'CstJrnl',
    GLJR_2.Description AS 'RevJrnl',
    GLJR_3.Description AS 'ClsJrnl',
    GLJR_4.Description AS 'MatJrnl',
    GLAC.Description AS 'MatAcct'
FROM dbo.JCCO WITH (nolock)
LEFT JOIN dbo.HQCO AS HQCO_1 WITH (nolock) ON HQCO_1.HQCo = JCCO.JCCo
LEFT JOIN dbo.HQCO AS HQCO_2 WITH (nolock) ON HQCO_2.HQCo = JCCO.GLCo
LEFT JOIN dbo.HQCO AS HQCO_3 WITH (nolock) ON HQCO_3.HQCo = JCCO.ARCo
LEFT JOIN dbo.HQCO AS HQCO_4 WITH (nolock) ON HQCO_4.HQCo = JCCO.INCo
LEFT JOIN dbo.HQCO AS HQCO_5 WITH (nolock) ON HQCO_5.HQCo = JCCO.PRCo
LEFT JOIN dbo.GLJR AS GLJR_1 WITH (nolock) ON GLJR_1.GLCo = JCCO.GLCo AND GLJR_1.Jrnl = JCCO.GLCostJournal
LEFT JOIN dbo.GLJR AS GLJR_2 WITH (nolock) ON GLJR_2.GLCo = JCCO.GLCo AND GLJR_2.Jrnl = JCCO.GLRevJournal
LEFT JOIN dbo.GLJR AS GLJR_3 WITH (nolock) ON GLJR_3.GLCo = JCCO.GLCo AND GLJR_3.Jrnl = JCCO.GLCloseJournal
LEFT JOIN dbo.GLJR AS GLJR_4 WITH (nolock) ON GLJR_4.GLCo = JCCO.GLCo AND GLJR_4.Jrnl = JCCO.GLMatJournal
LEFT JOIN dbo.GLAC WITH (nolock) ON GLAC.GLCo = JCCO.GLCo AND GLAC.GLAcct = JCCO.GLMiscMatAcct
ORDER BY JCCO.JCCo;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view consolidates Job Cost company master data with descriptive names for linked HQ companies (JC, GL, AR, Inventory, Payroll) and GL journals/accounts used in job costing processes like cost pos
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCCOCompanyForFM
output:
SELECT
    TOP 100 percent
bJCCO.JCCo,
    bHQCO_1.Name AS 'JCName',
    bHQCO_2.Name AS 'GLName',
    bHQCO_3.Name AS 'ARName',
    bHQCO_4.Name AS 'INName',
    bHQCO_5.Name AS 'PRName',
    bGLJR_1.Description AS 'CstJrnl',
    bGLJR_2.Description AS 'RevJrnl',
    bGLJR_3.Description AS 'ClsJrnl',
    bGLJR_4.Description AS 'MatJrnl',
    bGLAC.Description AS 'MatAcct'
FROM dbo.bJCCO WITH (nolock)
LEFT JOIN dbo.bHQCO AS bHQCO_1 WITH (nolock) ON bHQCO_1.HQCo = bJCCO.JCCo
LEFT JOIN dbo.bHQCO AS bHQCO_2 WITH (nolock) ON bHQCO_2.HQCo = bJCCO.GLCo
LEFT JOIN dbo.bHQCO AS bHQCO_3 WITH (nolock) ON bHQCO_3.HQCo = bJCCO.ARCo
LEFT JOIN dbo.bHQCO AS bHQCO_4 WITH (nolock) ON bHQCO_4.HQCo = bJCCO.INCo
LEFT JOIN dbo.bHQCO AS bHQCO_5 WITH (nolock) ON bHQCO_5.HQCo = bJCCO.PRCo
LEFT JOIN dbo.bGLJR AS bGLJR_1 WITH (nolock) ON bGLJR_1.GLCo = bJCCO.GLCo AND bGLJR_1.Jrnl = bJCCO.GLCostJournal
LEFT JOIN dbo.bGLJR AS bGLJR_2 WITH (nolock) ON bGLJR_2.GLCo = bJCCO.GLCo AND bGLJR_2.Jrnl = bJCCO.GLRevJournal
LEFT JOIN dbo.bGLJR AS bGLJR_3 WITH (nolock) ON bGLJR_3.GLCo = bJCCO.GLCo AND bGLJR_3.Jrnl = bJCCO.GLCloseJournal
LEFT JOIN dbo.bGLJR AS bGLJR_4 WITH (nolock) ON bGLJR_4.GLCo = bJCCO.GLCo AND bGLJR_4.Jrnl = bJCCO.GLMatJournal
LEFT JOIN dbo.bGLAC WITH (nolock) ON bGLAC.GLCo = bJCCO.GLCo AND bGLAC.GLAcct = bJCCO.GLMiscMatAcct
ORDER BY bJCCO.JCCo;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view retrieves open purchase order totals linked to Job Costing contracts, including associated job details, PO descriptions, remaining costs, total invoiced amounts, and flags for work in other
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCContractOpenPOs
output:
SELECT
    JCCM.JCCo,
    JCCM.[Contract],
    POOpenTotals.Job,
    POOpenTotals.JobDescription AS [JobDescription],
    POOpenTotals.POCo,
    POOpenTotals.PO,
    POOpenTotals.PODescription AS [PODescription],
    POOpenTotals.RemainingCost AS [RemainingCost],
    POOpenTotals.TotalInvoiced AS [TotalInvoiced],
    POOpenTotals.WorkExistsInOtherContracts AS [WorkExistsInOtherContracts],
    POOpenTotals.ExistsInBatchOrClosed AS [ExistsInBatchOrClosed]
FROM dbo.JCCM WITH (NOLOCK)
    CROSS APPLY dbo.vfJCContractOpenPOTotals (JCCM.JCCo, JCCM.[Contract]) POOpenTotals;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view delivers open service line (SL) totals for each contract, including associated job details, remaining costs, total invoiced amounts, and boolean flags indicating if related work exists in ot
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCContractOpenSLs
output:
SELECT
    JCCM.JCCo,
    JCCM.[Contract],
    SLOpenTotals.Job,
    SLOpenTotals.JobDescription AS [JobDescription],
    SLOpenTotals.SLCo,
    SLOpenTotals.SL,
    SLOpenTotals.SLDescription AS [SLDescription],
    SLOpenTotals.RemainingCost AS [RemainingCost],
    SLOpenTotals.TotalInvoiced AS [TotalInvoiced],
    SLOpenTotals.WorkExistsInOtherContracts AS [WorkExistsInOtherContracts],
    SLOpenTotals.ExistsInBatchOrClosed AS [ExistsInBatchOrClosed]
FROM dbo.JCCM WITH (NOLOCK)
    CROSS APPLY dbo.vfJCContractOpenSLTotals (JCCM.JCCo, JCCM.[Contract]) SLOpenTotals;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view aggregates job costing data from JCCP, summing actual costs, original estimated costs, current estimated costs, and projected costs by company and job. It enables direct comparison of realiz
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCCPReport

    sum(ActualCost) AS [Actual Cost],
    sum(OrigEstCost) AS [Original Est Cost],
    sum(CurrEstCost) AS [Current Est Cost],

FROM JCCP
GROUP BY JCCo, Job;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides monthly totals for contract cost forecasts in Job Costing, calculating CurrentEstimate as pending project management costs plus cumulative contract estimated costs through the forecast month,
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCForecastTotalsCost
output:
SELECT
    JCForecastMonth.JCCo,
    JCForecastMonth.Contract,
    JCForecastMonth.ForecastMonth,
    CAST(dbo.vfPMPendingCosts(JCForecastMonth.JCCo, JCForecastMonth.Contract, JCForecastMonth.ForecastMonth) +
    isnull(sum(bJCCP.CurrEstCost),0) AS numeric(20,2)) AS CurrentEstimate,
    CAST(isnull(sum(bJCCP.ActualCost),0) AS numeric(20,2)) AS ActualToDate,
    CAST(isnull((SELECT sum(bPMOL.EstCost)
FROM dbo.bPMOL WITH (nolock)
JOIN dbo.bPMOI WITH (nolock) ON bPMOL.PMCo=bPMOI.PMCo AND bPMOL.Project=bPMOI.Project
    AND isnull(bPMOL.PCOType,'')=isnull(bPMOI.PCOType,'')
    AND isnull(bPMOL.PCO,'')=isnull(bPMOI.PCO,'') AND isnull(bPMOL.PCOItem,'')=isnull(bPMOI.PCOItem,'')
    AND isnull(bPMOL.ACO,'')=isnull(bPMOI.ACO,'') AND isnull(bPMOL.ACOItem,'')=isnull(bPMOI.ACOItem,'')
JOIN dbo.bPMSC WITH (nolock) ON bPMSC.Status = bPMOI.Status
LEFT JOIN dbo.bPMDT WITH (nolock) ON bPMDT.DocType = bPMOI.PCOType
LEFT JOIN dbo.bJCJM AS bJCJM_1 WITH (nolock) ON bJCJM_1.JCCo=JCForecastMonth.JCCo AND bJCJM_1.Contract=JCForecastMonth.Contract
WHERE bPMOI.PMCo = JCForecastMonth.JCCo AND bPMOI.Project = bJCJM_1.Job AND JCForecastMonth.Contract IS NOT NULL
    AND bPMOL.InterfacedDate IS NULL
    AND isnull(bPMDT.IncludeInProj,'N') = 'Y'
    AND isnull(bPMSC.IncludeInProj,'N') = 'C'), 0)
    AS numeric(20,2)) AS IncludedCOAmt
FROM dbo.JCForecastMonth WITH (nolock)
LEFT JOIN dbo.bJCJM AS bJCJM_2 WITH (nolock) ON bJCJM_2.JCCo=JCForecastMonth.JCCo AND bJCJM_2.Contract=JCForecastMonth.Contract
LEFT JOIN dbo.bJCCP WITH (nolock) ON bJCCP.JCCo=JCForecastMonth.JCCo AND bJCCP.Job=bJCJM_2.Job AND bJCCP.Mth <= JCForecastMonth.ForecastMonth
GROUP BY JCForecastMonth.JCCo, JCForecastMonth.Contract, JCForecastMonth.ForecastMonth;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view delivers cumulative contract amounts and billed totals up to each specified forecast month for Job Costing contracts, alongside calculated forecast revenue for that month derived from a reve
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCForecastTotalsRev
output:
SELECT
    JCForecastMonth.JCCo,
    JCForecastMonth.Contract,
    JCForecastMonth.ForecastMonth,
    CAST(isnull(sum(bJCIP.ContractAmt),0) AS numeric(20,2)) AS CurrentContract,
    CAST(isnull(sum(bJCIP.BilledAmt),0) AS numeric(20,2)) AS BilledToDate,
    CAST(dbo.vfJCMthRevForecastAmt (JCForecastMonth.JCCo, JCForecastMonth.Contract, JCForecastMonth.ForecastMonth,JCForecastMonth.RevenuePct) AS numeric(20,2)) AS ForecastMthRevenue
FROM dbo.JCForecastMonth WITH (nolock)
LEFT JOIN dbo.bJCIP WITH (nolock) ON bJCIP.JCCo=JCForecastMonth.JCCo AND bJCIP.Contract=JCForecastMonth.Contract AND bJCIP.Mth <= JCForecastMonth.ForecastMonth
GROUP BY JCForecastMonth.JCCo, JCForecastMonth.Contract, JCForecastMonth.ForecastMonth, JCForecastMonth.RevenuePct;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view provides approved job contract details by company, including contract number, approval date, item, approved month, contract amount, and units from header and item tables, with null amounts a
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCFutureJCCO
output:
SELECT
    JCOI.JCCo AS 'Co',
    JCOI.Contract AS 'Cnt',
    JCOH.ApprovalDate AS 'ApprovalDate',
    JCOI.Item AS 'Item',
    JCOI.ApprovedMonth AS 'ApprovedMonth',
    isnull(JCOI.ContractAmt,0) AS 'Amt',
    isnull(JCOI.ContractUnits,0) AS 'Units'
FROM dbo.JCOI WITH (nolock)
JOIN dbo.JCOH WITH (nolock)
    ON JCOI.JCCo=JCOH.JCCo AND JCOI.Job=JCOH.Job AND JCOI.ACO = JCOH.ACO AND JCOI.Contract = JCOH.Contract;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides pending, fixed, or approved amounts and matching units for potential change order (PCO) items linked to contracts, calculated via CASE logic based on ACO presence, fixed amount flag, interfac
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCFuturePMCO
output:
SELECT
    bPMOI.PMCo AS 'Co',
    bPMOI.Contract AS 'Cnt',
    bPMOI.ContractItem AS 'Item',
    bPMOI.ACO AS 'ACO',
    bPMOI.ACOItem AS 'ACOItem',
    bPMOI.PCOType AS 'PCOType',
    bPMOI.PCO AS 'PCO',
    bPMOI.PCOItem AS 'PCOItem',
    CASE
    WHEN bPMOI.ACO IS NULL AND bPMOI.FixedAmountYN <> 'Y' THEN isnull(bPMOI.PendingAmount,0)
    WHEN bPMOI.ACO IS NULL AND bPMOI.FixedAmountYN = 'Y' THEN isnull(bPMOI.FixedAmount,0)
    WHEN bPMOI.InterfacedDate IS NULL AND bPMOI.ACO IS NOT NULL THEN isnull(bPMOI.ApprovedAmt,0)
    ELSE
    0
    END AS 'Amt',
    isnull(CASE WHEN bPMOI.UM=bJCCI.UM THEN bPMOI.Units ELSE 0 END,0) AS 'Units',
    isnull(bPMSC.IncludeInProj,'N') AS 'ProjectionOption'
FROM dbo.bPMOI WITH (nolock)
JOIN dbo.bPMSC WITH (nolock) ON bPMSC.Status = bPMOI.Status
JOIN dbo.bJCCI WITH (NOLOCK) ON bJCCI.JCCo=bPMOI.PMCo AND bJCCI.Contract=bPMOI.Contract AND bJCCI.Item=bPMOI.ContractItem
LEFT JOIN dbo.bPMDT WITH (nolock) ON bPMDT.DocType = bPMOI.PCOType
WHERE isnull(bPMDT.IncludeInProj,'Y') = 'Y' AND isnull(bPMSC.IncludeInProj,'N') IN ('Y','C');

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view aggregates future units and revenue amounts for contract items by company, summing units and amounts from JCFutureJCCO records where ApprovedMonth exceeds the JCIR month plus all units and a
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCFutureRevenueCO
output:
SELECT
    JCIR.Co,
    JCIR.Contract,
    JCIR.Item,
    ISNULL((SELECT sum(isnull(Units,0))
FROM dbo.JCFutureJCCO AS JCFutureJCCO_1
WHERE JCFutureJCCO_1.Co = JCIR.Co AND JCFutureJCCO_1.Cnt=JCIR.Contract
    AND JCFutureJCCO_1.Item=JCIR.Item AND JCFutureJCCO_1.ApprovedMonth> JCIR.Mth ),0)+ISNULL((SELECT sum(isnull(Units,0))
FROM dbo.JCFuturePMCO AS JCFuturePMCO_1
WHERE JCFuturePMCO_1.Co = JCIR.Co AND JCFuturePMCO_1.Cnt=JCIR.Contract
    AND JCFuturePMCO_1.Item=JCIR.Item),0) AS [FutureUnits],
    isnull((SELECT sum(isnull(Units,0))
FROM dbo.JCFuturePMCO AS JCFuturePMCO_1
WHERE JCFuturePMCO_1.Co = JCIR.Co AND JCFuturePMCO_1.Cnt=JCIR.Contract
    AND JCFuturePMCO_1.Item=JCIR.Item AND JCFuturePMCO_1.ProjectionOption='C'),0) AS [IncludedCOUnits],
    ISNULL((SELECT sum(isnull(Amt,0))
FROM dbo.JCFutureJCCO AS JCFutureJCCO_1
WHERE JCFutureJCCO_1.Co = JCIR.Co AND JCFutureJCCO_1.Cnt=JCIR.Contract
    AND JCFutureJCCO_1.Item=JCIR.Item AND JCFutureJCCO_1.ApprovedMonth> JCIR.Mth ),0)+ISNULL((SELECT sum(isnull(Amt,0))
FROM dbo.JCFuturePMCO AS JCFuturePMCO_1
WHERE JCFuturePMCO_1.Co = JCIR.Co AND JCFuturePMCO_1.Cnt=JCIR.Contract
    AND JCFuturePMCO_1.Item=JCIR.Item),0) AS [FutureAmount],
    isnull((SELECT sum(isnull(Amt,0))
FROM dbo.JCFuturePMCO AS JCFuturePMCO_1
WHERE JCFuturePMCO_1.Co = JCIR.Co AND JCFuturePMCO_1.Cnt=JCIR.Contract
    AND JCFuturePMCO_1.Item=JCIR.Item AND JCFuturePMCO_1.ProjectionOption='C'),0) AS [IncludedCOAmt]
FROM dbo.JCIR WITH (nolock);

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view delivers cumulative contract units and contract amounts up to a specified month for each company, month, contract, and item in the Job Costing module. It sums JCIP period data where the peri
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCIPForJCIR
output:
SELECT
    JCIR.Co,
    JCIR.Mth,
    JCIR.Contract,
    JCIR.Item,
    CAST(isnull(sum(JCIP.ContractUnits),0) AS numeric(20,2)) AS CurrentUnits,
    CAST(isnull(sum(JCIP.ContractAmt),0) AS numeric(20,2)) AS CurrentContract
FROM dbo.JCIR WITH (nolock)
LEFT JOIN dbo.JCIP WITH (nolock) ON JCIP.JCCo=JCIR.Co AND JCIP.Contract=JCIR.Contract AND JCIP.Item=JCIR.Item AND JCIP.Mth<=JCIR.Mth
GROUP BY JCIR.Co, JCIR.Mth, JCIR.Contract, JCIR.Item;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view aggregates key financial metrics for job contracts from the JCIP table, summing original contract amount, current contract amount, billed amount, received amount, and projected revenue by co

SELECT
    JCCo,
    Contract,
    sum(OrigContractAmt) AS [Original Contract Amount],
    sum(ContractAmt) AS [Contract Amount],
    sum(BilledAmt) AS [Billed Amount],
    sum(ReceivedAmt) AS [Received Amount],
    sum(ProjDollars) AS [Projected Revenue]
FROM JCIP
GROUP BY JCCo, Contract;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Aggregates cumulative projected job costs up to the revenue month for each company, month, contract, and item from job revenue records. Links revenue items via contracts to jobs and their phases, then
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCIRForJCCP
output:
SELECT
    JCIR.Co,
    JCIR.Mth,
    JCIR.Contract,
    JCIR.Item,
    CAST(isnull(sum(JCCP.ProjCost),0) AS numeric(20,2)) AS ProjCost
FROM dbo.JCIR WITH (nolock)
JOIN dbo.JCJM WITH (nolock) ON JCJM.JCCo=JCIR.Co AND JCJM.Contract=JCIR.Contract
LEFT JOIN dbo.JCJP WITH (nolock) ON JCJP.JCCo=JCIR.Co AND JCJP.Job=JCJM.Job AND JCJP.Item=JCIR.Item
LEFT JOIN dbo.JCCP WITH (nolock) ON JCCP.JCCo=JCIR.Co AND JCCP.Job=JCJM.Job AND JCCP.Mth<=JCIR.Mth AND JCCP.Phase=JCJP.Phase
GROUP BY JCIR.Co, JCIR.Mth, JCIR.Contract, JCIR.Item;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view aggregates current units and contract value from invoice register data, future units and amounts by summing change order impacts plus all future planned monthly cost overrides, projected cos
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCIRTotals
output:
SELECT
    JCIR.Co,
    JCIR.Contract,
    JCIR.Item,
    CAST(isnull(i.CurrentUnits,0) AS numeric(18,3)) AS CurrentUnits,
    CAST(isnull(i.CurrentContract,0) AS numeric(20,2)) AS CurrentContract,
    CAST(isnull(SUM(j.Units),0) +
    ISNULL((SELECT sum(isnull(JCFuturePMCO_1.Units,0))
FROM dbo.JCFuturePMCO AS JCFuturePMCO_1
WHERE JCFuturePMCO_1.Co = JCIR.Co
    AND JCFuturePMCO_1.Cnt=JCIR.Contract AND JCFuturePMCO_1.Item=JCIR.Item),0)
    AS numeric(18,3)) AS FutureUnits
    ,
    CAST(isnull(SUM(j.Amt),0) +
    ISNULL((SELECT sum(isnull(JCFuturePMCO_1.Amt,0))
FROM dbo.JCFuturePMCO AS JCFuturePMCO_1
WHERE JCFuturePMCO_1.Co = JCIR.Co
    AND JCFuturePMCO_1.Cnt=JCIR.Contract AND JCFuturePMCO_1.Item=JCIR.Item),0)
    AS numeric(20,2)) AS FutureAmount
    ,
    CAST(isnull(c.ProjCost,0) AS numeric(20,2)) AS ProjCost
    ,
    CAST(isnull((SELECT sum(isnull(JCFuturePMCO_1.Units,0))
FROM dbo.JCFuturePMCO AS JCFuturePMCO_1
WHERE JCFuturePMCO_1.Co = JCIR.Co
    AND JCFuturePMCO_1.Cnt=JCIR.Contract AND JCFuturePMCO_1.Item=JCIR.Item AND JCFuturePMCO_1.ProjectionOption='C'),0)
    AS numeric(18,3)) AS IncludedCOUnits
    ,
    CAST(isnull((SELECT sum(isnull(JCFuturePMCO_1.Amt,0))
FROM dbo.JCFuturePMCO AS JCFuturePMCO_1
WHERE JCFuturePMCO_1.Co = JCIR.Co
    AND JCFuturePMCO_1.Cnt=JCIR.Contract AND JCFuturePMCO_1.Item=JCIR.Item AND JCFuturePMCO_1.ProjectionOption='C'),0)
    AS numeric(20,2)) AS IncludedCOAmt
FROM dbo.JCIR
OUTER
APPLY
dbo.vfJCIRCurrentContract (JCIR.Co, JCIR.Mth, JCIR.Contract, JCIR.Item) i
OUTER
APPLY
dbo.vfJCIRFutureJCChgOrders (JCIR.Co, JCIR.Mth, JCIR.Contract, JCIR.Item) j
OUTER
APPLY
dbo.vfJCIRProjectedCost (JCIR.Co, JCIR.Mth, JCIR.Contract, JCIR.Item) c
GROUP BY JCIR.Co, JCIR.Contract, JCIR.Item,
    i.CurrentUnits
    ,
    i.CurrentContract
    ,
    c.ProjCost;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view provides pending Project Change Order (PCO) estimates by job, phase group, phase, and cost type for unapproved PCOs marked for project inclusion, with calculated pending hours, units, and co
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCJobAnalysisCostType-PCO
output:
SELECT
    JCCH.JCCo,
    JCCH.Job,
    JCCH.PhaseGroup,
    JCCH.Phase,
    JCCH.CostType,
    'Insert-PCO' AS [Type],
    '2001-01-01' AS [ActualDate],
    PMOI.Approved AS [PMOI.Approved],
    PMOP.Status AS [PCOStatus],
    PMSC.[IncludeInProj],
    PMOL.PCOType,
    PMOL.PCO,
    PMOL.PCOItem,
    PMOL.EstHours AS [PendEstHours],
    (PMOL.HourCost*PMOL.EstHours) AS [PendHourCost],
    PMOL.EstCost AS [PendEstCostChg],
    JCCH.UniqueAttchID,
    CASE WHEN PMOL.EstUnits IS NOT NULL THEN PMOL.EstUnits ELSE 0 END AS [PendEstUnits]
FROM dbo.JCCH
RIGHT JOIN dbo.PMOL ON JCCH.JCCo=PMOL.PMCo AND JCCH.Job=PMOL.Project AND
    JCCH.PhaseGroup=PMOL.PhaseGroup AND JCCH.Phase=PMOL.Phase AND JCCH.CostType=PMOL.CostType
RIGHT JOIN dbo.PMOI ON PMOI.PMCo=JCCH.JCCo AND PMOI.Project=JCCH.Job AND
    PMOL.PCOType=PMOI.PCOType AND PMOL.PCO=PMOI.PCO AND PMOL.PCOItem=PMOI.PCOItem
RIGHT JOIN dbo.PMOP ON PMOP.PMCo=JCCH.JCCo AND PMOP.Project=JCCH.Job AND PMOP.PCOType=PMOI.PCOType AND PMOP.PCO=PMOI.PCO
JOIN dbo.JCJM ON JCJM.JCCo=JCCH.JCCo AND JCJM.Job=JCCH.Job
LEFT OUTER JOIN PMSC ON PMSC.Status = PMOP.Status
WHERE PMSC.IncludeInProj <> 'N' AND PMOP.Status<>'APP';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides pending labor ('L' category) estimates from unapproved Project Change Orders (PCOs) for specific jobs, phases, and cost types, marked as 'Insert-PCO' placeholders with a dummy date for job an
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCJobAnalysisCostTypeL-PCO
output:
SELECT DISTINCT
    JCCH.JCCo,
    JCCH.Job,
    JCCH.PhaseGroup,
    JCCH.Phase,
    JCCH.CostType,
    'Insert-PCO' AS [Type],
    '2001-01-01' AS [ActualDate],
    PMOI.Approved AS [PMOI.Approved],
    PMOP.Status AS [PCOStatus],
    PMSC.[IncludeInProj],
    PMOL.PCOType,
    PMOL.PCO,
    PMOL.PCOItem,
    PMOL.EstHours AS [PendEstHours],
    (PMOL.HourCost*PMOL.EstHours) AS [PendHourCost],
    PMOL.EstCost AS [PendEstCostChg],
    JCCH.UniqueAttchID,
    CASE WHEN PMOL.EstUnits IS NOT NULL THEN PMOL.EstUnits ELSE 0 END AS [PendEstUnits],
    JCCT.JBCostTypeCategory
FROM dbo.JCCH
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.PMOL ON JCCH.JCCo=PMOL.PMCo AND JCCH.Job=PMOL.Project AND
    JCCH.PhaseGroup=PMOL.PhaseGroup AND JCCH.Phase=PMOL.Phase AND JCCH.CostType=PMOL.CostType
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.PMOI ON PMOI.PMCo=JCCH.JCCo AND PMOI.Project=JCCH.Job AND
    PMOL.PCOType=PMOI.PCOType AND PMOL.PCO=PMOI.PCO AND PMOL.PCOItem=PMOI.PCOItem
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.PMOP ON PMOP.PMCo=JCCH.JCCo AND PMOP.Project=JCCH.Job AND PMOP.PCOType=PMOI.PCOType AND PMOP.PCO=PMOI.PCO
LEFT OUTER JOIN dbo.JCJM ON JCJM.JCCo=JCCH.JCCo AND JCJM.Job=JCCH.Job
LEFT OUTER JOIN PMSC ON PMSC.Status = PMOP.Status
LEFT OUTER JOIN JCCT ON JCCT.CostType=JCCH.CostType
WHERE PMSC.IncludeInProj <> 'N' AND PMOP.Status<>'APP' AND JCCT.JBCostTypeCategory='L';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Aggregates line-level labor man-hour and cost data into job totals, including original/current estimates, actuals, projections, earned MH, over/under variances, earned labor dollars, and approved/pend
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCJobAnalysisJobL-MH-Earn
output:
SELECT
    [JCCo],
    [Job],
    sum([L-OrigEstHours]) AS [L-OrigEstHours],
    sum([L-CurrEstHours]) AS[L-CurrEstHours],
    sum([L-ActualHours]) AS[L-ActualHours],
    sum([L-ProjHours]) AS [L-ProjHours],
    sum([L-MH to Comp])AS [L-MH to Comp],
    sum([L-MH Over/Under])AS [L-MH Over/Under],
    sum([L-Earned MH]) AS [L-Earned MH],
    sum([L-OrigEstCost]) AS [L-OrigEstCost],
    sum([L-CurrEstCost]) [L-CurrEstCost],
    sum([L-ActualCost]) AS [L-ActualCost],
    sum([L-ProjCost]) AS [L-ProjCost],
    sum([L-TotalProjectEst]) AS [L-TotalProjectEst],
    sum([L-Cost Over/Under]) AS [L-Cost Over/Under],
    sum([L-EarnedLabor$]) [L-EarnedLabor$],
    sum([L-ActualLaborCost]) AS [L-ActualLaborCost],
    sum([L-AppEstHours]) AS [L-AppEstHours],
    sum([L-AppHourCost]) [L-AppHourCost],
    sum([L-AppEstCostChg]) AS [L-AppEstCostChg],
    sum([L-PendEstHours])AS [L-PendEstHours],
    sum([L-PendHourCost]) AS [L-PendHourCost],
    sum([L-PendEstCostChg]) AS [L-PendEstCostChg],
    sum([L-AddOnAmount])AS [L-AddOnAmount]
FROM [JCJobAnalysisCostTypeL-MH]
GROUP BY [JCCo]
    ,[Job];

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view aggregates total pending estimated hours, hour costs, estimated cost charges, and units per job and company from detailed cost type data. It performs grouping by company and job with summati
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCJobAnalysisJobL-PCO
output:
SELECT
    [JCCo],
    [Job],
    sum([PendEstHours]) AS [PendEstHours],
    sum([PendHourCost]) AS [PendHourCost],
    sum([PendEstCostChg]) AS [PendEstCostChg],
    sum([PendEstUnits]) AS [PendEstUnits]
FROM [dbo].[JCJobAnalysisCostTypeL-PCO]
GROUP BY [JCCo] ,[Job];

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Aggregates labor man-hour (LMH) metrics including original/current estimates, actuals, projections, over/under variances, earned man-hours, and costs at the job level by company. Includes breakdowns f
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCJobAnalysisJobLMHEarn
output:
SELECT
    [JCCo],
    [Job],
    sum([L-OrigEstHours]) AS [L-OrigEstHours],
    sum([L-CurrEstHours]) AS[L-CurrEstHours],
    sum([L-ActualHours]) AS[L-ActualHours],
    sum([L-ProjHours]) AS [L-ProjHours],
    sum([L-MH to Comp])AS [L-MH to Comp],
    sum([L-MH Over/Under])AS [L-MH Over/Under],
    sum([L-Earned MH]) AS [L-Earned MH],
    sum([L-OrigEstCost]) AS [L-OrigEstCost],
    sum([L-CurrEstCost]) [L-CurrEstCost],
    sum([L-ActualCost]) AS [L-ActualCost],
    sum([L-ProjCost]) AS [L-ProjCost],
    sum([L-TotalProjectEst]) AS [L-TotalProjectEst],
    sum([L-Cost Over/Under]) AS [L-Cost Over/Under],
    sum([L-EarnedLabor$]) [L-EarnedLabor$],
    sum([L-ActualLaborCost]) AS [L-ActualLaborCost],
    sum([L-AppEstHours]) AS [L-AppEstHours],
    sum([L-AppHourCost]) [L-AppHourCost],
    sum([L-AppEstCostChg]) AS [L-AppEstCostChg],
    sum([L-PendEstHours])AS [L-PendEstHours],
    sum([L-PendHourCost]) AS [L-PendHourCost],
    sum([L-PendEstCostChg]) AS [L-PendEstCostChg],
    sum([L-AddOnAmount])AS [L-AddOnAmount]
FROM dbo.JCJobAnalysisCostTypeLMH
GROUP BY [JCCo],[Job];

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Aggregates labor man-hour and cost metrics at the job phase level from line-level data, including original/current estimates, actuals, projections, man-hours to completion, over/under variances, earne

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Aggregates phase-level production metrics to job level, computing man-hour and cost performance ratios (expected/actual), current estimate totals, variances from expected, and projections for total ho
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCJobProductionCalcs
output:
SELECT
    [JCCo],
    [Job],
    CAST((CASE ISNULL(SUM([Actual Hours]), 0)
    WHEN 0 THEN 0
    ELSE ISNULL(SUM([Expect Hours]), 0) / ISNULL(SUM([Actual Hours]), 0)
    END)AS decimal(12,2)) AS 'MH Perf',
    Sum([Curr Est Hours] ) AS 'Curr Est Hours',
    Sum([Expect Hours])AS 'Expect Hours',
    Sum([Actual Hours])AS 'Actual Hours',
    Sum([MHVarFromExpected])AS 'MHVarFromExpected',
    CAST((CASE ISNULL(SUM([Actual Cost]), 0)
    WHEN 0 THEN 0
    ELSE ISNULL(SUM([Expect Cost]), 0) / ISNULL(SUM([Actual Cost]), 0)
    END)AS decimal(12,2)) AS 'Amt Perf',
    Sum([Curr Est Cost])AS 'Curr Est Cost',
    Sum([Expect Cost])AS 'Expect Cost',
    Sum([Actual Cost])AS 'Actual Cost',
    Sum([CostVarFromExpected])AS 'CostVarFromExpected',
    Sum([Est-Actual Cost])AS 'Est-Actual Cost',
    CAST((Sum([Curr Est Hours]) / (CASE ISNULL(SUM([Actual Hours]), 0)
    WHEN 0 THEN 0
    ELSE ISNULL(SUM([Expect Hours]), 0) / ISNULL(SUM([Actual Hours]), 0)
    END ))AS decimal(12,2)) AS 'Projected MH',
    CAST((Sum([Curr Est Hours])-(Sum([Curr Est Hours]) / (CASE ISNULL(SUM([Actual Hours]), 0)
    WHEN 0 THEN 0
    ELSE ISNULL(SUM([Expect Hours]), 0) / ISNULL(SUM([Actual Hours]), 0)
    END )))AS decimal(12,2)) AS 'Variance MH',
    CAST((Sum([Curr Est Cost])/ (CASE ISNULL(SUM([Actual Cost]), 0)
    WHEN 0 THEN 0
    ELSE ISNULL(SUM([Expect Cost]), 0) / ISNULL(SUM([Actual Cost]), 0)
    END ))AS decimal(12,2)) AS 'Projected Cost',
    CAST((Sum([Curr Est Cost])-(Sum([Curr Est Cost])/ (CASE ISNULL(SUM([Actual Cost]), 0)
    WHEN 0 THEN 0
    ELSE ISNULL(SUM([Expect Cost]), 0) / ISNULL(SUM([Actual Cost]), 0)
    END )))AS decimal(12,2)) AS 'Variance Cost'
FROM [JCPhaseProductionCalcs]
WHERE [% Comp Units]>15 AND [Actual Cost] > 0 AND [Actual Hours] > 0
GROUP BY [JCCo],[Job];

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Retrieves phase descriptions in Job Costing by unioning job-specific records from JCJP (with company and job), master phase records from JCPM (with blank company/job), and a single top record from JCJ
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCJPDescGet
output:
SELECT
    JCCo,
    Job,
    PhaseGroup,
    Phase,
    Description
FROM dbo.JCJP WITH (nolock)
UNION
SELECT '' AS JCCo, '' AS Job, PhaseGroup, Phase, Description
FROM dbo.JCPM WITH (nolock)
UNION
SELECT TOP 1 1 JCCo, Job, PhaseGroup, Phase, Description
FROM dbo.JCJP WITH (nolock)
JOIN JCCO WITH (nolock) ON JCCO.JCCo=JCJP.JCCo
WHERE isnull(JCCO.ValidPhaseChars,0) <> 0 AND Phase LIKE substring(Phase,1,JCCO.ValidPhaseChars) + '%';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Aggregates original costs from job cost transactions at the phase level within jobs, computing a total phase cost and pivoting sums into up to 10 columns based on company-configured cost types from PM
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCJPPM1
output:
SELECT
    TOP 100 percent JCJP.JCCo,
    JCJP.Job,
    JCJP.PhaseGroup,
    JCJP.Phase,
    'PhaseTotal' = CAST(isnull(sum(JCCH.OrigCost),0) AS numeric (16,2)),
    'CostType1' = CAST(sum(CASE WHEN JCCH.CostType=PMCO.ShowCostType1 THEN JCCH.OrigCost ELSE 0 END) AS numeric(16,2)),
    'CostType2' = CAST(sum(CASE WHEN JCCH.CostType=PMCO.ShowCostType2 THEN JCCH.OrigCost ELSE 0 END) AS numeric(16,2)),
    'CostType3' = CAST(sum(CASE WHEN JCCH.CostType=PMCO.ShowCostType3 THEN JCCH.OrigCost ELSE 0 END) AS numeric(16,2)),
    'CostType4' = CAST(sum(CASE WHEN JCCH.CostType=PMCO.ShowCostType4 THEN JCCH.OrigCost ELSE 0 END) AS numeric(16,2)),
    'CostType5' = CAST(sum(CASE WHEN JCCH.CostType=PMCO.ShowCostType5 THEN JCCH.OrigCost ELSE 0 END) AS numeric(16,2)),
    'CostType6' = CAST(sum(CASE WHEN JCCH.CostType=PMCO.ShowCostType6 THEN JCCH.OrigCost ELSE 0 END) AS numeric(16,2)),
    'CostType7' = CAST(sum(CASE WHEN JCCH.CostType=PMCO.ShowCostType7 THEN JCCH.OrigCost ELSE 0 END) AS numeric(16,2)),
    'CostType8' = CAST(sum(CASE WHEN JCCH.CostType=PMCO.ShowCostType8 THEN JCCH.OrigCost ELSE 0 END) AS numeric(16,2)),
    'CostType9' = CAST(sum(CASE WHEN JCCH.CostType=PMCO.ShowCostType9 THEN JCCH.OrigCost ELSE 0 END) AS numeric(16,2)),
    'CostType10' = CAST(sum(CASE WHEN JCCH.CostType=PMCO.ShowCostType10 THEN JCCH.OrigCost ELSE 0 END) AS numeric(16,2))
FROM dbo.JCJP
LEFT JOIN dbo.JCCH WITH (nolock) ON JCCH.JCCo=JCJP.JCCo AND JCCH.Job=JCJP.Job AND JCCH.PhaseGroup=JCJP.PhaseGroup AND JCCH.Phase=JCJP.Phase
LEFT JOIN dbo.PMCO WITH (nolock) ON PMCO.PMCo=JCCH.JCCo
GROUP BY JCJP.JCCo, JCJP.Job, JCJP.PhaseGroup, JCJP.Phase
ORDER BY JCJP.JCCo, JCJP.Job, JCJP.PhaseGroup, JCJP.Phase;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view delivers the effective projected minimum percentage (ProjMinPct) for each job phase, prioritizing the phase-level value, falling back to job-level, then company-level if zero or null. It com
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCJPProjMinPct
output:
SELECT
    bJCJP.JCCo,
    bJCJP.Job,
    bJCJP.Phase,
    'ProjMinPct' = CASE WHEN isnull(bJCJP.ProjMinPct,0) <> 0 THEN bJCJP.ProjMinPct
    WHEN isnull(bJCJM.ProjMinPct,0) <> 0 THEN bJCJM.ProjMinPct
    WHEN isnull(bJCCO.ProjMinPct,0) <> 0 THEN bJCCO.ProjMinPct
    ELSE 0 END
FROM dbo.bJCJP WITH (nolock)
JOIN dbo.bJCJM WITH (nolock) ON bJCJM.JCCo=bJCJP.JCCo AND bJCJM.Job=bJCJP.Job
JOIN dbo.bJCCO WITH (nolock) ON bJCCO.JCCo=bJCJP.JCCo;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view aggregates company-month combinations from Job Cost override tables (JCOP and JCOR) and GL fiscal periods (GLFP) into a unified list, filtering out null months. It maps GL fiscal period fiel
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCOverrides

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view aggregates cumulative actual equipment hours and costs from job cost detail transactions up to each period month, for equipment-assigned records in job cost period details. It sums ActualHou
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCPDTotals
output:
SELECT
    bJCPD.Co,
    bJCPD.Mth,
    bJCPD.BatchId,
    bJCPD.BatchSeq,
    bJCPD.DetSeq,
    CASE WHEN bJCPD.EMCo IS NOT NULL AND bJCPD.Equipment IS NOT NULL
    THEN sum(isnull(bJCCD.ActualHours,0))
    ELSE 0
    END
AS EquipmentActualHours,
    CASE WHEN bJCPD.EMCo IS NOT NULL AND bJCPD.Equipment IS NOT NULL
    THEN sum(isnull(bJCCD.ActualCost,0))
    ELSE 0
    END
AS EquipmentActualCosts
FROM dbo.bJCPD WITH (nolock)
LEFT JOIN dbo.bJCCD WITH (nolock) ON bJCCD.JCCo=bJCPD.Co AND bJCCD.Mth <= bJCPD.Mth
AND bJCCD.Job=bJCPD.Job AND bJCCD.PhaseGroup=bJCPD.PhaseGroup AND bJCCD.Phase=bJCPD.Phase
AND bJCCD.CostType=bJCPD.CostType AND bJCCD.EMCo=bJCPD.EMCo AND bJCCD.EMEquip=bJCPD.Equipment
GROUP BY bJCPD.Co, bJCPD.Mth, bJCPD.BatchId, bJCPD.BatchSeq, bJCPD.DetSeq, bJCPD.EMCo, bJCPD.Equipment;

input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCPPCostTypesHdr

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Aggregates estimated, projected, and completed units for job phases and cost types up to the posting's actual date, sourced from cost details and grouped by company, month, batch, job, phase group, ph
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCPPJCCD
output:
SELECT
    TOP 100 percent
    bJCPP.Co,
    bJCPP.Mth,
    bJCPP.BatchId,
    bJCPP.BatchSeq,
    bJCPP.Job,
    bJCPP.PhaseGroup,
    bJCPP.Phase,
    bJCPP.CostType,
    isnull(sum(bJCCD.EstUnits),0) AS [CurrentEstimated],
    isnull(sum(bJCCD.ProjUnits),0) AS [CurrentProjected],
    isnull(sum(bJCCD.ActualUnits),0) AS [CurrentCompleted]
FROM dbo.bJCPP WITH (nolock)
JOIN dbo.bJCCH WITH (nolock) ON bJCCH.JCCo=bJCPP.Co AND bJCCH.Job=bJCPP.Job AND bJCCH.PhaseGroup=bJCPP.PhaseGroup
AND bJCCH.Phase=bJCPP.Phase AND bJCCH.CostType=bJCPP.CostType
LEFT JOIN dbo.bJCCD WITH (nolock) ON bJCCD.JCCo=bJCPP.Co AND bJCCD.Job=bJCPP.Job AND bJCCD.PhaseGroup=bJCPP.PhaseGroup
AND bJCCD.Phase=bJCPP.Phase AND bJCCD.CostType=bJCPP.CostType AND bJCCH.UM=bJCCD.UM AND bJCCD.ActualDate<=bJCPP.ActualDate
GROUP BY bJCPP.Co, bJCPP.Mth, bJCPP.BatchId, bJCPP.BatchSeq, bJCPP.Job, bJCPP.Phase, bJCPP.PhaseGroup, bJCPP.CostType;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Provides cumulative totals for revised job budgets, current commitments (BudgetCode 'COMM'), and contingencies (BudgetCode 'CONT') per company, job, phase, cost type, month, and revision transaction f
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JCPRTotal
output:
SELECT
    bJCPR_2.JCCo,
    bJCPR_2.Job,
    bJCPR_2.Phase,
    bJCPR_2.CostType,
    bJCPR_2.Mth,
    bJCPR_2.ResTrans,
    CAST(isnull((SELECT sum(bJCCP.CurrEstCost)
FROM dbo.bJCCP WITH (nolock)
WHERE bJCCP.JCCo=bJCPR_2.JCCo AND bJCCP.Job=bJCPR_2.Job AND bJCCP.Phase=bJCPR_2.Phase AND bJCCP.CostType=bJCPR_2.CostType
    AND bJCCP.Mth <= bJCPR_2.Mth), 0)
    AS numeric(20,2)) AS RevisedBudget,
    CAST(isnull((SELECT sum(bJCPR_1.Amount)
FROM dbo.bJCPR AS bJCPR_1 WITH (nolock)
WHERE bJCPR_1.JCCo=bJCPR_2.JCCo AND bJCPR_1.Job=bJCPR_2.Job AND bJCPR_1.Phase=bJCPR_2.Phase AND bJCPR_1.CostType=bJCPR_2.CostType
    AND bJCPR_1.BudgetCode = 'COMM' AND (bJCPR_1.Mth < bJCPR_2.Mth OR (bJCPR_1.Mth=bJCPR_2.Mth AND bJCPR_1.ResTrans <= bJCPR_2.ResTrans))), 0)
    AS numeric(20,2)) AS CurrCommit,
    CAST(isnull((SELECT sum(bJCPR_1.Amount)
FROM dbo.bJCPR AS bJCPR_1 WITH (nolock)
WHERE bJCPR_1.JCCo=bJCPR_2.JCCo AND bJCPR_1.Job=bJCPR_2.Job AND bJCPR_1.Phase=bJCPR_2.Phase AND bJCPR_1.CostType=bJCPR_2.CostType
    AND bJCPR_1.BudgetCode = 'CONT' AND (bJCPR_1.Mth < bJCPR_2.Mth OR (bJCPR_1.Mth=bJCPR_2.Mth AND bJCPR_1.ResTrans <= bJCPR_2.ResTrans))), 0)
    AS numeric(20,2)) AS Contingency
FROM dbo.bJCPR AS bJCPR_2 WITH (NOLOCK)
GROUP BY bJCPR_2.JCCo, bJCPR_2.Job, bJCPR_2.Phase, bJCPR_2.CostType, bJCPR_2.Mth, bJCPR_2.ResTrans, bJCPR_2.BudgetCode;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Combines job contract billing revenue (contract, billed, received, retainage amounts) with job cost detail transactions (actual costs by source type like PR Entry), both tied to specific jobs. Enriche
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JobTransRevCost
output:
SELECT
    JCCI.JCCo,
    JCCI.Contract,
    JCJMPM.Description AS [JobDescription],
    JCJMPM.JobStatus AS [JobStatus],
    'Billings' AS [TransType],
    NULL AS [Vendor],
    NULL AS [Employee],
    JCCI.Description AS [TransDesc],
    JCCI.StartMonth AS [Month],
    JCCI.StartMonth AS [ActualDate],
    JCCI.ContractAmt,
    JCCI.BilledAmt,
    JCCI.ReceivedAmt,
    JCCI.CurrentRetainAmt,
    0 AS [ActualCost]
FROM JCCI
JOIN JCJMPM ON JCJMPM.JCCo=JCCI.JCCo AND JCJMPM.Job=JCCI.Contract
WHERE JCCI.JCCo = '1'
UNION ALL
SELECT JCCD.JCCo,JCCD.Job AS [Contract],JCJMPM.Description AS [JobDescription],JCJMPM.JobStatus AS [JobStatus]
, Source AS [TransType], APVM.Name AS [Vendor],JCCD.Employee AS [Employee]
,CASE WHEN Source = 'PR Entry' THEN (PREH.FirstName+' '+PREH.LastName) ELSE JCCD.Description END AS [TransDesc]
,Mth AS [Month],JCCD.ActualDate AS [ActualDate],0 AS [ContractAmt]
, 0 AS [BilledAmt] , 0 AS [ReceivedAmt], 0 AS [CurrentRetainAmt], JCCD.ActualCost
FROM dbo.JCCD
JOIN JCJMPM ON JCJMPM.JCCo=JCCD.JCCo AND JCJMPM.Job=JCCD.Job
LEFT JOIN APVM ON APVM.VendorGroup=JCCD.JCCo AND APVM.Vendor=JCCD.Vendor
LEFT JOIN PREH ON PREH.PRCo=JCCD.JCCo AND PREH.Employee=JCCD.Employee
WHERE JCCD.JCCo = '1' AND JCCD.ActualCost <> '0';

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Summarizes job revenue and cost data by job company, contract, and job description, aggregating contract amount, billed amount, received amount, current retainage, and actual costs. Calculates percent
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view JobTransRevCostSum
output:
SELECT
    [JCCo],
    [Contract],
    [JobDescription],
    sum([ContractAmt]) AS [ContractAmt],
    sum([BilledAmt]) AS [BilledAmt],
    sum([ReceivedAmt]) AS [ReceivedAmt],
    sum([CurrentRetainAmt]) AS [CurrentRetainAmt],
    sum([ActualCost]) AS [ActualCost],
    CASE WHEN sum([ContractAmt]) <>0 THEN (sum([BilledAmt]) / sum([ContractAmt]))*100 ELSE '0' END AS [PercBilled],
    CASE WHEN sum([ReceivedAmt]) <>0 THEN (sum([ReceivedAmt]) / sum([ContractAmt])) * 100 ELSE '0' END AS [PercReceived],
    CASE WHEN sum([ContractAmt]) - sum([ActualCost]) > 0 THEN sum([ContractAmt]) - sum([ActualCost]) ELSE 0 END AS [ContractLessCost]
FROM [dbo].[JobTransRevCost]
GROUP BY [JCCo]
    ,[Contract]
    ,[JobDescription];

instruction: Write a SQL query to: Grid view of material sales invoice transactions, pulling batch headers, invoice details, company defaults, and transaction totals. Calculates adjusted invoice totals for AU/CA countries with intercom
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view MSIDGrid
output:
SELECT
    TOP 100 percent MSID.Co,
    MSID.Mth,
    MSID.BatchId,
    MSID.BatchSeq,
    MSID.MSTrans,
    MSID.Ticket,
    MSID.CustJob,
    MSID.CustPO,
    MSID.SaleDate,
    'Date' = MSTD.SaleDate,
    MSID.FromLoc,
    'Location' = MSTD.FromLoc,
    MSID.MatlGroup,
    MSID.Material,
    MSID.UM,
    MSTD.MatlUnits,
    MSID.UnitPrice,
    MSTD.ECM,
    MSTD.HaulTotal,
    MSTD.TaxTotal,
    'Total' = CASE WHEN HQCO.DefaultCountry IN ('AU','CA') AND MSIB.InterCoInv = 'Y'
    THEN isnull(MSTD.MatlTotal,0) + isnull(MSTD.HaulTotal,0) + isnull(MSTD.TaxTotal,0) + ISNULL(MSTD.HaulPayTaxAmt,0)
    ELSE isnull(MSTD.MatlTotal,0) + isnull(MSTD.HaulTotal,0) + isnull(MSTD.TaxTotal,0)
    END,
    'Discount' = isnull(MSTD.DiscOff,0) + isnull(MSTD.TaxDisc,0),
    MSTD.HaulPayTaxAmt
FROM dbo.MSID WITH (nolock)
JOIN dbo.MSIB WITH (NOLOCK) ON MSIB.Co = MSID.Co AND MSIB.Mth = MSID.Mth AND MSIB.BatchId = MSID.BatchId AND MSIB.BatchSeq = MSID.BatchSeq
JOIN dbo.HQCO WITH (NOLOCK) ON HQCO.HQCo = MSID.Co
JOIN dbo.MSTD WITH (nolock) ON MSTD.MSCo = MSID.Co AND MSTD.Mth = MSID.Mth AND MSTD.MSTrans = MSID.MSTrans
ORDER BY MSID.Co, MSID.Mth, MSID.BatchId, MSID.BatchSeq, MSID.MSTrans;

instruction: Write a SQL query to: This view augments MS Quote Detail records with the project company code (JCCo) and project number (Job) from the matching MS Quote Header, plus the latest interface date from PMMF for quote lines mat
input: Context: Viewpoint Vista database, view MSQDPM
output:
SELECT MSQD.*, 'PMCo' = (SELECT JCCo
FROM MSQH WITH (nolock)
WHERE MSQH.MSCo=MSQD.MSCo AND MSQH.Quote=MSQD.Quote),
    'Project' = (SELECT Job
FROM MSQH WITH (nolock)
WHERE MSQH.MSCo=MSQD.MSCo AND MSQH.Quote=MSQD.Quote),
    'InterfaceDate' = (SELECT max(PMMF.InterfaceDate)
FROM PMMF WITH (nolock)
WHERE PMMF.MSCo=MSQD.MSCo
    AND PMMF.Quote=MSQD.Quote AND PMMF.Location=MSQD.FromLoc AND PMMF.MaterialCode=MSQD.Material
    AND PMMF.UM=MSQD.UM AND PMMF.Phase=isnull(MSQD.Phase,PMMF.Phase))
FROM dbo.MSQD;
